Alphabetical list of all APIs new in this release

bcm_bfd_endpoint_stat_get   Get BFD endpoint stats
bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_set   Set/Get config for the given priority for the PFC Deadlock feature
bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_get   Set/Get config for the given priority for the PFC Deadlock feature
bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_t_init   Initialize a COSq PFC deadlock config structure.
bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_info_get   Get bitmap of Enabled(Admin) and Current Deadlock ports status
bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_info_t_init   Initialize a COSq PFC deadlock info structure.
bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_t_init   Initialize a COSq PFC deadlock queue config structure.
bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_status_get   Get the current Deadlock status for the given UC Queue Gport.
bcm_field_qualify_L2PayLoad   Add match criteria for bcmFieldQualifyL2PayLoad qualifier in the field entry.
bcm_field_qualify_L2PayLoad_get   Get match criteria for bcmFieildQualifyL2PayLoad qualifier from the field entry.
bcm_field_qualify_XXX   Add a qualification to a field entry
bcm_field_qualify_XXX_get   Get a qualification match criteria from a field entry
bcm_l3_ecmp_agm_attach   Attach already created monitor entry to a L3 ECMP.
bcm_l3_ecmp_agm_attach_get   Retrieve a monitor id attached to a L3 ECMP group.
bcm_l3_ecmp_agm_detach   Detach a monitor entry from a L3 ECMP group
bcm_multicast_egress_subscriber_qos_map_get   Get the replication queue offset profile index associated to multicast group's subscriber queue replication list.
bcm_multicast_egress_subscriber_qos_map_set   Assign a replication queue offset profile index to multicast group's subscriber queue replication list.
bcm_port_ingress_tdm_failover_get   Get the list of enabled TDM ports.
bcm_port_ingress_tdm_failover_set   Set the list of enabled TDM ports.
bcm_range_config_t_init   To initialize all members in bcm_range_config_t structure to default values.
bcm_range_create   Create a Range checker
bcm_range_destroy   Destroy the range object
bcm_range_get   Fetches the Range object created in the system
bcm_range_oper_mode_get   Get Operational mode of Range module
bcm_range_oper_mode_set   Set Operational mode for Range Module
bcm_range_traverse   Traverse all the valid range id's in the system, calling a specified callback function for each one
bcm_sat_gtf_packet_start   Start gtf packet generation.
bcm_sat_gtf_packet_stop   Stop gtf packet generation.
bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_range_set   Set A range of LIF IDs.
bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_range_get   Set A range of LIF IDs.
bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_set   Creates a {counting_source, counting_mask} to lif_stack_level mapping. For Issuing a counter command with the the LIF in lif_stack_id_to_count in the packet LIF stack.
bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_get   Creates a {counting_source, counting_mask} to lif_stack_level mapping. For Issuing a counter command with the the LIF in lif_stack_id_to_count in the packet LIF stack.
bcm_switch_agm_create   Creates an aggregation monitoring entry.
bcm_switch_agm_destroy   Destroy an existing aggregation monitoring entry.
bcm_switch_agm_enable_get   Return a monitor entry's enable status.
bcm_switch_agm_enable_set   Enable or disable the aggregation group monitoring on a given entry.
bcm_switch_agm_get   Retrieve an aggregation group id on which the monitor entry is attached.
bcm_switch_agm_info_t_init   Initialize a bcm_switch_agm_info_t structure.
bcm_switch_agm_l3_ecmp_attach_get   Retrieve a l3 ecmp group id where the monitor entry is attached.
bcm_switch_agm_stat_clear   Clear stats of counter entries attached to the aggregation monitor (id).
bcm_switch_agm_stat_get   Retrieve bandwidth and packet distribution information that were collected via aggregation group monitoring.
bcm_switch_agm_stat_t_init   Initialize a bcm_switch_agm_stat_t structure.
bcm_switch_agm_traverse   Traverse all aggregation monitor entries and call callback function for each allocated entry.
bcm_switch_agm_trunk_attach_get   Retrieve a (fabric) trunk_id where the monitor entry is attached.
bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_add   Set/Replace MAC address assigned to Offload Processor connecting port.
bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_delete   Delete OLP MAC address.
bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_delete_all   Delete all previously configured OLP mac addresses.
bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_get   Get MAC address assigned to Offload Processor connecting port.
bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t_init   Initialize a bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t structure.
bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_traverse   Traverse previously configured OLP MAC addresses and call callback function for each valid OLP MAC.
bcm_time_synce_clock_get   Get current syncE input divisor settings
bcm_time_synce_clock_set   Set syncE clock output frequency beased on the input divisor settings.
bcm_time_synce_divisor_setting_t_init   Initialize bcm_time_synce_divisor_setting_t structure.
bcm_trunk_agm_attach   Attach already created monitor entry to a trunk or a fabric trunk.
bcm_trunk_agm_attach_get   Retrieve a monitor id attached to a (fabric) trunk.
bcm_trunk_agm_detach   Detach a monitor entry from a trunk or a fabric trunk
bcm_udf_oper_mode_get   get UDF operation mode
bcm_udf_oper_mode_set   Set UDF operation mode




Section 1: About This Document

These are the Release Notes for the Broadcom Network Switching Software Development Kit Release 6.4.6.

This document provides a general description of the release and its new features. It also describes the chips supported by the release, BCM API additions or changes, resolved issues, and any relevant open issues.



Section 2: Product Documentation

The following documents are available through Broadcom's Customer Support Portal, http://support.broadcom.com. They are the primary source of information and should be referenced when using this release:

Table 1: Product Documentation

Document Description
56XX-PG646-R BCM API Reference Guide.

This manual describes the theory of operations of the API and all existing BCM APIs for this release.

56XX-PG707-R Stacking Software Guide

This guide describes how to use the discovery and stacking applications provided in this release.

56XX-PG818-R Platform Guide

This guide describes the SDK source and Makefile structure, abstraction and porting layers, device specific interactions, and the platform/operating system specific features of the SDK. If this is your first time working with the SDK, start with this document.





Section 3: New in this Release

This section describes feature and device support that is introduced in this release.

Section 3.1: Summary of New Features


Section 3.1.1: BCM56960 Updates

BCM56960 family is industry's First High-Density 25/100 Gigabit Ethernet Switch for Cloud-Scale Networks. The switch offers 32 100GbE, 128 25GbE ports. This release contains enhanced Early Access bring up support for BCM56960 A0.

This release supports the following device configurations.

BCM56960 A0: 32x100G, 128x10G, 128x25G, 28x100G_4x106G, 32x40G, 64xd40G

Section 3.1.1.1: New Features in this Release

Flex Port Support- Encap modes:

This release adds support for transformations between Ethernet and HiGig2 encapsulations and port speeds.

Flex stats support for VFP per pipe:

VLAN Field Processor (VFP) module makes use of Flex Stats infrastructure, to setup packet counters. Since Tomahawk VFP supports per-pipe rules, Flex stats infrastructure has been enhanced to allow per-pipe counters to be setup by VFP software module, starting this release.

Aggregation Monitor:

Aggregation Monitor helps evaluate forwarding group (ECMP, Trunk or HG Trunk) member selection. This release adds a set of counters, incremented by monitor, that show whether all members are treated equally, fairly loaded and whether there are any bandwidth anomalies.

Headroom Monitoring and Management:

In addition to the same Ingress Admission Control capabilities available in previous devices (Trident, Trident2), Tomahawk adds the ability to manage the headroom space as a reserved buffer space, as a shared resource. Using the new facilities provided in this release, customer software can decide to monitor the maximum buffer usage of the headroom pool and/or to optimize its size based on the actual, real world network traffic.

PFC Deadlock Detection and Recovery:

Automatic detection and recovery of queues from PFC deadlock condition.

ALPM Performance Improvements:

ALPM performance is improved by around 15% as compared to the previous release.

BCM56961 SKU:

This release adds bring-up support for BCM56961 employing a 64x40G port configuration. The primary difference between BCM56961 and the base SKU (BCM56960), is that the only supported port speeds on BCM56961 are 10G, 20G and 40G and their corresponding HiGig2 counterparts.

Preview Support for Revision B0

Additional Field Processor Features:

Exact Match:

Tomahawk support separate hash based exact match lookup in IFP. This is supported using the existing field API. New stage is added in field API for supporting this feature. This feature does not support per entry mask hence key must exactly match the key stored in table. Exact Match supports pre-selection as in IFP. Qualifier support in exact match is a subset of qualifier support in IFP. Exact Match entry contains both the key and policy in same table. This feature supports three UFT entry views in which every view contain different sizeof key and policy data. Action resolution of exact match lookup happens along with IFP action resolution, hence logical table space is shared between IFP and Exact Match. It can be used in parallel or chained with IFP based on user requirements.

Per Pipe VFP/EFP:

Tomahawk supports per-pipe mode for VFP and EFP. This feature enables rules to be configured per pipe.

User has to pass the port bit map during group creation and rules gets configured only in the pipe which the port belongs.

API used to configure the group in per-pipe: "int bcm_field_group_config_create(int unit, bcm_field_group_config_t *group_config);"

"ports" bitmap field in bcm_field_group_config_t structure has to be set for all the ports belongs to a specific pipe.

UDF Per Pipe operation:

From this release, per-pipe udf configuration is enabled on tomahawk. Port bitmap is added to bcm_udf_t data structure to inform a pipe line the udf needs to be configured.

Note: all ports in port bitmap must belong to single ingress pipe.

EFP New Qualifiers:

This release supports the new qualifiers introduced in tomahawk hardware.

Around 35 new qualifiers are added to qualify the fields in HIGIG header.

Around 7 new qualifiers are added to qualify the fields in Loopback Header.

A new qualifier is added to qualify the Bytes after L2 PayLoad

Range Checkers:

TD2 supports range checking capabilities for VLAN IDs, IP L4 ports and the packet length. TH leverages these capabilities and adds an extension to perform a range check on a user defined field extracted through the UDF framework.

There are a total of 32 total range checkers for the following fields:

  • VLAN ID
  • L4 Sport
  • L4 Dport
  • IP Packet Length
  • UDF1 Chunk 2 (bits 47:32 of UDF1)
Existing field range check APIs(bcm_field_range_XXX) does not scale up to support new fields in Range Check.

A new set of APIs is proposed to configure Range Checkers. Range checkers can be configured in Global as well as PerPipe Modes using the new range api¡Çs in Tomahawk.

IFP New Qualifiers:

This release supports the new qualifiers introduced in tomahawk hardware. Details of the new qualifiers are mentioned in API document.

bcmFieldQualifyInPorts Support in Legacy Mode:

This release supports bcmFieldQualifyInPorts in global mode. Here the SDK internally programs the IFP in per-pipe mode and rules are programmed in pipe corresponding to the port bit map passed during group creation.

Enhanced FP Warmboot:

Warmboot support has been added for pre-selection, compression and exact match features.

This feature restores the software data structures from the scache and hardware tables. In tomahawk majority of the datastructures are restored from the scache. The total scache required for IFP in worst case configuration is around 36 MB.

Section 3.1.1.3: Features Not Yet Supported

The following features are not yet supported.

Table 3: Features Not Supported in this Release

Feature Release with Support

Flex Stats for Exact Match SDK 6.4.7


Section 3.1.2: BCM56860 Updates

The BCM56860 family of switches is aimed specifically at the cloud DC market, ToR and spine. The switch offers up to 104 x 10GbE, up to 32 x 40 GbE or up to 8 x 100 GbE ports. The faster member of the family provides up 1.28Tbps of Ethernet switching in oversub mode or 960G in line rate mode.

Section 3.1.2.1: New Features Added

BCM56833 SKU:

Bring-up support has been added for this device derivative. This table defines the main differences between this SKU and the base SKU BCM56860

Table 4: BCM56833 SKU

Features BCM56833 BCM56860
Max Frequency 537MHz 790MHz
Core Bandwidth 640G 960G
Packet Buffer Size 12MB 16MB
ICAP 4K 16K
Cut Through No Yes
VXLAN No Yes
L2 GRE No Yes
NAPT (Network Address Port Translation) No Yes
FCoE No Yes
TRILL No Yes
RioT No Yes
CMAC Enable All Disabled All Enabled
Other features Same Same

BCM56861 SKU:

Bring-up support has been added for this device derivative. This table defines the main differences between this SKU and the base SKU BCM56860

Table 5: BCM56861 SKU

Features BCM56861 BCM56860
Max Frequency 635MHz 790MHz
Core Bandwidth 720G 960G
CMAC Enable All Disabled All Enabled
Other features Same Same

Hierarchical ECMP Support:

Hierarchical ECMP allows configuring 2 levels of ECMP groups, the first for overlay networks and the second of underlay networks. This permits efficient use of the ECMP member table for path selection.

In Hierarchical or multi-level ECMP, the first level ECMP resolution may result in either a next_hop or another ECMP group for an underlay network. If it results in an ECMP group, the second level ECMP resolution resolves to a next_hop.

Warmboot Support:

In Trident2Plus, the software data structures are saved into the scache during the Warmboot sync. When the SDK boots in the Warmboot mode, it recovers the data structures from scache and initializes the structures. The scache size is calculated based on the total size of various data structures, considering the max value of every field in the data structure.

The total scache required for all modules together is 2993512 bytes.

Flex Port Support:

The following port transformations have been verified to be functional in the Line Rate mode with the internal SERDES and the legacy APIs,

  • 1x40G <-> 4x10G

RioT Provider Backbone Bridging SDK 6.4.8

Section 3.1.3: BCM56260 Updates

The BCM56260 family of switches is aimed specifically at the cost/power sensitive Carrier Ethernet Access (EAD/NID), Microwave backhaul, Compact PTN and Compact Cell-site-Router markets. The switch offers 12x2.5G + 2x10G SerDes with support for 10M/100M/1000M, 2.5G and 10G-XAUI Ethernet speeds on Front panel Viper SerDes and 10M/100M/1000M, 2.5G, 10G-XAUI and 10G Serial Ethernet speeds on Uplink Eagle SerDes ports. The switch provides 50Gbps of Ethernet switching.

The NEON/VPF feature is enabled in B0 SKUs as default.

Section 3.1.3.1: Additional Features Supported

BCM56461 SKU

Bring-up support has been added for this device derivative. This table defines the main adifferences between this SKU and the base SKU BCM56460.

Table 8: BCM56461 SKU

Features BCM56461 BCM56460
NEON+VFP functionality in ARM A9 core Not enabled enabled
iHost CPU support No yes

BCM56268 SKU

Bring-up support has been added for this device derivative. This table defines the main differences between this SKU and the base SKU BCM56260.

Table 9: BCM56268 SKU

Features BCM56268 BCM56260
NEON+VFP functionality in ARM A9 core Not enabled enabled
Ext pkt buf No Yes
Port configs/ max throughput 12x2.5G+2x10G/HGs11(52Gbps) 16xGE(16 gbps)
Flex port No Yes

BCM56465 SKU

Bring-up support has been added for this device derivative. This table defines the main differences between this SKU and the base SKU BCM56460

Table 10: BCM56465 SKU

Features BCM56465 BCM56460
NEON+VFP functionality in ARM A9 core Not enabled enabled

Section 3.1.4: BCM88670-Family Limited General Availiability (LGA) Release

This release is an LGA version for the BCM88370-Family and BCM88670-Family product lines. Compared to 6.4.5 Beta version, the 6.4.6 release delivers increased feature coverage as well as higher maturity for the supported features.

The subsequent sections describe the increment in available features compared to 6.4.5, major bug-fixes and known issues.

Section 3.1.4.1: Important notes

6.4.6 Release is aligned with KBP-SDK 1.3.8 for external TCAM and KAPS. Scheduled WarmBoot is not supported.


Section 3.1.4.2: Validated Features

Basic data path, connectivity and Traffic Management features

  • Performance tuning: support 720G traffic rate
  • Source based ingress congestion management
  • Interrupts:
    • Per event specific handling
    • Interrupt modes: polling, IRQ
  • RCPU support (access-level)
  • CRPS: add Counter processor API for multiple LIFs for specific packet in ingress/egress pipe.
  • SGMII support over Falcon PHY:
    • PHY loopback isn't yet supported.
  • Higig Support (excluding higig flow control)
  • External PHY infrastructure:
    • Serves as bases for per-PHY interoperability validation
  • Linkscan
  • Oversubscribtion tuning: default egress CGM theashods updated
  • Metering is now fully functional (compatible to ARAD+ and fully validated for dual-core support)

Packet Processing:

  • MIM is now fully functional
  • Additional ROO features:
    • ROO IPV6 forwarding multicast (except of Multicast APIs)
    • ROO over VPLS (Unicast)
    • ROO Linker-layer (Overlay-LL) inner VLAN editing
  • Additional OAM features:
    • MIP traffic snooping while keeping the original system headers

  • Forwarding-Layer and Link-Layer MTU filters


Section 3.1.4.3: Major Bugfixes

The list below refers to major bugfixes, and does not provide a comprehensive coverage of various bugfixes on all levels.

Basic data path, connectivity and Traffic Management features:

  • Fixed diag cosq non empty queues for core 1.

Packet Processing:

  • KAPS core-1 support added
  • IPv6 endian byte swap issues were fixed in bcm_l3_route_add API
  • MPLS termination QOS mappings between EXP to TC,DP are now supported


Section 3.1.5: BCM88770 (FE3600) GA Release

The Broadcom BCM88770 (formerly named BCM88950) is the fourth generation in the Dune product line of Fabric Element (FE) devices.

This is a GA release of BCM88950 driver, with all major features supported.

Section 3.1.5.1: Major Bugfixes

  • Power up/down link dynamically (using APIs bcm_port_probe/bcm_port_detach) was fixed. Additional information can be found in 88770-SDG1xx document (User Manual), section Power Efficiency.
  • Setting multiple mc groups at once (bcm_fabric_multicast_multi_set/get)
    • Additional information can be found in the 88770-SDG1xx document.
  • Legacy support for bcm_fabric_link_control_setwith controls bcmFabricLinkIsSecondaryOnly, link, bcmFabricLinkPrimaryWeight, bcmFabricLinkSecondaryWeight
  • SerDes RX controls: bcm_port_phy_control_setwit controls: BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_RX_PEAK_FILTER, BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_RX_LOW_FREQ_PEAK_FILTER, BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_RX_VGA, BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_RX_TAP# BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_RX_TAP#_RELEASE
  • Added support for custom SerDes TX pattern generation.


Section 3.1.6: BCM88650-Family Release

This release is the continuation of 6.4.5 for the BCM88650-Family and is backward compatible with the 6.3.X features (except Warm-boot).

Section 3.1.6.1: High Availability:

  • Scheduled WarmBoot Is Now Supported.


Section 3.1.6.2: Major Bug fixes

  • VLAN-Port , VXLAN: LIF learning information was incorrect in BCM88660 and on some cases returned error in get/replace APIs.


Section 3.1.7: New External PHY Support


Section 3.1.7.1: BCM82209 Bring-up Support - 28 nm Octal 25G Unidirectional NRZ Retimer. Firmware version D00E

The external PHY Driver supports 100G LR4/KR4, 40G SR4/LR4/KR4, 25G LR and 10G SR/LR. The BCM82209 has been tested with BCM56960.

Section 3.1.7.1.1: Functionality Supported:

  • PHY Reset(Hard/soft), Link status, Speed and Interface configuration, port enable/disable, Polarity inversion, PRBS, Eyescan, DSC, PLL sequencer restart, Phy dump and Rx PMD lock.
  • Mapping of consecutive or non-consecutive BCM56960 physical ports with either Tx simplex PHY or Rx simplex PHY is supported.
  • A simplex PHY can be configured either as Tx PHY or Rx PHY using the config property "port_phy_mode_reverse" based on whether the PHY is connected in Tx path or Rx path of the switch port. (0 - Rx PHY (default), 1 - Tx PHY)
  • Different lane map can be assigned to different BCM56960 ports. This is achieved using the config property "port_phy_lane_mask"


Section 3.1.7.1.2: Limitations

Chip reset issues reset to all the ports that shares same PHY-ID(MDIO ADDR). All the ports that shares same PHY-ID(MDIO ADDR) must be configured with same speed and interface


Section 3.1.7.2: BCM84864/84868 additional support

SDK 6.4.6 adds support for the following:

  • Support 5G/2.5G speed over XFI mode.
  • Jumbo Frames support.
  • MDI Pair Swapping.
  • Enhanced Cable Diag.
  • Manufacturing (MFG) tests support.


Section 3.1.7.3: BCM82780 additional support

Added support for:

  • Setting analog parameters for TX and RX in 40G and 10G
  • Support Auto negotiation on 40G CR4/KR4 and 10G KR
  • Support repeater and retime mode configuration
Limitation:
  • Force Tx training is not supported.
  • Accessing system side of PHY is not supported i.e. GPORT macro supports is not added.


Section 3.2: Things to note

This section lists items that require special attention.

Section 3.2.1: Slight deviation of the traffic distribution accuracy on Trident2 Plus

Trident2+ customers may see some slight deviations with the accuracy of traffic distribution in MMU. The amount of deviation is less than 1%, and depends on the packet size and traffic conditions. The issue will remain intermittent until Broadcom completes internal verification and tuning of MMU parameters as a part of Trident2+ PRA preparation. Once optimized MMU settings become available, they will be integrated into a future SDK release


Section 3.2.2: Minimum VxLAN vpn ID for Trident2 Plus and Tomahawk

VPN ID 0x7000 is allowed when calling bcm_vxlan_vpn_create with BCM_VXLAN_PORT_WITH_ID on BCM56850. It is not allowed for BCM56860 and BCM56960 due to VPN ID 0x7000 is reserved on those devices.


Section 3.2.3: Scache Size Requirements for Tomahawk

In Tomahawk the field related software data structures is saved into the s-cache and software recovers and link them back after warm boot. The s-cache size needs to be increased to save all the data structures available in field module. Software depends only on the saved data for the recovery of IFP configurations after warm boot in tomahawk.

The size of the s-cache will change with the configurations used in IFP. Below is the memory requirement for 3 different configurations.

128 groups with 50 qualifiers per group, 24K entries, 5 actions per entry ~33 MB

128 groups with 50 qualifiers per group, 24K entries, 10 actions per entry ~37 MB

128 groups with 50 qualifiers per group, 24K entries, 15 actions per entry ~42 MB


Section 3.2.4: Scache Size Requirements for devices in legacy IFP support

In warmboot design, the software data structures are saved into the sCache during warmboot sync. When the SDK boots in warmboot mode, it recovers the data structures from sCache and initializes the structures. The sCache size is calculated based on total size of various data structures, considering the max value of every field in the data structure.

In Saber2, the total scache required for all modules together is 573408 bytes

In Greyhound, the total scache required for all modules together is 380188 bytes


Section 3.2.5: BCMX API deprecation

BCMX APIs have not been enhanced or supported for newer devices since SDK-5.10.2. Legacy BCMX APIs, supported in SDK-5.10.2 will be deprecated starting with SDK-6.3.5 release. Customers are encouraged to transition from BCMX APIs to their equivalent BCM APIs.

Please contact Broadcom application support for any help in the transition.


Section 3.2.6: spn_PHY_PORT_PRIMARY_AND_OFFSET

Setting of the config property spn_PHY_PORT_PRIMARY_AND_OFFSET is absolutely required for the following PHYs.

BCM54880E BCM54680E BCM54682E BCM54685E BCM54640E BCM542XX


Section 3.2.7: IP Route Lookup

If a packet destination IP lookup falls in between 2 route prefixes having a common prefix part and differing lengths, then the lower route prefix, which is the correct match, may not always be returned correctly.


Section 3.2.8: BCM Field Qualifier Tunnel Type

The enumeration type bcm_field_TunnelType_t has changed its values between SDK-6.2.x, SDK-6.3.0 and SDK-6.3.1.

The implication is that legacy field qualifier support for bcm_field_qualify_TunnelType in XGS devices running SDK-6.3.1 and later has been broken.

Features such as RPC between systems running SDK-6.2.x or SDK-6.3.0 on one and SDK-6.3.1 (or later) on another will not work properly for the BCM field qualifier tunnel type.

This issue is being addressed in SDK-6.3.5, SDK-6.4.0, and later releases.


Section 3.2.9: WarmBoot: Validated warmboot upgrades.

Following warmboot upgrades have been validated in this release.

Table 13: Validated Warmboot upgrades

Software upgrade Supported
6.4.5 to 6.4.6 Yes
6.3.12 to 6.4.6 Yes

Warmboot testing and issue resolution has focused on the following family of devices:

  • Trident2
  • Trident+
  • Triumph3
  • Katana2
  • Helix4
  • Hurrican2
  • Katana
  • Raven
  • Greyhound
  • Tomahawk - Upgrade testing still in progress
  • Saber 2
  • Trident2+ - Upgrade testing still in progress


Section 3.2.10: COSq Warmboot

The scache file which is used to store software data related to Cosq during level-2 warmboot for TR3 and related SKUs has a different data structure between 6.3.x releases and 6.4.x releases. However, the data structure difference cannot be distinguished, because they are marked with the same warmboot version number.

If level-2 warmboot is used to upgrade from release 6.3.3 and later to release 6.4.x, the Cosq module will be restored with incorrect data.


Section 3.2.11: New Spinlock APIs

In the SDK release v6.3.8/SDK 6.4.1 a new lock mechanism -- spinlock was introduced to satisfy some requirements for protecting small critical sections more efficiently. The spinlock mechanism is applicable to the scenario in which the critical section to be protected only contains simple operations, such as inserting or removing nodes from a linked list, increasing or decreasing shared data. The data structure and interfaces of the spinlock are defined at SAL layer in SDK as follows, 

	typedef struct sal_spinlock_s {
	    char spinlock_opaque_type;
	} *sal_spinlock_t;

	sal_spinlock_t sal_spinlock_create(char *desc);
	int sal_spinlock_destroy(sal_spinlock_t lock);
	int sal_spinlock_lock(sal_spinlock_t lock);
	int sal_spinlock_unlock(sal_spinlock_t lock);
These primitives have been implemented for vxWorks and Linux. The changes are available in src/sal/core/linux/sync.c for Linux kernel mode, src/sal/core/unix/sync.c for Linux user mode and src/sal/core/vxworks/sync.c for vxWorks. Customers who use different OSes will need to make similar implementation in their OS specific SAL layer source files. If additional information is needed, please refer to the field alert document "Spinlock Application Note" or contact your Field Support staff.


Section 3.2.12: BCM56440 Family of Devices

TCAMs in BCM56440 family of chips were not included in the MEMSCAN until this (SDK-6.4.4)release. Due to a customer request, the SER for this family of chips is enhanced in this release to include protection for the TCAMs. Given the way the parity enable controls are configured in different releases, upgrading from previous releases to this releases would generate false memory error reports on the TCAM memories.

As a remedy, users can disable parity or/and memscan on the TCAM memories using the relevant configuration properties which will be equivalent to what previous releases used to offer for these devices. Error recovery on the TCAMs can be enabled by doing a cold reset of the system. If SER on the TCAMs is desired right after the upgrade, users may need to patch the changes from SDK-55917 on to previous releases.


Section 3.3: New Devices and Systems

For any given SDK release, support for certain devices may be provided in Preview or Supported status. Devices in preview status are provided to allow early integration of the customer's application with the SDK APIs that support that device. This software has not been tested on the physical target device and should not be expected to fully function.

Devices in "Supported" status have completed the full QA process and are intended for use in production systems. It is expected that customers would integrate the version of the SDK which provides "Supported" status for their use on actual development or production systems.

Table 14: Supported Switch Devices

Family Devices Description
BCM56060 BCM56063 A0 4 x QSGMII, 4 x 1G/2.5G/5G/10G (XFI)
BCM56064 A0 4 x QSGMII, 8 x 1GbE, 4 x 10GbE (option1)
BCM56064 A0 4 x QSGMII, 8 x 1GbE, 2 x 10Gbe, 2 x HiGigDuo[13] (option2)

Section 3.4: Summary of BCM changes

This section summarizes BCM API changes in this release. Complete documentation is available in the Network Switching Software Programmer's Guide 56XX-PG646-R. (See section 2 earlier in this document for availability).

Section 3.4.1: BCM Fundamentals

A new module BCM_MODULE_RANGE has been added in this release

The BCM APIs are classified into API groups called 'modules'. The following table lists the BCM modules and their string equivalents.

Table 20: BCM Module IDs

BCM Module ID String Equivalent
BCM_MODULE_PORT port
BCM_MODULE_L2 l2
BCM_MODULE_VLAN vlan

BCM_MODULE_MCAST mcast
BCM_MODULE_LINKSCAN linkscan
BCM_MODULE_STAT stat
BCM_MODULE_VIRTUAL virtual
BCM_MODULE_COMMON common
BCM_MODULE_MIRROR mirror
BCM_MODULE_L3 l3
BCM_MODULE_STACK stack
BCM_MODULE_IPMC ipmc
BCM_MODULE_STG stg
BCM_MODULE_TX tx
BCM_MODULE_L2GRE l2gre
BCM_MODULE_AUTH auth

BCM_MODULE_TIME time

BCM_MODULE_FABRIC fabric
BCM_MODULE_MIM mim

BCM_MODULE_OOB oob
BCM_MODULE_RANGE range (New)


Section 3.4.2: Bidirectional Forwarding Detection

New BFD packet statistic options are added.

Table 21: BFD packet statistic options.

Options Description
BCM_BFD_ENDPOINT_STAT_CLEAR Clear statistics.
BCM_BFD_ENDPOINT_STAT_64BIT Get 64bit statistics.

New fields are added in bcm_bfd_endpoint_stat_t in regard to the extension of 64-bit support. The BFD Statistics structure is used for retrieving counters for a BFD session. 

	typedef struct bcm_bfd_endpoint_stat_s {
           ...
	   uint64 packets_in_64;           /* Total packets in 64bit count. */
	   uint64 packets_out_64;          /* Total packets out 64bit count. */
	   uint64 packets_drop_64;         /* Total packets drop 64bit count. */
	   uint64 packets_auth_drop_64;    /* Packets drop due to authentication
                                              failure 64bit count. */
	} bcm_bfd_endpoint_stat_t;

The last parameter of bcm_bfd_endpoint_stat_get() API is changed from "uint8 clear" to "unit32 options".

APIs for Section 3.4.2: Bidirectional Forwarding Detection

bcm_bfd_endpoint_stat_get

Get BFD endpoint stats

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/bfd.h>
	int 
	bcm_bfd_endpoint_stat_get(
	    int unit, 
	    bcm_bfd_endpoint_t endpoint, 
	    bcm_bfd_endpoint_stat_t *ctr_info, 
	    uint32 options);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
endpoint   (IN) The ID of the endpoint object to get counts for
ctr_info   (IN/OUT) Pointer to endpoint stat structure to receive the data
clear   (IN) If set, clear counts after read

DESCRIPTION

Retrieve counter information for the specified endpoint. If clear is set the counters will be cleared after reading.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Operation completed successfully
BCM_E_PARAM   Null pointer to counter information structure
BCM_E_MEMORY   Unable to allocate memory
BCM_E_INTERNAL   Unable to obtain/release resource lock / Failed to read or write resource

Section 3.4.3: Class of Service Queue Configuration

New BCM COSQ DELAY TOLERANCE Configuration are added in this release for bcm_cosq_delay_tolerance_level_set() and bcm_cosq_delay_tolerance_level_get() APIs.

Table 22: BCM COSQ DELAY TOLERANCE Configuration

Parameter / Description
credit_request_satisfied_backslow_enter_thresh - Hysteresis value for to the Backslow Enter. Resolution in bytes. Range: 0 491520. Resolution: 1 Byte.
credit_request_satisfied_backslow_exit_thresh - Hysteresis value for to the Backslow Exit. Resolution in bytes. Range: 0 491520. Resolution: 1 Byte.

New CosQ range types are added in this release for APIs bcm_cosq_control_range_set() and bcm_cosq_control_range_get().

Table 23: Range configuration type.

New Range typs Description
bcmCosqStatIfQueues A range of queues that produce statistics reports when working in queue size mode.
bcmCosqStatIfScrubberQueues A range of queues that produce statistics scrubber reports when working in queue size mode.

The field names of PFC class and SAFC class in data structures bcm_cosq_pfc_class_mapping_t and bcm_cosq_safc_class_mapping_t repsectively have been changed from class to class_id. 

	#define BCM_COSQ_PFC_GPORT_COUNT    16

	/* PFC class to COSq / scheduling node mapping structure. */
	typedef struct bcm_cosq_pfc_class_mapping_s {
	    int class_id;                          /* PFC class. */
	    bcm_gport_t gport_list[BCM_COSQ_PFC_GPORT_COUNT]; /* mapped COSqs, -1 for no mapping. */
	} bcm_cosq_pfc_class_mapping_t;

	#define BCM_COSQ_SAFC_GPORT_COUNT   20

	/* SAFC class to COSq / scheduling node mapping structure. */
	typedef struct bcm_cosq_safc_class_mapping_s {
	    int class_id;                          /* SAFC class. */
	    bcm_gport_t gport_list[BCM_COSQ_SAFC_GPORT_COUNT]; /* mapped COSqs, -1 for no mapping. */
	} bcm_cosq_safc_class_mapping_t;

New COSQ control types are added for bcm_cosq_control_set() and bcm_cosq_control_get() APIs.

Table 24: CoSQ Control Type Values

Value Description Arg value
bcmCosqControlIngressPoolLimitBytes Ingress Shared Service Pool limit setting. number of bytes
bcmCosqControlIngressHeadroomPoolLimitBytes Ingress Headroom Pool limit setting. number of bytes
bcmCosqControlIngressHeadroomPool Ingress Headroom Pool selection. value, 0-3

New BST COSQ ID bcmBstStatIdHeadroomPool is add for bcm_cosq_bst_profile_set() and bcm_cosq_bst_profile_get() APIs.

Table 25: New BCM BST CoSQ IDs

flag Description
bcmBstStatIdHeadroomPool Headroom pool

New COSQ APIs are added in this release. 

	typedef struct bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_s {
	    uint32 detection_timer; /* PFC Deadlock Detection Timer. */
	    uint32 recovery_timer;  /* PFC Deadlock Recovery Timer. */
	} bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_t;
	@code


	@api
	bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_set
	bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_get

	@brief Set/Get Config status for the given UC Queue Gport for the PFC Deadlock feature

	@synopsis
	#include <bcm/cosq.h>
	int bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_set(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_gport_t gport,
	    bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_t *q_config);
	int bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_gport_t gport,
	    bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_t *q_config);

	@param=unit             BCM device number
	@param=gport(IN)        UC Queue GPORT ID
	@param=config(IN/OUT)   Config struture for given UC Queue Gport

	@desc
	Configure(set) or Get the Enable status for a given UC queue gport.
	enable - Indicates if the UC Queue gport's enabled status(IN(set)/OUT(get)) for PFC Deadlock
	feature monitoring

	@returns
	@returnval=BCM_E_NONE
	@returnval=BCM_E_XXX

	@endapi

	@code
	typedef struct bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_s {
	    int enable; /* PFC Deadlock config for a Queue. */
	} bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_t;

	typedef struct bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_info_s {
	    bcm_pbmp_t enabled_pbmp;    /* Bitmap of ports enabled for a given priority. */
	    bcm_pbmp_t deadlock_pbmp;   /* Bitmap of ports currently in deadlock status
					   for a given priority. */
	} bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_info_t;

APIs for Section 3.4.3: Class of Service Queue Configuration

bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_t_init

Initialize a COSq PFC deadlock config structure.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/cosq.h>
	void bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_t_init(bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_t *config);

PARAMETERS

profile   Pointer to PFC Deadlock configuration structure to initialize.

DESCRIPTION

Initialize a COSq PFC deadlock config structure.

RETURNS

None.

bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_t_init

Initialize a COSq PFC deadlock queue config structure.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/cosq.h>
	void bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_t_init(
	    bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_config_t *q_config);

PARAMETERS

profile   Pointer to PFC Deadlock queue configuration structure to initialize.

DESCRIPTION

Initialize a COSq PFC deadlock queue config structure.

RETURNS

None.

bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_info_t_init

Initialize a COSq PFC deadlock info structure.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/cosq.h>
	void bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_info_t_init(
	    bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_info_t *pfc_deadlock_info);

PARAMETERS

profile   Pointer to PFC Deadlock info structure to initialize.

DESCRIPTION

Initialize a COSq PFC deadlock info structure.

RETURNS

None.

bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_set
bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_get

Set/Get config for the given priority for the PFC Deadlock feature

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/cosq.h>
	int bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_set(
	    int unit,
	    int priority,
	    bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_t *config);
	int bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_get(
	    int unit,
	    int priority,
	    bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_config_t *config);

PARAMETERS

unit   BCM device number
priority(IN)   Priority for the given config
config(IN/OUT)   Config struture for given priority

DESCRIPTION

Configure PFC deadlock config structure for a given priority. The config include "detection_timer" and "recovery_timer". detection_timer(IN/OUT) - indicates the time for Hardware to monitor a specific Cos queue of a Port. recovery_timer(IN/OUT) - indicates the time for Software to retain the Port's queue in Recovery state

1. Detection: Setup Detection timer. Hardware monitors enabled Port's queues (for configured priority). If enabled Queues remain in XOFF state beyond the deadlock_timer, Hardware declares Deadlock. 2. When Deadlock is detected, Packets can be transmitted ignoring PFC congestion status (Default), or can be configured to be discarded during the deadlockrecovery period using switch control bcmSwitchPFCDeadlockRecoveryAction). 3. Recovery: Software keeps polling for the Deadlock status. When Deadlock is set, Software sets the Action(Ignore PFC Status or Packet discard) 4. Software runs a recovery timer configured by the user/application. On expiry of recovery timer, Sw will have to remove/reset the action.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE  
BCM_E_XXX  

bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_status_get

Get the current Deadlock status for the given UC Queue Gport.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/cosq.h>
	int bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_queue_status_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_gport_t gport,
	    uint8 *deadlock_status);

PARAMETERS

unit   BCM device number
gport(IN)   UC Queue GPORT ID
deadlock_status(OUT)   Deadlock status for the given UC queue gport

DESCRIPTION

Get the current Deadlock status for the given UC Queue Gport.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE  
BCM_E_XXX  

bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_info_get

Get bitmap of Enabled(Admin) and Current Deadlock ports status

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/cosq.h>
	int bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_info_get(
	    int unit,
	    int priority,
	    bcm_cosq_pfc_deadlock_info_t *pfc_deadlock_info);

PARAMETERS

unit   BCM device number
priority(IN)   Priority for the given config
pfc_deadlock_info(OUT)   Info struture for given priority

DESCRIPTION

Get bitmap of Enabled(Admin) and Current Deadlock ports status for a given priority in PFC deadlock feature.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE  
BCM_E_XXX  

Section 3.4.4: Fabric

The Max number of modules used in BCM_FABRIC_MODULE_VEC_GET is now increased to 144. 

        #define BCM_FABRIC_MAX_MULTICAST_MODULES    (144)


Section 3.4.5: Field Processor

New field qualifiers are added in this release as listed.

Table 26: New Field Qualifiers

Qualifier Purpose
bcmFieldQualifyLearnExtension Learn Extension Data.
bcmFieldQualifyIpFragNonOrFirst Non Fragmented IP Packet or First Fragment of IP Packet.
bcmFieldQualifyPacketLength Packet Length Excluding L2 Header(+ Vlan Tag for Tagged packets).
bcmFieldQualifyGroupClass Field Group Class Id (Logical Table Class Id) assigned by pre-selection entry.
bcmFieldQualifyUdfClass Class ID associated to packet on UDF match.
bcmFieldQualifyInterfaceLookupClassPort VFP Port Class Id that can be matched in Ingress Filter Processor.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigDstMulticast Indicates if the HiGig Destination is a Multicast or Unicast.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigDstMulticastGroupId Destination Multicast Group Id.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigTrafficClass QOS provided by Fabric when forwarding the packet through Fabric.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigDstModuleGport Destination Module ID.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigDstPortGport Destination Port.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigDstModPortGport Destination Module ID and Port.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigSrcModuleGport Source Module ID.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigSrcPortGport Source Port.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigSrcModPortGport Source Module ID and Port.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigLoadBalanceID A packet flow hashing index for distribution of packet flows through a multipath fabric.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigColor Indicates Traffic rate violation status of the packet measured by Ingress Module.This can be Green/Yellow/Red
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigIntCongestionNotification Indicates ECN and Transport Protocol Class Information generated by Ingress Module.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigIngressTagged Tagged packet was ingressed at the HiGig Port.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigDstTrunk Is the Destination port is Trunk Port?
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigDstTrunkId Destination HiGig Trunk Group Id.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigIngressL3SwitchPkt Packet is L3 switched at the Source Port
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigLabel 20 Bit Label Present in HiGig Header. Label Type can be QTag/Mirror Classification Tag/System Ingress Port.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigReplicationId Replication ID used to identify Packet modifications to be applied for this replicated copy.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigVlan Vlan tag information in HiGig Header
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigPortFilteringMode Port Filtering mode used for Multicast packets.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigSrcTrunk Indicates the packet is originally ingressed on Trunk Port.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigIngressClassificationTag Classification Tag assigned to packet in Ingress Filter Processor(IFP).
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigEgressMcast Indicates whether the packet is sent to a single point or a multi-point tree within the egress chip.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigVni Virtual Network Identifier (ISID) which identifies the service instance for this packet.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigDstGport The destination VP index for egress chip packet modification and encapsulation.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigMulticastIndex The destination multicast index for egress chip packet modification and encapsulation.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigVpReplicationId The destination Replication ID for egress chip packet modification and encapsulation.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigSrcGport The Source VP index from which the packet ingressed the system.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigProtectionSwitchingStatus This indicates the egress packet processor to use working / protection path based on the decision made in the ingress packet processor.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigMirrorToVp Indicates whether the packet is a mirrored copy or Switched Copy
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigDstType Indicates whether the destination is Virtual or Physical.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigSrcType Indicates whether the source is Virtual or Physical.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigOffloadEngineClassificationTag Opaque field generated by the ACL rule that triggered the redirect to the offload engine.
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigOffloadEnginePktPriNew New 802.1p bits
bcmFieldQualifyHiGigOffloadEngineDscpNew New DSCP value.
bcmFieldQualifyLoopBackQueue Loopback Port Queue Number. It is used in the MMU for buffer account and flow control of traffic received on the internal loopback port.
bcmFieldQualifyLoopBackSrcGport Source field for the packet. It can be a Virtual/Physical port.
bcmFieldQualifyPktIsVisible Triggers capture of intermediate packet processing results for this packet.
bcmFieldQualifyLoopBackCpuMasqueradePktProfile Pointer to indicate disposition of these packets in the Ingress Pipeline.
bcmFieldQualifyLoopBackColor Indicates Traffic rate violation status of the packet measured by Ingress Module.This can be Green/Yellow/Red.
bcmFieldQualifyLoopBackTrafficClass QOS provided by Fabric when forwarding the packet through Fabric.
bcmFieldQualifyLoopBackPacketProcessingPort Device Port Number which is to be used for processing the packet in the Ingress Pipeline. This must be a port that is programmed in the device to be a front panel (Ethernet) port.
bcmFieldQualifyL2PayLoad Qualify Bytes after L2 Header. Bits after L2 Header starts at beginning of "L2Payload" in the packet format given below.
  • Packet ::= DA(6) + SA(6) + [TAGS] + (802.3frame | EthII frame ) + L2 Payload + FCS
  • TAGS ::= (Vlan Tag | VNTAG | ETAG | CNTAG)*
  • 803.3frame ::= Length + (LLC | LLC_SNAP)
  • LLC ::= DSAP(1)+SSAP(1)
  • LLC_SNAP ::== (DSAP=0xAA, SSAP=0xAA, 3 bytes + 2 bytes (ethertype))
  • EthII frame ::== Ethertype (2)
L2Payload always starts after "Ethertype" (DSAP/SSAP in case of 802.3 LLC). So, for example, in case of a regular IPv4 packet (without options) the first byte of this L2 Payload is 0x45.

This qualifier will be able to inter operate with the existing L2PayloadFirstEightBytes qualifier. Tomahawk EFP supports 144 bits after L2header.

bcmFieldQualifyITag Service Instance Tag in MAC-in-MAC.
bcmFieldQualifyInterfaceIngressKeySelectClassPort Ingress port class id assigned to port by port table.
bcmFieldQualifyBfdYourDiscriminator BFD Your Discriminator.
bcmFieldQualifyCpuVisibilityPacket CPU visibility packet.
bcmFieldQualifyDstL2MulticastGroup Destination L2 Multicast Group Id.
bcmFieldQualifyDstL3MulticastGroup Destination L3 Multicast Group Id.
bcmFieldQualifyExactMatchHitStatus Exact Match Hit Status.
bcmFieldQualifyExactMatchActionClassId Exact Match Action Class Identifier.
bcmFieldQualifyExactMatchGroupClassId Exact Match Group Class Identifier.

New field actions are added in this release as listed.

Table 27: New Field Actions

Action Description param0 param1
bcmFieldActionDscpMapNew Qos Mapping for Incoming packet DSCP Dscp Map Id n/a
bcmFieldActionFabricEHAddOrUpdate To add or update the Higig extended header(4 bytes) to Higig Packets.
bcmFieldActionDot1pPreserve To prohibit changing/rewriting of packets 802.1p priority.
bcmFieldActionGpDot1pPreserve To prohibit changing/rewriting of Green packets 802.1p priority.
bcmFieldActionYpDot1pPreserve To prohibit changing/rewriting of yellow packets 802.1p priority.
bcmFieldActionRpDot1pPreserve To prohibit changing/rewriting of red packets 802.1p priority.
bcmFieldActionDscpPreserve To prohibit changing/rewriting of packets DSCP.
bcmFieldActionGpDscpPreserve To prohibit changing/rewriting of green packets DSCP.
bcmFieldActionYpDscpPreserve To prohibit changing/rewriting of yellow packets DSCP.
bcmFieldActionRpDscpPreserve To prohibit changing/rewriting of red packets DSCP.
bcmFieldActionChangeL2FieldsCancel Cancel Changing OuterVlan, SrcMac, DstMac, VnTag, Etag from lower prioirty groups.
bcmFieldActionBFDSessionIdNew Assign new Seesion Id to BFD EndPoint.
bcmFieldActionCosMapNew Override the default internal prioirty to cosq mapping derived in ingress pipeline using new IFP Cos Map.
bcmFieldActionGpCosMapNew Override the default internal prioirty to cosq mapping derived in ingress pipeline using new IFP Cos Map for Green Packets only.
bcmFieldActionYpCosMapNew Override the default internal prioirty to cosq mapping derived in ingress pipeline using new IFP Cos Map for Yellow Packets only.
bcmFieldActionRpCosMapNew Override the default internal prioirty to cosq mapping derived in ingress pipeline using new IFP Cos Map for Red Packets only.
bcmFieldActionVxlanHeaderFlags Set Vxlan Header Flags Field.
bcmFieldActionChangeL2Fields Modify L2 Fields for a given egress object.
bcmFieldActionExactMatchClassId Class Identifier associated to a exact match entry. Class Identifier Value. n/a

A new field forwarding type bcmFieldForwardingTypePortExtender is added for Port Extender.

Table 28: Field Forwarding Type

Type Purpose
bcmFieldForwardingTypePortExtender VNTAG/ETAG based forwarding.

New field hints are added and used during group creation and group expansion. Macro BCM_FIELD_HINT_EXACT_MATCH_GROUP_PRIORITY is added to Set Hint for Exact Match Group.

Table 29: New Field Hint type

Hint Type Purpose
bcmFieldHintTypeExactMatch Hint Type for Exact Match.

The Max number of supported Preselection entries is increased to 1024. 

        #define BCM_FIELD_PRESEL_SEL_MAX    1024

New fied priority is added in bcm_field_group_config_t data structure. 

	/*
	 * Group configuration structure. Used to create a field group with
	 * specific attributes.
	 */
	typedef struct bcm_field_group_config_s {
	    ...
	    int priority;                       /* Group priority. */
	    ...
	} bcm_field_group_config_t;

New data structure bcm_field_redirect_type_t has been introduced in this release. 

	/* bcm_field_redirect_type_e */
	typedef enum bcm_field_redirect_type_e {
	    bcmFieldRedirectTypeL3 = 0,     /* Redirect based on L3 route flow. */
	    bcmFieldRedirectTypeAll = 1,    /* Redirect all IP and non-IP flows. */
	    bcmFieldRedirectTypeCount = 3   /* Always Last. Not a usable value. */
	} bcm_field_redirect_type_t;

New field APIs are introduced in this release.

APIs for Section 3.4.5: Field Processor

bcm_field_qualify_XXX

Add a qualification to a field entry

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/field.h>
	int bcm_field_qualify_LearnExtension(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data);
	int bcm_field_qualify_IpFragNonOrFirst(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_PacketLength(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint16 data,
	    uint16 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_GroupClass(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 data,
	    uint32 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_UdfClass(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 data,
	    uint32 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_InterfaceLookupClassPort(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 data,
	    uint32 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstMulticast(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstMulticastGroupId(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_multicast_t group,
	    bcm_multicast_t mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigTrafficClass(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstModuleGport(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstPortGport(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstModPortGport(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigSrcModuleGport(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigSrcPortGport(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigSrcModPortGport(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigLoadBalanceID(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigColor(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 color);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigIntCongestionNotification(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigIngressTagged(
	    int unit,

	    uint8 data,

	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t port_mask);

	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigMirrorToVp(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstType(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigSrcType(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigOffloadEngineClassificationTag(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint16 data,
	    uint16 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigOffloadEnginePktPriNew(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigOffloadEngineDscpNew(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_LoopBackQueue(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_LoopBackSrcGport(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_PktIsVisible(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_LoopBackCpuMasqueradePktProfile(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_LoopBackColor(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 color);
	int bcm_field_qualify_LoopBackTrafficClass(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_LoopBackPacketProcessingPort(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_ExactMatchHitStatus(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    int group_pri,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_ExactMatchActionClassId(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    int group_pri,
	    uint32 data,
	    uint32 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_ExactMatchGroupClassId(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    int group_pri,
	    bcm_field_group_t group);
	int bcm_field_qualify_InterfaceIngressKeySelectClassPort(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 data,
	    uint32 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_ITag(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 data,
	    uint32 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_BfdYourDiscriminator(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 data,
	    uint32 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_CpuVisibilityPacket(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 data,
	    uint8 mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_DstL2MulticastGroup(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_multicast_t group,
	    bcm_multicast_t mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_DstL3MulticastGroup(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_multicast_t group,
	    bcm_multicast_t mask);

	para=unit     BCM nevice number

PARAMETERS

entry   Field entry ID
data   Data to match against
mask   Mask to choose which bits of data to match against

DESCRIPTION

Adds a qualification to a filter entry. Each qualification added makes the entry more specific and match fewer possible packets.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Operation completed successfully
BCM_E_INIT   BCM unit not initialized
BCM_E_NOT_FOUND   Entry ID not found
BCM_E_PARAM   Qualifier not in group's Qset
BCM_E_XXX   Other error code

bcm_field_qualify_XXX_get

Get a qualification match criteria from a field entry

SYNOPSIS

        #include <bcm/field.h>
	int bcm_field_qualify_LearnExtension_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data);
	int bcm_field_qualify_IpFragNonOrFirst_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_PacketLength_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint16 *data,
	    uint16 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_GroupClass_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 *data,
	    uint32 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_UdfClass_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 *data,
	    uint32 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_InterfaceLookupClassPort_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 *data,
	    uint32 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstMulticast_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstMulticastGroupId_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_multicast_t *group,
	    bcm_multicast_t *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigTrafficClass_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstModuleGport_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstPortGport_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstModPortGport_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigSrcModuleGport_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigSrcPortGport_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigSrcModPortGport_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigLoadBalanceID_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigColor_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *color);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigIntCongestionNotification_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigIngressTagged_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstTrunk_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstTrunkId_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_trunk_t *data,
	    bcm_trunk_t *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigIngressL3SwitchPkt_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigLabel_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 *data,
	    uint32 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigReplicationId_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 *data,
	    uint32 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigVlan_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint16 *data,
	    uint16 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigPortFilteringMode_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigSrcTrunk_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigIngressClassificationTag_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint16 *data,
	    uint16 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigEgressMcast_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigVni_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint16 *data,
	    uint16 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_HiGigDstGport_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_id,
	    bcm_gport_t *port_mask);

	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint16 *data,
	    uint16 *mask);

	    int unit,

	    uint32 *mask);

	    int unit,

	    bcm_gport_t *port_mask);

	    int unit,

	    int unit,

	    int group_pri,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
