	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    int group_pri,
	    uint32 *data,
	    uint32 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_ExactMatchGroupClassId_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    int group_pri,
	    bcm_field_group_t *group);
	int bcm_field_qualify_InterfaceIngressKeySelectClassPort_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 *data,
	    uint32 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_ITag_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 *data,
	    uint32 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_BfdYourDiscriminator_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint32 *data,
	    uint32 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_CpuVisibilityPacket_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    uint8 *data,
	    uint8 *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_DstL2MulticastGroup_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_multicast_t *group,
	    bcm_multicast_t *mask);
	int bcm_field_qualify_DstL3MulticastGroup_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_field_entry_t entry,
	    bcm_multicast_t *group,
	    bcm_multicast_t *mask);

PARAMETERS

unit   BCM device number
entry   Field entry ID
data   Data to match against
mask   Mask to choose which bits of data to match against

DESCRIPTION

Get a match criteria for a specific qualifier from a field entry.

RETURNS

BCM_E_XXX  

bcm_field_qualify_L2PayLoad

Add match criteria for bcmFieldQualifyL2PayLoad qualifier in the field entry.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/field.h>
	int bcm_field_qualify_L2PayLoad(int unit, bcm_field_entry_t entry, uint32 length, 
					const uint8 *data, const uint8 *mask);

PARAMETERS

unit   BCM device number
entry   Field entry ID
data   Qualifier match data.
mask   Qualifier match mask.
length   Number of bytes to qualify from the start of L2 Payload . Number of bytes can be qualified in L2 Payload may vary from chip to chip and may differ b/w (Vlan/Ingress/Egress) Field Processors of same chip. If user passes length more than supported, API will return BCM_E_PARAM. If length is less than the supported, API will add trailing zeros.

DESCRIPTION

Add match criteria for bcmFieldQualifyL2PayLoad qualifier in the field entry.

RETURNS

BCM_E_XXX  

bcm_field_qualify_L2PayLoad_get

Get match criteria for bcmFieildQualifyL2PayLoad qualifier from the field entry.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/field.h>
	int bcm_field_qualify_L2PayLoad_get(int unit, bcm_field_entry_t entry, uint32 length, 
					    uint8 *data, uint8 *mask);

PARAMETERS

unit   BCM device number
entry   Field entry ID
data   Qualifier match data.
mask   Qualifier match mask.
length   Number of bytes to qualify from the start of L2 Payload . Number of bytes can be qualified in L2 Payload may vary from chip to chip and may differ b/w (Vlan/Ingress/Egress) Field Processors of same chip. If user passes length more than supported, API will return BCM_E_PARAM. If length is less than the supported, API will add trailing zeros.

DESCRIPTION

Get match criteria for bcmFieldQualifyL2PayLoad qualifier from the field entry.

RETURNS

BCM_E_XXX  

Section 3.4.6: Layer 3 Management

The new BCM_L3_FLAGS2_FIELD_ONLY is added for flags2 fields in any of the L3 structures values which are the logical OR of one or more of the following flags.

Table 30: New BCM Layer 3 Flags2

Name Purpose
BCM_L3_FLAGS2_FIELD_ONLY When L3 egress objects are created with this flag, they can be used for IFP actions.

A new field l3info_max_ecmp_groups is added in data structure bcm_l3_info_t, which is used to return L3 table capacity and usage information. 

	typedef struct bcm_l3_info_s {
	    ...
	    int l3info_max_ecmp_groups; /* Maximum ECMP groups allowed. */
	    ...
	} bcm_l3_info_t;

Section 3.4.6.1: New AGM APIs for ECMP group.

The new AGM APIs are used to manage the ECMP groups using a AGM monitor.

APIs for Section 3.4.6.1: New AGM APIs for ECMP group.

bcm_l3_ecmp_agm_attach

Attach already created monitor entry to a L3 ECMP.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/l3.h>
	int bcm_l3_ecmp_agm_attach(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_if_t l3_ecmp_id,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
l3_ecmp_id   (IN) ID of a L3 ECMP group.
agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.

DESCRIPTION

Both l3_ecmp_id and agm_id should be a valid ID, after AGM monitor attach to a ECMP group. Need to enable this AGM to start counting (see bcm_switch_agm_enable_set ).

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - If the attachment is succeed.
BCM_E_PARAM   - If the monitor_id is not valid or the monitor entry is not created. If the ecmp id is not valid.
BCM_E_EXISTS   - If a monitor entry is already attached to.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_l3_ecmp_agm_detach

Detach a monitor entry from a L3 ECMP group

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/l3.h>
	int bcm_l3_ecmp_agm_detach(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_if_t l3_ecmp_id,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
l3_ecmp_id   (IN) ID of a L3 ECMP group.
agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.

DESCRIPTION

Un-map the monitor_entry_id from an aggregation group internally, need to disable AGM before detach it from an aggregation group.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - If the enable or disable is succeed.
BCM_E_PARAM   - If the ecmp id is not valid.
BCM_E_NOT_FOUND   - If no monitor entry is attached to the aggregation group.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_l3_ecmp_agm_attach_get

Retrieve a monitor id attached to a L3 ECMP group.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/l3.h>
	int bcm_l3_ecmp_agm_attach_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_if_t l3_ecmp_id,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t *agm_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
l3_ecmp_id   (IN) ID of a L3 ECMP group.
agm_id   (OUT) Pointer to Aggregation ID to update.

DESCRIPTION

Retrieve a monitor id attached to a L3 ECMP group.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - If the enable or disable is succeed.
BCM_E_PARAM   - If the trunk id is not valid.
BCM_E_NOT_FOUND   - If no monitor entry is attached to the aggregation group.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device


Section 3.4.7: Link Monitoring and Notification

The default linkscan interval BCM_LINKSCAN_INTERVAL_DEFAULT is added with the value 250000.


Section 3.4.8: Mirroring

New field recycle_cmd is added in data structure bcm_mirror_options_t. 

	/* Flags for bcm_mirror_options_s */
	#define BCM_MIRROR_OPTIONS_COPY_DROP    (1 << 0)   /* drop the copied packet */
	#define BCM_MIRROR_OPTIONS_FORWARD_DROP (1 << 1)   /* drop the original packet */

	/*  represents the options for the mirroring of packets */
	typedef struct bcm_mirror_options_s {
            ...
	    uint32 recycle_cmd;     /* dedicated for ETPP traps */
	} bcm_mirror_options_t;


Section 3.4.9: Multicast Configuration

New multicast APIs are added in this release.

APIs for Section 3.4.9: Multicast Configuration

bcm_multicast_egress_subscriber_qos_map_set

Assign a replication queue offset profile index to multicast group's subscriber queue replication list.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/multicast.h>

	int bcm_multicast_egress_subscriber_qos_map_set(int unit,
						bcm_multicast_t group,
						bcm_gport_t port,
						bcm_gport_t subscriber_queue,
						int qos_map_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
group   (IN) Multicast group ID
port   (IN) GPORT ID
subscriber_queue   (IN) Subscriber queue group ID
qos_map_id   (IN) Replication Qos Map ID.

DESCRIPTION

Assign a replication queue offset profile index to multicast group's subscriber queue replication list. The multicast group will use the replication QOS MAP for the queueing the packets to the queue in a queue group. the subscriber_queue represents the GPORT ID of the base queue ID in the queue group.the qos_map_id should be valid exisiting replication QOS Map created.

RETURNS

BCM_E_XXX

bcm_multicast_egress_subscriber_qos_map_get

Get the replication queue offset profile index associated to multicast group's subscriber queue replication list.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/multicast.h>

	int bcm_multicast_egress_subscriber_qos_map_get(int unit,
						bcm_multicast_t group,
						bcm_gport_t port,
						bcm_gport_t subscriber_queue,
						int *qos_map_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
group   (IN) Multicast group ID
port   (IN) GPORT ID
subscriber_queue   (IN) Subscriber queue group ID
qos_map_id   (OUT) Replication Qos Map ID.

DESCRIPTION

Get the replication queue offset profile index associated with the multicast group's subscriber queue replication list. The multicast group will use the replication QOS MAP for the queueing the packets to the queue in a queue group. the subscriber_queue represents the GPORT ID of the base queue ID in the queue group.

RETURNS

BCM_E_XXX

Section 3.4.10: Operations, Administration, And Maintenance

New field lm_ctr_pool_id is added in bcm_oam_endpoint_info_t OAM endpoint info structure, while existing field lm_pdu_ctr_field_size is renamed to lm_ctr_sample_size. This is equivalent to an 802.1ag Maintenance Endpoint (MEP): 

	typedef struct bcm_oam_endpoint_info_s {
	    ...
	    int lm_ctr_pool_id;                 /* The loss measurement counter pool id
						   from which the counters should be
						   allocated. Valid values are 0/1/2. */
            ...
            bcm_oam_lm_counter_size_t lm_ctr_sample_size; /* Valid values are 32/64.
            ...
	} bcm_oam_endpoint_info_t;

In BCM5260/56460 devices, lm_ctr_pool_id need to be passed with one of the counter pool id values, which can be 0 or 1 or 2 representing the 3 counter pools. Hardware can increment multiple counters(atmost 3 from 3 pools) associated with multiple endpoint ids if a packet's fields matches multiple endpoints. However the hardware can increment the counters for different endpoints only if they are allocated from different counter pools. Hence the caller of the bcm_oam_endpoint_create API should take care of passing different counter pool IDs for different endpoints if it is expected to receive packets with fields matching multiple endpoints.


Section 3.4.11: Policer

New field core_id is added in bcm_policer_config_t data structure for bcm_policer_create() API. 

	typedef struct bcm_policer_config_s {
	    ...
	    bcm_core_t core_id;         /* Device core on which to allocate the policer */
	} bcm_policer_config_t;


Section 3.4.12: Port Configuration

New port control type bcmPortControlExternalBufferEnable has been added for bcm_port_control_set() and bcm_port_control_get() APIs.

Table 31: New port control type bcm_port_control_t

Type Description
bcmPortControlExternalBufferEnable Enable/disable External Memory usage on the port. On Enable/Disable Port will be shutdown flushing the intermittent stale packets and then configuring External Buffer for value 1/Internal Buffer for value 0.
bcmPortControlOlpEnable Enable/Disable OLP encapsulation/decapsulation on specified BCM device port. Valid values : True/False.
bcmPortControlPortMacOui Upper 3 bytes of PORT MAC address. Used for OAM PORT MEP packet termination on relevant devices.
bcmPortControlPortMacNonOui Lower 3 bytes of PORT MAC address. Used for OAM PORT MEP packet termination on relevant devices.
bcmPortControlLinkPhyEnable Enable LinkPhy on a Port

New Port Match Criteria is added.

Table 32: Generic Port Match Criteria

New Match Criteria Description
BCM_PORT_MATCH_PORT_PON_TUNNEL_INNER_VLAN Mod/port/trunk + LLVID [11:0] of LLTAG + I-VID[11:0].

The following macros are newly designated for set/retrieve strength bit for specific port wide data, while the max width of port wide data is defined as BCM_PORT_WIDE_DATA_WIDTH and it's 57 in this release:

Table 33: Macros for set/get port wide data strength

Macro Macro Description
BCM_PORT_WIDE_DATA_STRENGTH_SET(_data, _strength) set the port wide data strength
BCM_PORT_WIDE_DATA_STRENGTH_GET(_data) get the port wide data strength

New Port APIs are added.

APIs for Section 3.4.12: Port Configuration

bcm_port_ingress_tdm_failover_get

Get the list of enabled TDM ports.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/port.h>
	int 
	bcm_port_ingress_tdm_failover_get(
	    int unit, 
	    int flag, 
	    bcm_pbmp_t *pbmp);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number
flag   (IN) for future use
pbmp   (OUT) List of enabled ports

DESCRIPTION

Retrieve all ports that allow TDM traffic to ingress the device. TDM traffic on any other port will be dropped. Modifying the set of TDM-enabled ports can be used for fast protection-switching of TDM traffic.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Success
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   Feature unavailable
BCM_E_XXX   Error occurred

bcm_port_ingress_tdm_failover_set

Set the list of enabled TDM ports.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/port.h>
	int 
	bcm_port_ingress_tdm_failover_set(
	    int unit, 
	    int flag, 
	    bcm_pbmp_t pbmp);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number
flag   (IN) for future use
pbmp   (IN) List of enabled ports

DESCRIPTION

Configure all ports that allow TDM traffic to ingress the device. TDM traffic on any other port will be dropped. Modifying the set of TDM-enabled ports can be used for fast protection-switching of TDM traffic.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Success
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   Feature unavailable
BCM_E_XXX   Error occurred

Section 3.4.13: Precision Time Protocol

New field tod_baud_rate is added to bcm_ptp_tod_input_t and bcm_ptp_tod_output_t data structures. 

	typedef struct bcm_ptp_tod_input_s {
	    ...
	    uint32 tod_baud_rate; /* PTP ToD baud rate. Supported baud rates are 300, 600, 1200, 1800,
				     2400, 4800, 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200, 230400 */
	} bcm_ptp_tod_input_t;

	typedef struct bcm_ptp_tod_output_s {
	    ...
	    uint32 tod_baud_rate; /* PTP ToD baud rate. Supported baud rates are 300, 600, 1200, 1800,
				     2400, 4800, 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200, 230400 */
	} bcm_ptp_tod_output_t;


Section 3.4.14: Quality of Service

The new QoS configuration flag BCM_QOS_MAP_REPLICATION that configures replication QOS map profile is added in this release and used with the QoS APIs.

  • BCM_QOS_MAP_REPLICATION - Configures replication QOS map profile.


Section 3.4.15: Range Checker Management (New)

The BCM Range APIs allow application developers to manage the Range Checker resources in StrataXGS devices. ============== Range checker Overview ==================

Section 3.4.15.1: Range Checker

The ICAP ContentAware engine contains a range checker, allowing software to easily check if a certain parameter falls within a range of values. The number of range checker entries available may vary across devices. Each range checker can be used to check for one of the following types:

  • L4 source port: source port field of TCP/UDP header.
  • L4 destination port: destination port field of TCP/UDP header.
  • VLAN ID: 12 bit internal OVID. The OVID value is affected by VLAN translation or other VLAN assignment mechanisms.
  • L3 Packet Length: Length in bytes of L3 payload plus L3 header. For IPv4 packet it is TL field in IPv4 header. For IPv6 packet it is Payload Length field in IPv6 header plus length of IPv6 header (40).
  • UDF1 Chunk 2(bits 47:32 of UDF1) : User defined field. (Supported in only Tomahawk)
In addition to support UDF1 Chunk 2, Tomahawk also supports capability to apply mask before doing a range check. This mask capability is as of now applicable to only UDF1 Chunk2. The range check comparison is performed on the entire 16 bits of masked UDF against the range. Each ranger checker entry will contain an upper bound and lower bound values. The results of the ranger checkers will be sent as a bitmap to the Protocol-Aware Selector engine.

Note: Switch control to use Range Module APIs

bcmSwitchRangeCheckersAPIType - Setting this switch control to 0 allows to use only field API's (bcm_field_range_XXX) and setting it to 1 allows to use only new range module API's (bcm_range_XXX). Default value will be set to 0. Refer Field section for field APIs on range checkers.

============= Range Data Structures ===========================

Section 3.4.15.2: Range Data Structures

    Range Config Structure. 
    	typedef struct bcm_range_config_s {
	    bcm_range_t rid;        /* Range Check Id */
	    bcm_range_type_t rtype; /* Range Check Type(bcmRangeTypeXXX) */
	    uint32 min;             /* Lower limit of Range inclusive. */
	    uint32 max;             /* Upper limit of Range inclusive. */
	    uint8 offset;           /* Offset (in bits) for mask to apply before range
				       check comparison. */
	    uint8 width;            /* Width(in bits) from offset specified for mask to
				       apply before range check comparison. */
	    bcm_udf_id_t udf_id;    /* UDF id created using bcm_udf_create API. */
	    bcm_pbmp_t ports;       /* Port bitmap to decide XGS pipe */
	} bcm_range_config_t;

    Table 34: BCM Range Checker Type

    bcmRangeTypeXXX Description
    bcmRangeTypeL4SrcPort Check L4 Source port range.
    bcmRangeTypeL4DstPort Check L4 Destination port range.
    bcmRangeTypeOuterVlan Check Outer Vlan range.
    bcmRangeTypePacketLength Check IP payload length range.
    bcmRangeTypeUdf Check Udf range.
    bcmRangeTypeCount Always last. Not a usable value.

    Table 35: BCM Range Module Operational Mode

    bcmRangeOperModeXXX Description
    bcmRangeOperModeGlobal Range Checkers Operate in Global Mode Value. i.e. for a given packet on any port from any pipe will have the same range check Result.
    bcmRangeOperModePipeLocal Range Checkers Operate in Per Pipe Mode Value. i.e. for a given packet on ports from different pipes can have the different range check Result.
    bcmRangeOperModeCount Always last. Not a usable value.

    Table 36: Flags to bcm_range_create

    flags Description
    BCM_RANGE_CREATE_WITH_ID Flag to the API to indicate the range is to be created with the user specified Range Id.

============== Range APIs ==========================

Section 3.4.15.3: APIs to manage the Range checker resources

During bcm_init, the range module will be initialized (or reinitialized, if warm-booting) before the field module is initialized. This is required, at least in case of warm reloading because the range objects which are recovered in range module are needed for appropriate object recovery while recovering field groups/entries.

APIs for Section 3.4.15.3: APIs to manage the Range checker resources

bcm_range_config_t_init

To initialize all members in bcm_range_config_t structure to default values.

SYNOPSIS

	#include<bcm/range.h>
	void bcm_range_config_t_init(
		bcm_range_config_t *range_config);

PARAMETERS

range_config   (IN/OUT) Pointer to Cross-Reference 103 (bcm_range_config_t) structure

DESCRIPTION

Initialises the range_config structure to default values. Notes Following are the different members in bcm_range_config_t structure and its default values. 
	typedef struct bcm_range_config_s { 
	    bcm_range_t rid =  -1;
	    bcm_range_type_t rtype = bcmRangeTypeCount;
	    uint32 min = 0;
	    uint32 max = 0;
	    uint8 offset = 0;
	    uint8 width = 0;
	    bcm_udf_id_t udf_id = -1;
	    bcm_pbmp_t ports = 0;
	} bcm_range_config_t;

RETURNS

BCM_E_XXX

bcm_range_create

Create a Range checker

SYNOPSIS

	#include<bcm/range.h>
	int bcm_range_create(
		int unit,
		int flags,
		bcm_range_config_t *range_config);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
flags   (IN) Flags to Range allocator.
range_config   (IN) Range Config structure.

DESCRIPTION

This API is to create a Layer 4 TCP/UDP port range checker or a VLAN ranger checker or a packet length range checker or a UDF range checker and returns an opaque bcm_range_t identifier that can be passed to 'bcm_field_qualify_RangeCheck' API, to qualify a Field entry with Range Checker match criteria. The required hardware resources are allocated and programmed. The range can be inverted using the 'invert' argument to bcm_field_qualify_RangeCheck. This API can optionally take "flags" from the user to decide whether to create a Range Checker with a specific bcm_range_t handle.

After initializing the range_config using bcm_range_config_t_init API, User need to update required members (as mentioned below) of it before passing it to bcm_range_config_create API.

  • rid : If BCM_RANGE_CREATE_WITH_ID flag is passed to API, a valid rid should be given.
  • rtype : User need to specify type of range checker of type bcm_range_type_t to create. This is mandatory of all range checker types.
  • min : Lower range to match (inclusive) and mandatory for all range checker types.
  • max : Upper range to match (inclusive) and mandatory for all range checker types.
  • offset : This is applicable only for UDF range checkers (bcmRangeTypeUdf). This is the offset (in bits) for mask to apply before range check comparison with min and max values.
  • width : This is applicable only for UDF range checkers (bcmRangeTypeUdf). This is the width (in bits) from offset specified for mask to apply before range check comparison with min and max values. For example for a particular UDF range checker, offset is specified as 10, and width is specified as 6, then that means user intends to qualify on MSB 7 bits of 16 bit UDF chunk. These 7 bits gives values from 0 to 128 which will be range checked using min and max values specified.
  • udf_id : This is applicable only for UDF range checkers (bcmRangeTypeUdf). User needs to pass the udf id created using bcm_udf_create API. This value is required to know whether the UDF chunk used by this UDF can be used for range checking.
  • ports : This is a PBMP to specify for which pipe of XGS pipeline user wants to create this range checker. User can specify a specific pipe or all pipes. User needs to call bcm_port_config_get API to get 'per pipe'/all pipe PBMP. This parameter is mandatory for all range checker types.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Range Module created successfully.
BCM_E_EXISTS   Entry already exists.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   Feature not supported.
BCM_E_INIT   Range module not initialized.
BCM_E_RESOURCE   Range Ids are all allocated
BCM_E_XXX   Standard error code.

bcm_range_get

Fetches the Range object created in the system

SYNOPSIS

	#include<bcm/range.h>
	int 
	bcm_range_get(
		int unit, 
		bcm_range_config_t *range_config)

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
range_config   (IN/OUT) Range Config structure.

DESCRIPTION

This API is to retrieve the operational configuration for the given range id.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Range get successful
BCM_E_NOT_FOUND   Range not found
BCM_E_INIT   Range Module not initialized
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   Feature not supported.
BCM_E_XXX   Standard error code.

bcm_range_destroy

Destroy the range object

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/range.h>
	int 
	bcm_range_destroy(
		int unit,
		bcm_range_t rid)

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
rid   (IN) Range ID.

DESCRIPTION

Destroys a range checker and releases resources allocated to the range checker. Hardware resources will also be freed.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Range deleted successfully
BCM_E_NOT_FOUND   Range does not exist
BCM_E_INIT   Range module not initialised
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   Feature not supported
BCM_E_XXX   Standard error code

bcm_range_oper_mode_set

Set Operational mode for Range Module

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/range.h>
	int bcm_range_oper_mode_set(
		int unit, 
		bcm_range_oper_mode_t oper_mode);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) BCM Device number.
oper_mode   (IN) Range Operational Mode enum value.

DESCRIPTION

Configure Operational mode of Range Module to either Global or Pipe Local.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Operation successful.
BCM_E_PARAM   Invalid operational mode.
BCM_E_UNIT   Range module not initialized.
BCM_E_BUSY   Ranges are already existing. Hence cannot change operational mode.

bcm_range_oper_mode_get

Get Operational mode of Range module

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/range.h>
	int bcm_range_oper_mode_get(
		int unit, 
		bcm_range_oper_mode_t *oper_mode);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) BCM Device number.
oper_mode   (OUT) Range Operational Mode enum value.

DESCRIPTION

Get current operational mode of the Range Module.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Operation successful.
BCM_E_PARAM   Invalid parameter.
BCM_E_UNIT   Range module not initialized.

bcm_range_traverse

Traverse all the valid range id's in the system, calling a specified callback function for each one

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/range.h>
	int 
	bcm_range_traverse(
		int unit,
		bcm_range_traverse_cb callback,
		void *user_data);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
callback   (IN) A pointer to the callback function to call for each range
user_data   (IN) Pointer to user data to supply in the callback

RETURNS

BCM_E_XXX  


Section 3.4.16: Time Configuration

Synchronous Ethernet APIs are newly added in this release.

Synchronous Ethernet (SyncE) and packet timing using the IEEE 1588 protocol are key solutions to the transport of frequency synchronization over packet networks which will ultimately drive the interoperability of carrier Ethernet and legacy networks. TSC-Eagle and TSC-Falcon have clock divisor hardware block to adjust output clock frequency for syncE. ============== SyncE Data Types ==================

Section 3.4.16.1: SyncE Data Types

  • The bcm_time_synce_clock_src_type_t typedef is used to specify which Primary/Secondary source is to be configured. 

    	typedef enum bcm_time_synce_clock_src_type_e {
	    bcmTimeSynceClockSourcePrimary = 0, /* Primary Clock Source */
	    bcmTimeSynceClockSourceSecondary = 1 /* Secondary Clock Source */
	} bcm_time_synce_clock_src_type_t;
  • The bcm_time_synce_input_src_type_t typedef is used to specify the input source type. 

    	typedef enum bcm_time_synce_input_src_type_e {
	    bcmTimeSynceInputSourceTypePort = 0, /* Input Source Port */
	    bcmTimeSynceInputSourceTypePLL = 1  /* Input Source PLL */
	} bcm_time_synce_input_src_type_t;
  • The bcm_time_synce_stage0_mode_t typedef is used to specify the stage0 mode. 

    	typedef enum bcm_time_synce_stage0_mode_e {
	    bcmTimeSynceModeBypass = 0,     /* Stage0 Mode Bypass */
	    bcmTimeSynceModeGap45 = 1,      /* Stage0 Mode GAP 4/5 */
	    bcmTimeSynceModeSDMFracDiv = 2  /* Stage0 Mode SDM Frac Div */
	} bcm_time_synce_stage0_mode_t;
  • The bcm_time_synce_stage1_div_t typedef is used to specify the stage1 divisor. 

    	typedef enum bcm_time_synce_stage1_div_e {
	    bcmTimeSynceStage1Div1 = 0, /* Stage1 Div1 */
	    bcmTimeSynceStage1Div7 = 1, /* Stage1 Div7 */
	    bcmTimeSynceStage1Div11 = 2 /* Stage1 Div11 */
	} bcm_time_synce_stage1_div_t;
  • The bcm_time_synce_divisor_setting_t structure is used to specify the stage0/stage1 divisor settings 

    	typedef struct bcm_time_synce_divisor_setting_s {
	    bcm_time_synce_input_src_type_t input_src; /* Input source type */
	    uint32 index;                       /* Logical port number or PLL index */
	    bcm_time_synce_stage0_mode_t stage0_mode; /* Stage0 Mode bcmTimeSynceMode* */
	    uint32 stage0_sdm_whole;            /* Stage0 SDM whole value */
	    uint32 stage0_sdm_frac;             /* Stage0 SDM frac value */
	    bcm_time_synce_stage1_div_t stage1_div; /* Stage1 Div bcmTimeSynceStage1Div* */
	} bcm_time_synce_divisor_setting_t;

============== SyncE APIs =======================

Section 3.4.16.2: SyncE APIs

APIs for Section 3.4.16.2: SyncE APIs

	    bcm_time_synce_divisor_setting_t *divisor);

PARAMETERS

DESCRIPTION

	    int unit,
	    bcm_time_synce_clock_src_type_t clk_src,

unit   BCM unit number
clk_src   clock source type : Primary or Secondary
divisor_setting   SyncE divisor setting

RETURNS

BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not available
BCM_E_XXX   - Any other error

unit   BCM unit number
clk_src   clock source type : Primary or Secondary
divisor_setting   SyncE divisor setting

DESCRIPTION

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not available
BCM_E_XXX   - Any other error


Section 3.4.17: Packet Transmit and Receive

RX trap codes for Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor are renamed with "Tx" direction as listed while some additional trap codes are added in this release.

Table 37: Rx Trap Codes Changes

Trap Code Description
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop0 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 0
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop1 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 1
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop2 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 2
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop3 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 3
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop4 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 4
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop5 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 5
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop6 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 6
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop7 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 7
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop8 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 8
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop9 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 9
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop10 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 10
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop11 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 11
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop12 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 12
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop13 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 13
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop14 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 14
bcmRxTrapEgTxFieldSnoop15 Egress snoop from Egress Field Processor profile 15
bcmRxTrapEgTxStpStateFail Egress STP state failure
bcmRxTrapEgTxProtectionPathUnexpected Unexpected Traffic on a Protecting Path
bcmRxTrapEgTxPortNotVlanMember Egress STP state failure
bcmRxTrapEgTxDiscardFrameTypeFilter
bcmRxTrapEgTxMtuFilter
bcmRxTrapEgTxSplitHorizonFilter

Three new fields are added in bcm_rx_trap_config_t data structure in this release. 

	/* User-configurable, per-unit RX configuration. */
	typedef struct bcm_rx_trap_config_s {
	    ...
	    int *dest_port_arr;                 /* Destination ports. bcm_gport_t array
						   is expected. */
	    int dest_port_arr_len;              /* dest_port_arr length */
	    bcm_mirror_options_t *mirror_cmd;   /* Mirror options in ETPP traps */
	} bcm_rx_trap_config_t;

In addition to existing BCM_RX_TRAP_UPDATE_POLICER RX packet tracp for update policer id (No. 1), BCM_RX_TRAP_UPDATE_POLICER_2 is added for another update policer id in No. 2

Table 38: BCM RX Trap Flags

Name Purpose
BCM_RX_TRAP_UPDATE_POLICER update policer id No.1
BCM_RX_TRAP_UPDATE_POLICER_2 update policer id No.2


Section 3.4.18: Service Activation Test (SAT)

New SAT APIs in this release.

APIs for Section 3.4.18: Service Activation Test (SAT)

bcm_sat_gtf_packet_start

Start gtf packet generation.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/sat.h>
	int bcm_sat_gtf_packet_start(
	    int unit, 
	    bcm_sat_gtf_t gtf_id, 
	    bcm_sat_gtf_pri_t priority);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) BCM device number
gtf_id   (IN) GTF ID
priority   (IN) bcmSatGtfPriAll indicates both cir and eir; bcmSatGtfPriCir indicates cir; bcmSatGtfPriEir indicates eir

DESCRIPTION

Start gtf packet generation. This API should be called after bcm_sat_gtf_packet_config.

Table 39: SAT GTF PRI Type

GTF Pri Description
bcmSatGtfPriAll Relevant to both CIR generator and EIR generator
bcmSatGtfPriCir Only relevant to CIR generator
bcmSatGtfPriEir Only relevant to EIR generator

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Operation completed successfully
BCM_E_NOT_FOUND   Attempt to set rate pattern for GTF which does not exist
BCM_E_PARAM   Attempt to set gtf rate pattern with invalid parameters
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   current API is not supported on the specified unit
BCM_E_TIMEOUT   Unable to obtain resource lock
BCM_E_INTERNAL   Unable to release resource lock / Failed to write memory

bcm_sat_gtf_packet_stop

Stop gtf packet generation.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/sat.h>
	int bcm_sat_gtf_packet_stop(
	    int unit, 
	    bcm_sat_gtf_t gtf_id, 
	    bcm_sat_gtf_pri_t priority);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) BCM device number
gtf_id   (IN) GTF ID
priority   (IN) bcmSatGtfPriAll indicates both cir and eir; bcmSatGtfPriCir indicates cir; bcmSatGtfPriEir indicates eir

DESCRIPTION

Stop gtf packet generation.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Operation completed successfully
BCM_E_NOT_FOUND   Attempt to set rate pattern for GTF which does not exist
BCM_E_PARAM   Attempt to set gtf rate pattern with invalid parameters
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   current API is not supported on the specified unit
BCM_E_TIMEOUT   Unable to obtain resource lock
BCM_E_INTERNAL   Unable to release resource lock / Failed to write memory

Section 3.4.19: Statistics

New Flex Counter Hint Information are defined as listed. 

	/* Defines Stat Hint values used during custom mode creation. */
	typedef enum bcm_stat_group_mode_hint_type_e {
	    ...
	    bcmStatGroupAllocHintVlanFieldGroup = 2,
	    bcmStatGroupAllocHintExactMatchFieldGroup = 3,
	    bcmStatGroupAllocHintCount = 4      /* Max value defined for this enum */
	} bcm_stat_group_mode_hint_type_t;

It's fundamental to the use of the statistics library is an enumerated type indicating the type of statistics to retrieve. The new type is defined as follows:

snmpBcmEgressProtectionDataDrop is the latest addition of bcm_stat_val_t. 

	typedef enum bcm_stat_val_e {
	    ...
	    snmpBcmEgressProtectionDataDrop /* Egress Protection data drop in EPIPE.
						   (Broadcom-specific) */
	} bcm_stat_val_t;

The type bcm_custom_stat_trigger_t is an enumeration of the packet types available for debug counters. bcmDbgCntEgressProtectionDataDrop is the latest addition of bcm_custom_stat_trigger_t type.

Table 40: New Custom Counter Packet Type

Name Purpose
bcmDbgCntEgressProtectionDataDrop Egress Protection data drop in EPIPE

APIs for Section 3.4.19: Statistics

bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_set
bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_get

Creates a {counting_source, counting_mask} to lif_stack_level mapping. For Issuing a counter command with the the LIF in lif_stack_id_to_count in the packet LIF stack.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/stat.h>
	int bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_set(
	    int unit, 
	    uint32 flags, 
	    bcm_stat_counter_source_t *source, 
	    bcm_stat_counter_lif_mask_t *counting_mask, 
	    bcm_stat_counter_lif_stack_id_t lif_stack_id_to_count);

DESCRIPTION

	An Out-LIF/In-LIF value is one of the parameters used for a decision if a counting action is valid.
	There can be two valid ranges of Out-LIF/In-LIF: range 0 and range 1.

	For ingress PP (IRPP) there are 2 counters, counter pointers are calculated as follows:
	-   At this point there are up to four indexes into the LIF table: the first is the outer-most LIF; the remaining ones have a 2-bit index/valid attribute.
	-   The LIFs are ordered according to their index (we assume that indexes are not identical)
	-   Each LIF is compared to two ranges (Cfg-Counter-In-LIF-Range-0|1). The comparison result is:
	2'b00 LIF is invalid
	2'b01 LIF is not in any range
	2'b10 LIF is inside range '0'
	2'b11 LIF is inside range '1'
	-   The value {Outer-most-LIF-Range, LIF-0-Range, LIF-1-Range, LIF-2-Range} is mapped to Counter-0|1-Source which can have the following values:
	2'b00 Outer-most-LIF
	2'b01 LIF-0
	2'b10 LIF-1
	2'b11 LIF-2
	-   Counter-0|1-Pointer is determined according to Counter-0|1-Source (padded with 5 zeros}; Counter-0|1-Update is set if the LIF indicated by Counter-0|1-Source is valid.

	Egress EPNI, At this point the last three Out-LIFs in the encapsulation stack are available; not all are valid. 
	Each LIF is compared to two ranges (Cfg-Counter-Out-LIF-Range-0|1). The comparison result is:
	2'b00 LIF is invalid
	2'b01 LIF is not in any range
	2'b10 LIF is inside range '0'
	2'b11 LIF is inside range '1'
	*   The value {Counter-0-Mode equal LIF (1), Counter-1-Mode equal LIF (1), LIF-0-Range (2), LIF-1-Range (2), LIF-2-Range (2)} is mapped to Counter-0|1-Source which can have the following values:
	2'b00 Invalid (i.e. NULL)
	2'b01 LIF-0
	2'b10 LIF-1
	2'b11 LIF-2
	* If Counter-0|1-Mode is LIF
	-       Counter-0|1-Pointer[15:0] is calculated according to Counter-0|1-Source
	-       Counter-0|1-Valid is set if Counter-0|1-Source is not Invalid
	* If Counter-0|1-Valid then 
	-       {Counter-1-Pointer[20:16], Counter-0-Pointer[20:16]} = {Egress-MC(1), System-MC(1), Out-PP-Port(8)}
	-       Counter-0|1-Pointer += Cfg-Counter-0|1-Base[Counter-0|1-Mode](21) + Out-PP-Port.Counter-0|1-Pointer-Base(21)

	/* Counter Engine Source Configuration */
	typedef struct bcm_stat_counter_source_s {
	    bcm_stat_counter_source_type_t engine_source; /* Counting source */
	    int command_id;                     /* Defines what counting command to
						   read. */
	} bcm_stat_counter_source_t;

	/* 
	 * Define the counting source of a counter engine. That is, what block to
	 * count, and what to count in a block
	 */
	typedef enum bcm_stat_counter_source_type_e {
	    bcmStatCounterSourceIngressInlif = 3, 
	    bcmStatCounterSourceEgressTransmitOutlif = 12, 
	} bcm_stat_counter_source_type_t;

	/* 
	 * Defines the mask of range IDs per stack ID level, for which the packet
	 * will be counted.
	 */
	typedef struct bcm_stat_counter_lif_mask_s {
	    bcm_stat_counter_lif_range_id_t lif_counting_mask[BCM_STAT_COUNT_LIF_NUMBER_OF_STACK_IDS]; /* An entry in a mask of range IDs per
						   stack ID level, each value defines a
						   result of LIF value compared with the
						   LIF ranges. */
	} bcm_stat_counter_lif_mask_t;
	/* 
	 * An entry in a mask of range IDs per stack ID level, each value defines
	 * a result of LIF value compared with the LIF ranges.
	 */
	typedef enum bcm_stat_counter_lif_range_id_e {
	    bcmStatCounterLifRangeIdLifInvalid = -2, /* The LIF does not exist in the packet
						   stack. */
	    bcmStatCounterLifRangeIdNotInAny = -1, /* The LIF is not in any range. */
	    bcmBcmStatCounterLifRangeId0 = 0,   /* The LIF is in any range 0. */
	    bcmBcmStatCounterLifRangeId1 = 1    /* The LIF is in any range 1. */
	} bcm_stat_counter_lif_range_id_t;

	typedef enum bcm_stat_counter_lif_stack_id_e {
	    bcmStatCounterLifStackIdNone = -1,  /* Do not issue a counter command. */
	    bcmStatCounterLifStackId0 = 0,      /* Issue a counter command with the
						   outermost LIF. */
	    bcmStatCounterLifStackId1 = 1,      /* Issue a counter command with LIF 1 in
						   the packet stack. */
	    bcmStatCounterLifStackId2 = 2,      /* Issue a counter command with LIF 2 in
						   the packet stack. */
	    bcmStatCounterLifStackId3 = 3       /* Issue a counter command with the
						   innermost LIF. */
	} bcm_stat_counter_lif_stack_id_t;

bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_range_set
bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_range_get

Set A range of LIF IDs.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/stat.h>
	int bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_range_set(
	    int unit, 
	    uint32 flags, 
	    bcm_stat_counter_source_type_t source, 
	    bcm_stat_counter_lif_range_id_t range_id, 
	    bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_range_t *lif_range);

DESCRIPTION

	/* 
	 * Define the counting source of a counter engine. That is, what block to
	 * count, and what to count in a block
	 */
	typedef enum bcm_stat_counter_source_type_e {
	    bcmStatCounterSourceIngressInlif = 3, 
	    bcmStatCounterSourceEgressTransmitOutlif = 12, 
	} bcm_stat_counter_source_type_t;

	/* 
	 * An entry in a mask of range IDs per stack ID level, each value defines
	 * a result of LIF value compared with the LIF ranges.
	 */
	typedef enum bcm_stat_counter_lif_range_id_e {
	    bcmStatCounterLifRangeIdLifInvalid = -2, /* The LIF does not exist in the packet
						   stack. */
	    bcmStatCounterLifRangeIdNotInAny = -1, /* The LIF is not in any range. */
	    bcmBcmStatCounterLifRangeId0 = 0,   /* The LIF is in any range 0. */
	    bcmBcmStatCounterLifRangeId1 = 1    /* The LIF is in any range 1. */
	} bcm_stat_counter_lif_range_id_t;

	/* A range of LIF IDs. */
	typedef struct bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_range_s {
	    int start; 
	    int end; 
	} bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_range_t;

Section 3.4.20: Switch Control

The switch object bcmSwitchObjectPFCDeadlockCosMax is added regarding max cosq support for PFC in this release for bcm_switch_object_count_get() API . 

	typedef enum bcm_switch_object_e {
            ...
	    bcmSwitchObjectPFCDeadlockCosMax /* Get the Max COS supported for PFC
					        Deadlock detection and recovery. */
	} bcm_switch_object_t;

New switch control bcmSwitchNonUcVlanShapingEnable is added in this release for bcm_switch_control_xxx() APIs.

Table 41: Switch Type Values

Value Description Arg Value
bcmSwitchNonUcVlanShapingEnable Enable/disable the ability of assigning single destination non-unicast traffic to service-based queues. 1 is enable and 0 (default) is disable. 0-1
bcmSwitchOamOlpStationMacOui Upper 3 bytes of BCM device MAC address. Used for incoming OLP packet termination. Upper 3 bytes of MAC address.
bcmSwitchOamOlpStationMacNonOui Lower 3 bytes of BCM device MAC address. Used for incoming OLP packet termination. Lower 3 bytes of MAC address.
bcmSwitchPFCDeadlockDetectionTimeInterval Set and Get the PFC detection timer interval (0-100ms[default], 1-10ms). Value used is of type bcm_switch_pfc_deadlock_detection_interval_t
bcmSwitchPFCDeadlockRecoveryAction Set and Get Recovery action to be performed in PFC deadlock recovery state. 0-Transmit Packets (Default), 1-Drop. Value used is of type bcm_switch_pfc_deadlock_action_t
bcmSwitchEcmpGroupMemberMode Set/get ecmp group member mode for BCM56846.
  • BCM_SWITCH_ECMP_GROUP_MEMBER_MODE_256 - There are 4 pages with a maximum of 256 members each per ECMP group.
  • BCM_SWITCH_ECMP_GROUP_MEMBER_MODE_1K - There are a maximum of 1024 members per ECMP group.
bcmSwitchRangeCheckersAPIType Setting this switch control to 0 allows to use only field API's (bcm_field_range_XXX) and setting it to 1 allows to use only new range module API's (bcm_range_XXX). Default value will be set to 0. 0-1
	typedef enum bcm_switch_pfc_deadlock_action_e {
	    bcmSwitchPFCDeadlockActionTransmit = 0, /* Transmit packets in Recovery state
						       (ignoring the PFC state)-Default
						       Action */
	    bcmSwitchPFCDeadlockActionDrop = 1, /* Drop packets in Recovery state. */
	    bcmSwitchPFCDeadlockActionMaxCount = 2 /* Maximum PFC Deadlock Recovery action
						      type count */
	} bcm_switch_pfc_deadlock_action_t;

	typedef enum bcm_switch_pfc_deadlock_detection_interval_e {
	    bcmSwitchPFCDeadlockDetectionInterval100MiliSecond = 0, /* 100 ms interval for Detection
								       interval (default) */
	    bcmSwitchPFCDeadlockDetectionInterval10MiliSecond = 1, /* 10ms interval for Detection interval */
	    bcmSwitchPFCDeadlockDetectionIntervalCount = 2 /* Maximum PFC deadlock detecion type
							       count */
	} bcm_switch_pfc_deadlock_detection_interval_t;

A new retrieving statistics on the number of API objects for bcmSwitchObjectEcmpMax is added for bcm_switch_object_count_get() API to get maximum number of possible Ecmp groups.

New switch APIs are added in this release.

Section 3.4.20.1: New AGM general switch APIs.

New AGM switch APIs are added for general switch control in addition to the L3 and Trunk AGM APIs.

APIs for Section 3.4.20.1: New AGM general switch APIs.

bcm_switch_agm_info_t_init

Initialize a bcm_switch_agm_info_t structure.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>
	void
	bcm_switch_agm_info_t_init(bcm_switch_agm_info_t *agm_info);

PARAMETERS

agm_info   (IN/OUT) AGM info parameters

DESCRIPTION

Initializes a AGM info parameters structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any such structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_switch_agm_info_t structure, and bcm_switch_agm_info_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

RETURNS

Nothing

bcm_switch_agm_stat_t_init

Initialize a bcm_switch_agm_stat_t structure.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>
	void
	bcm_switch_agm_stat_t_init(bcm_switch_agm_stat_t *agm_stat);

PARAMETERS

agm_stat   (IN/OUT) AGM stat parameters

DESCRIPTION

Initializes a AGM stat parameters structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any such structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_switch_agm_stat_t structure, and bcm_switch_agm_stat_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

RETURNS

Nothing

bcm_switch_agm_create

Creates an aggregation monitoring entry.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_agm_create(
	    int unit,
	    uint32 options,
	    bcm_switch_agm_info_t *agm_info);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
options   (IN) Reserved.
agm_info   (IN/OUT) Pointer to AGM info structure to create.

DESCRIPTION

Return agm_id in parameter agm_info if succeed, a flex counter object will be allocated internally for a given type of aggregation group table. Only same member count of aggregation groups can share same flex counter pool, otherwise, a new flex counter pool will be allocated for this purpose.

Support up to 63 valid aggregation monitor entries can be used.

If agm_info->period_num equals to zero, it means monitor will keep counting until it's disabled. 

	typedef enum bcm_switch_agm_type_e {
	    bcmSwitchAgmTypeTrunk = 0,          /* Forwarding group is a Trunk group */
	    bcmSwitchAgmTypeFabricTrunk = 1,    /* Forwarding group is a Higig Trunk
						   group */
	    bcmSwitchAgmTypeL3Ecmp = 2,         /* Forwarding group is an Ecmp Trunk
						   group */
	    bcmSwitchAgmTypeCount = 3           /* Maximum AGM type count */
	} bcm_switch_agm_type_t;

	typedef enum bcm_switch_agm_period_interval_e {
	    bcmSwitchAgmInterval1Second = 0,    /* 1s interval for each monitor period */
	    bcmSwitchAgmInterval100MiliSecond = 1, /* 100 ms interval for each monitor
						   period */
	    bcmSwtichAgmInterval10MiliSecond = 2, /* 10ms interval for each monitor period */
	    bcmSwitchAgmInterval1MiliSecond = 3, /* 1ms interval for each monitor period */
	    bcmSwitchAgmInterval100MacroSecond = 4, /* 100us interval for each monitor
						   period */
	    bcmSwitchAgmIntervalCount = 5       /* Maximum AGM period interval type
						   count */
	} bcm_switch_agm_period_interval_t;

	typedef struct bcm_switch_agm_info_s {
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id;         /* AGM monitor id */
	    bcm_switch_agm_type_t agm_type;     /* Indicates forwarding group type using
						   this monitor */
	    int num_members;                    /* number of members for the forwarding
						   group */
	    int period_num;                     /* AGM period number to be monitored, 0
						   means continue counting traffic
						   indefinitely */
	    bcm_switch_agm_period_interval_t period_interval; /* interval for each period */
	} bcm_switch_agm_info_t;

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device
BCM_E_FULL   - When all the monitor entries are used

bcm_switch_agm_enable_set

Enable or disable the aggregation group monitoring on a given entry.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_agm_enable_set(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id,
	    int enable);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.
enable   (IN) TRUE: monitoring is enabled, FALSE: monitoring is disabled.

DESCRIPTION

Enable or disable the aggregation group monitoring. Enable: program enable field to 1 and startTS to the current 1588 timestamp value in agg_monitor_table Monitoring will continue until the end of the period programmed If period is not specified, the monitoring will continue counting traffic indefinitely. Disable: program enable field to 0 and set starts to 0 in agg_monitor_table Disable monitoring on the aggregation_group, if period_num is specified, monitoring will be disabled automatically after period_num If monitoring is running indefinitely, the monitoring will be stopped.

This API will internally use time function to create a time interface if period interval is valid. With time interface, current time stamp can be retrieved and stamp to an incoming packet. 

	typedef int bcm_switch_agm_id_t;

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_switch_agm_stat_get

Retrieve bandwidth and packet distribution information that were collected via aggregation group monitoring.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_agm_stat_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id,
	    int nstat,
	    bcm_switch_agm_stat_t *stat_arr);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.
nstat   (IN) number of elements on the stat_arr (array size must be number of members * period).
stat_arr   (OUT) Aggregation group member info and stat info.

DESCRIPTION

Retrieve bandwidth and packet distribution information that were collected via aggregation group monitoring. Array size must be number of members * period, if period equals to 0, array size must be number of members. 
	typedef struct bcm_switch_agm_stat_s {
	    uint64 packets;         /* accumulated packets value */
	    uint64 bytes;           /* accumulated bytes value */
	    int period;             /* period number used by current stat */
	    bcm_gport_t gport_id;   /* If this AGM is for a Trunk/HigigTrunk, indicates
				       which trunk member using the counter */
	    bcm_if_t intf_id;       /* If this AGM is for an ECMP group, indicates which
				       group member using the counter */
	} bcm_switch_agm_stat_t;

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_switch_agm_stat_clear

Clear stats of counter entries attached to the aggregation monitor (id).

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_agm_stat_clear(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.

DESCRIPTION

Clear stats of counter entries attached to the aggregation monitor (id).

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_switch_agm_destroy

Destroy an existing aggregation monitoring entry.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_agm_destroy(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.

DESCRIPTION

Destroy an existing aggregation monitoring entry. Reverse steps of bcm_switch_agm_create.

If the AGM object is currently in use and needs to be detached first.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_switch_agm_trunk_attach_get

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	    int unit,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id,
	    bcm_trunk_t *trunk_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.
trunk_id   (OUT) (Fabric) Trunk id.

DESCRIPTION

Retrieve a (fabric) trunk_id where the monitor entry is attached.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_switch_agm_l3_ecmp_attach_get

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_agm_l3_ecmp_attach_get(
	    int unit,

agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.
l3_ecmp_id   (OUT) L3 ECMP group id.

Retrieve a l3 ecmp group id where the monitor entry is attached.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_switch_agm_get

Retrieve an aggregation group id on which the monitor entry is attached.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_agm_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_switch_agm_info_t *agm_info);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
agm_info   (IN/OUT) Pointer to AGM info structure to update.

DESCRIPTION

Retrieve an aggregation group info on which the monitor entry is attached. User should provide agm_info->agm_id in order to retrieve the info.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device
BCM_E_NOT_FOUND   - If the monitor entry is not attached to any of aggregation group.

bcm_switch_agm_enable_get

Return a monitor entry's enable status.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_agm_enable_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id,
	    int *enable);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.
enable   (OUT) returned enable status.

DESCRIPTION

Return a monitor entry's enable status.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_switch_agm_traverse

Traverse all aggregation monitor entries and call callback function for each allocated entry.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_agm_traverse(
	    int unit,
	    int flags,
	    bcm_switch_agm_traverse_cb trav_fn,
	    void *user_data);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) BCM device number
flags   (IN) Reserved
cb_fn   (IN) User specified Callback function
user_data   (IN) User data to be passed to callback function

DESCRIPTION

This API traverse over the aggregation monitor table and run callback at each entry (except reserved entry).

Whereas Callback function syntax is: 

	typedef int (*bcm_switch_agm_traverse_cb)(
		int unit,
		bcm_switch_agm_info_t *agm_info,
		void *user_data);

	Parameters:

	unit           Unit number.
	agm_info       Aggregation monitor entry info (OUT).
	user_data      User data to be passed to callback function (OUT).

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

APIs for Section 3.4.20: Switch Control

bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t_init

Initialize a bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t structure.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	void 
	bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t_init(bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t *l2_addr);

PARAMETERS

l2_addr   (IN/OUT) OLP MAC address information, indexed by port.

DESCRIPTION

Initializes a OLP L2 information structure to default values.

Whereas bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t is defined as: 

	typedef struct bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_s {
	    bcm_port_t port;        /* BCM device connecting port for this entry. */
	    bcm_mac_t mac;          /* MAC address for this entry */
	} bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t;

	Parameters:

	port           BCM device port number.
	mac            6 bytes MAC address assigned to OLP interfacing port.

RETURNS

Nothing

bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_add

Set/Replace MAC address assigned to Offload Processor connecting port.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_add(
	    int unit,
	    uint32 options,
	    bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t *l2_addr);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
options   (IN) Operational control options : BCM_SWITCH_OLP_L2_ADDR_REPLACE.
l2_addr   (IN) OLP MAC address information, indexed by port.

Table 42: Optional Flags for bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_add

Name Description
BCM_SWITCH_OLP_L2_ADDR_REPLACE Replace the matching entry

DESCRIPTION

This API configures MAC address which is used by BCM device as destination MAC address of L2 header sent towards OLP from BCM device.

Optional flag BCM_SWITCH_OLP_L2_ADDR_REPLACE can be used under options parameter of this API to replace the existing entry.

RETURNS

BCM_E_xxx

bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_get

Get MAC address assigned to Offload Processor connecting port.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t *l2_addr);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
l2_addr   (OUT) OLP MAC address information, indexed by port.

DESCRIPTION

Get MAC address configured for OLP connected to specified BCM device port. Port is input parameter.

RETURNS

BCM_E_xxx

bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_delete

Delete OLP MAC address.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_delete(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t *l2_addr);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
l2_addr   (IN) OLP MAC address information, indexed by port.

DESCRIPTION

Delete MAC address of OLP connected to specified BCM device port.

RETURNS

BCM_E_xxx

bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_delete_all

Delete all previously configured OLP mac addresses.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_delete_all(
	    int unit);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.

DESCRIPTION

Delete ALL previously configured OLP MAC address for specified unit.

RETURNS

BCM_E_xxx

bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_traverse

Traverse previously configured OLP MAC addresses and call callback function for each valid OLP MAC.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/switch.h>

	int bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_traverse( 
	    int unit, 
	    bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_traverse_cb cb_fn, 
	    void *user_data);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) BCM device number
cb_fn   (IN) User specified Callback function
user_data   (IN) User data to be passed to callback function

DESCRIPTION

This API traverse all previously configured OLP MAC address by API bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_add() and envoke callback function for each valid OLP MAC entry.

Whereas Callback function syntax is: 

	typedef int (*bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_traverse_cb)(
		int unit, 
		bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t  *l2_addr, 
		void *user_data);

	Parameters:

	unit           BCM device number (OUT).
	l2_addr        OLP MAC address info (OUT).
	user_data      User data to be passed to callback function (OUT).

RETURNS

BCM_E_xxx

Section 3.4.21: Trunking (Link Aggregation) - AGM APIs for (Fabric) Trunk group.

New trunk AGM APIs are added in this release.

APIs for Section 3.4.21: Trunking (Link Aggregation) - AGM APIs for (Fabric) Trunk group.

bcm_trunk_agm_attach

Attach already created monitor entry to a trunk or a fabric trunk.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/trunk.h>
	int bcm_trunk_agm_attach(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_trunk_t trunk_id,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
trunk_id   (IN) ID of a (fabric) trunk.
agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.

DESCRIPTION

Both trunk_id and agm_id should be a valid ID, after AGM monitor attach to a trunk group. Need to enable this AGM to start counting (see bcm_switch_agm_enable_set ).

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - If the attachment is succeed.
BCM_E_PARAM   - If the monitor_id is not valid or the monitor entry is not created. If the trunk id is not valid.
BCM_E_EXISTS   - If a monitor entry is already attached to.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_trunk_agm_detach

Detach a monitor entry from a trunk or a fabric trunk

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/trunk.h>
	int bcm_trunk_agm_detach(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_trunk_t trunk_id,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t agm_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
trunk_id   (IN) ID of a (fabric) trunk.
agm_id   (IN) Aggregation monitor ID.

DESCRIPTION

Un-map the monitor_entry_id from an aggregation group internally, need to disable AGM before detach it from an aggregation group.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - If the enable or disable is succeed.
BCM_E_PARAM   - If the trunk id is not valid.
BCM_E_NOT_FOUND   - If no monitor entry is attached to the aggregation group.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

bcm_trunk_agm_attach_get

Retrieve a monitor id attached to a (fabric) trunk.

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/trunk.h>
	int bcm_trunk_agm_attach_get(
	    int unit,
	    bcm_trunk_t trunk_id,
	    bcm_switch_agm_id_t *agm_id);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
trunk_id   (IN) ID of a (fabric) trunk.
agm_id   (OUT) Pointer to Aggregation ID to update.

DESCRIPTION

Retrieve a monitor id attached to a (fabric) trunk.

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   - If monitor entry id found.
BCM_E_PARAM   - Parameter is not invalid.
BCM_E_NOT_FOUND   - If no monitor entry is attached to the aggregation group.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   - Feature is not supported on the device

Section 3.4.22: UDF Resources Management

New field subport_tag is added in bcm_udf_pkt_format_info_t data structure for Packet format based UDF specification structure. 

	/* Packet format based UDF specification structure. */
	typedef struct bcm_udf_pkt_format_info_s {
	    ...
	    uint16 subport_tag;             /* SUBPORT_TAG packet format.
					       (BCM_PKT_FORMAT_SUBPORT_TAG_XXX) */
	} bcm_udf_pkt_format_info_t;

New option BCM_UDF_CREATE_O_RANGE_CHECK for bcm_udf_create() API is added.

Table 43: New option to bcm_udf_create

flags Description
BCM_UDF_CREATE_O_RANGE_CHECK Hint to the API so the udf allocation is adjusted to be used by Range Checker.

New field ports is added in bcm_udf_t data structure as well as the new data structure bcm_udf_oper_mode_t for bcm_udf_oper_mode_set() and bcm_udf_oper_mode_get() APIs. 

	typedef struct bcm_udf_s {
	    ...
	    bcm_pbmp_t ports;       /* port bitmap used in OperModePipeLocal. 
				       ports must be in same ingress pipe */ 
	    ...
	} bcm_udf_t;

	typedef enum bcm_udf_oper_mode_e {
	   bcmUdfOperModeGlobal = 0, /* Group Operational Global Mode Value. */
	   bcmUdfOperModePipeLocal = 1, /* Group Operational Pipe Local Mode Value. */
	   bcmUdfOperModeCount = 2 /* Always last. Not a usable value. */
	} bcm_udf_oper_mode_t;

New UDF APIs are added in this release.

APIs for Section 3.4.22: UDF Resources Management

bcm_udf_oper_mode_set

Set UDF operation mode

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/udf.h>
	int 
	bcm_udf_oper_mode_set(
	    int unit, 
	    bcm_udf_oper_mode_t mode);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
mode   (IN) UDF operation mode

DESCRIPTION

Used to configure UDF operational mode per pipe. Default operational mode is Global to mimic legacy behavior. User must explicitly select PipeLocal mode for creating per-pipe UDF entries (Tcam/Offset).

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Success.
BCM_E_PARAM   Invalid operational mode.
BCM_E_INIT   UDF module not initialized.
BCM_E_BUSY   UDF tcam or offset memory has a valid entry configured
BCM_E_XXX   Standard error code.

bcm_udf_oper_mode_get

get UDF operation mode

SYNOPSIS

	#include <bcm/udf.h>
	int 
	bcm_udf_oper_mode_get(
	    int unit, 
	    bcm_udf_oper_mode_t *mode);

PARAMETERS

unit   (IN) Unit number.
mode   (INOUT) UDF operation mode

RETURNS

BCM_E_NONE   Success.
BCM_E_UNAVAIL   Feature is not available.
BCM_E_XXX   Standard error code.

Section 3.4.23: VLAN Management

The new key types for VLAN translation lookup are defined in bcm_vlan_translate_key_t.

Table 44: bcm_vlan_translate_key_t

New VLAN Translate Key Types Description
bcmVlanTranslateKeyPortPonTunnel Use Port, LLVID[11:0]
bcmVlanTranslateKeyPortPonTunnelOuter Use Port, LLVID[11:0] and O-VID[11:0]
bcmVlanTranslateKeyPortPonTunnelInner Use Port LLVID[11:0] and I-VID[11:0]

A new VLAN group flag is added in this release.

Table 45: New VLAN gport flag

Flag Description
BCM_VLAN_PORT_EGRESS_PON_TUNNEL_NONE This flag indicates that LLTAG is not added when a packet egress out from this VLAN port.

New port match criterias are added in this release. A Logical Layer 2 port can be set as one of the following values and also in Table 46: bcm_vlan_port_match_t .

Table 46: bcm_vlan_port_match_t

Value Meaning
BCM_VLAN_PORT_MATCH_PORT_PON_TUNNEL Mod/port/trunk + LLTAG VLAN ID[11:0].
BCM_VLAN_PORT_MATCH_PORT_PON_TUNNEL_VLAN Mod/port/trunk + LLTAG VLAN ID[11:0] + Outer VLAN.
BCM_VLAN_PORT_MATCH_PORT_PON_TUNNEL_INNER_VLAN Mod/port/trunk + LLTAG VLAN ID[11:0] + Inner VLAN.





Section 4: Test Statistics


Section 4.1: How to read the Data

The below tables represent a spread of data gathered per-device, per-suite, per-release. The percentages represent the aggregate rate of failure for that suite when run against all variants of the family of devices.


Section 4.2: Overview

Each suite listed below is indicative of a specific module. Golden refers to a suite of tests that takes representation across multiple modules and serves as a sanity regression. Each suite contains tests of various types, loosely categorized as follows:
Test Categories Description
Configuration Tests Tests that verify that each API functions appropriately and can configure the device as expected.
Functionality Tests Tests that further validate each of the API through functional use often requiring traffic to be run through the system.
Semantic Tests Tests that ensure that the proper error handling mechanisms are working and users cannot crash the device through the API.


Section 4.3: Note

The below data is not meant to be a precise indication of quality but instead serves as a guideline for improvements release-over-release. Additionally, although some cells show 0% failures, this does not necessarily mean the feature is supported in the device - tests are run to validate the appropriate SDK support even for unsupported features on older devices to ensure graceful handling of all API.

Finally, some devices have fewer columns listed if they were introduced recently.


Section 4.4: Total Tests

The below data represents the number of unique cases for each release.

Note that although a particular test case will execute for each and every chip, it's only counted once.
sdk-6.4.6 sdk-6.4.5 sdk-6.4.4
golden 154 154 154
warmboot 392 372 368
auth 17 17 17
bfd 37 37 37
bhh 43 43 43
chip 9 9 9
cint 60 60 60
coe 543 543 543
cosq 456 448 405
custom 7 7 7
ea 108 108 108
eav 19 19 19
extender 33 33 33
fabric 7 7 7
failover 8 8 8
fcoe 37 37 37
field 971 972 886
higigproxy 129 129 129
infra 114 114 114
ipfix 17 17 17
ipmc 66 66 66
l2 253 252 252
l2gre 13 13 13
l3 351 332 231
l3.alpm 258 258 258

bcm.stat 0.0 % 0.5 % 0.8 %
bcm.stg 0.0 % 0.0 % 0.0 %
bcm.switch 0.5 % 0.5 % 0.5 %
bcm.time 0.0 % 0.0 % 0.0 %
bcm.trill 0.0 % 0.0 % 0.0 %
bcm.trunk 0.0 % 0.2 % 1.3 %
bcm.tunnel 0.0 % 0.5 % 0.5 %
bcm.subport 0.0 % 0.0 % 1.1 %
bcm.vlan 0.0 % 0.2 % 0.0 %
bcm.vxlan 0.0 % 0.0 % 0.0 %
bcm.wlan 0.0 % 0.0 % 0.0 %
Test Suite Total 0.5 % 0.7 % 1.0 %


Section 4.6: Static Code quality analysis

In 2015 we have once again upgraded our static analysis code tool to a version with many new checkers and are currently starting the process to work through the new backlog of issues.
Initial Reported Issues Open Issues SDK 6.4.1 Open Issues SDK 6.4.2 Open Issues SDK 6.4.3 Open Issues SDK 6.4.4 New baseline as of 1/31/15 Open Issues SDK 6.4.5 Open Issues SDK 6.4.6
DNX 664 131 67 11 13 450 295 168
XGS 271 123 54 21 4 500 229 116
SBX 600 0 0 45 1 650 156 77
SerDes 147 74 21 16 18 100 59 49
