Total 4509 528 202 127 50 2100 894 543





Section 5: Resolved Issues for 6.4.6

The following issues are resolved in version 6.4.6 of the SDK.

Number CSP # Chips Release Notes For 6.4.6
SDK-39506 All In previous releases, inconsistent and incorrect usage of port->link status. This release provides changes to handle the the port link status as a 2 bit value range rather than a 1 bit boolean value.
SDK-44005 56640_A0 56634_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 56634_B0 Fixed bcm_field_entry_policer_attach() API for Policers created with ID = 0 and Level = 0.
SDK-45564 56640_A0 56440_A0 56640_B0 56440_B0 Min required burst size for service meter is maximum of (MTU size + metering rate * refresh interval) and (2 * metering rate * refresh interval).
SDK-47366 642398 All In previous releases if MEM_SCAN was not in the feature list a compile error would occur. SER is a mandatory component after BCM_TRIUMPH_SUPPORT, and relies on MEM_SCAN. In this release, for the mandatory case, MEM_SCAN will be complied only depending on the SER support, no matter it is in the feature list or not. For previous chips, MEM_SCAN is an optional feature, It can be excluded by the user in local customized feature list and chip type selection.
SDK-47434 640577 56640_A0 56440_A0 Fix for proper computation of meter granularity when committed rate is zero is provided.
SDK-47922 642859 56840_A0 There were 2 issues found and tracked through this Jira: 1) Stack port trunk creation failure: Root cause: After creation of the trunk the trunk was immediately destroyed due to not filling-in the trunk state to variable which keeps tracks of the valid trunks. Resolution: Fill in the correct status for each trunk created or already exisitng one's 2) Could not modify trunks with existing trunk IDs. Root cause: If the trunk was found to be existing then it was skipped. Resolution: For existing trunks do not skip rather continue modifying its members
SDK-47973 649106 All In previous releases, bcm.user.proxy as a server/client did not work. This release fixes the socket closing unexpectedly when bcm.user.proxy is in client/server mode.
SDK-48082 661794 All Description of CPU transmitted packet sizes of the packet transmission flag combinations has been added to the documentation.
SDK-50405 693218 56540_A0 Problem: Egress LM counters were not updated for BCM56545

Solution: The OAM_LM_COUNTERS table size was not being indexed correctly. In this release, the OAM_LM_COUNTERS table size has been corrected.

SDK-50984 56340_A0 In this release, override of KFLAG_INCLD variable in Linux/iProc make files is allowed.
SDK-54164 743691 56150_A0 Packet RX DMA assertion fail could occur when linux-kernel-bde.ko was inserted with himem=1. In this release, warning messages are printed when high memory is used for DMA on ARM cpu but linux kernel configuration CONFIG_HIGHMEM is not enabled.
SDK-55247 729017 56340_A0 56547_A0 In previous releases, link flapping would occur when port settings were set by bcm_port_speed_set on Helix4 QSGMII ports. In this release, a fix was implemented to avoid the link flapping with speed set in sgmii/gmii mode on QSGMII core
SDK-60171 813666 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, pkt->rx_untagged was not being set for RCPU packets. In this release the problem with the RCPU function has been fixed.
SDK-60528 812963 56045_B0 Issue: Ranger+ doesn't support intra-slice mode in VFP.

Fix: This release removes theintra-slice flag for Ranger+ VFP stage.

SDK-61398 823602 All In the previous release, sal_udelay could be optimized incorrectly by the compiler for vxWorks. This has been fixed by using a global volatile variable to avoid compiler optimization.
SDK-61572 803880 88650_B1 Added new APIs dedicated for this task, There is a new API for configuring a CRPS engine dynamically. /* Configure counter engine. */ int bcm_stat_counter_config_set( int unit, bcm_stat_counter_engine_t *engine, bcm_stat_counter_config_t *config);
SDK-61762 830573 56850_A2 In previous releases, VLAN membership may be corrupted after call to bcm_vlan_gport_delete. To address this the behaviors on bcm_vlan_gport_add() were changed when adding virtual port or physical port to a VLAN: 1.Adding virtual port: New behaviors: a.BC/UMC/UUC_DO_NOT_ADD flag is used to control if virtual port is added to multicast group, but it cant be used to remove virtual port from multicast group. If this flag is not used virtual port is added to multicast group, else there is nothing to do. b.Add this virtual port to VP member group of this VLAN.

2.Adding physical port: New behaviors: a.BC/UMC/UUC_DO_NOT_ADD flag is used to add/delete multicast group members. If this flag is used physical port is removed from multicast group, else added to multicast group. So we can call this API many times for physical port to update multicast group member. b.Add this physical port to physical port member group.

For virtual port, if you want to do vlan check base on physical port, below API sequences should be used: 1.use bcm_vlan_gport_add(unit, vid, virtual port, 0) to add virtual port to VLAN 2.use bcm_vlan_gport_add(unit, vid, global physical port, 0) to add the physical port to VLAN. DO_NOT_ADD can be used to control if add this port to multicast group.

Behaviors of bcm_vlan_gport_delete() also have been changed: 1.Deleting virtual port: New behaviors: a.Delete virtual port from multicast group. b.Delete virtual port from VP member group.

2.Deleting physical port: There is no change for physical port.

SDK-63162 840528 88660_A0 add new soc property to control adding a trunk to a ingress MC group, this soc property is relevant only if you use trunk destinations only in ingress MC. using trunk destinations both in ingress and egress MC groups with the new Soc property is forbidden.
SDK-63472 807209 All When updating xmac in warmboot, mac disable will apply only when there is a change in mac.
SDK-63559 88670_A0 Added support for MIP traffic snooping while keeping the original system headers. For more details please refer to 88670-PG1XX-R OAM Snooping sub-section
SDK-65044 857445 88650_A0 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 In complex functions with many error checks the mutex is released at the function exit, all code must pass through the exit label. In simple protected code without error checks the mutex is taken before and released after the protected code.
SDK-65646 56340_A0 56548_A0 In previous releases, the Encapsulated Higig (EHG) API bcm_port_encap_config_set causes port link flap. The link flap was due to the soc_phy_speed_set when EHG encapsulation was set. On EHG the MAC/PHY are transparent hence phy reconfiguration is not required. This release fixes the link flap issue.
SDK-65661 861469 88650_A0 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 In ECMP, the key_shift and key_seed values were mistakenly limited to values shorter than supported by the hw, this is now fixed.
SDK-66338 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 56851_A0 56851_A1 56851_A2 56851P_A1 56851P_A2 56852_A0 56852_A1 56852_A2 56853_A0 56853_A1 56853_A2 56854_A0 56854_A2 56854_B0 56855_A0 56855_A2 All In earlier releases, a crash may occur when alpm routes were added with new VRF if TCAM entries were exhausted. This release fixes the issue.
SDK-66791 SDK-48699 56450_A0 56450_B0 This release adds API support to configure the following: 1. Replication QOS MAP profiles 2. Associating the Replication QOS Map profile to the queues.
SDK-67215 88660_A0 In previous release, all InLIFs were mapped to IVE action id (63). User just had one IVE command to use when MAC-In-MAC works in 32k VSIs mode. In this release, this issue has been resolved by modifying the PRGE. Two IVE commands can be used. One is used for NOP. The other is for add/remove S-tag.
SDK-67439 88660_A0 In the previous release, downstream IPv6 DIP/SIP compression entry must be bound to a NNI LIF. In this release, this issue has been addressed by eliminating this limitation. Downstream IPv6 DIP/SIP entry can be bound to a NNI port.
SDK-67482 88950_a0 Pattern controls are supported using bcm_port_phy_control_set bcm_port_phy_control_get

BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_TX_PATTERN_LENGTH BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_TX_PATTERN_GEN_ENABLE BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_TX_PATTERN_DATA0 . . BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_TX_PATTERN_DATA7

SDK-68497 88660_A0 In the previous release, IPv4 MC FLP program wasn't hit for IPv4 MC Packet when PON application is enabled. In this release, this issue has been addressed by disabling the IPv4 MC program when PON application is enabled.
SDK-68978 88750_B0 FE1600: Fixed bug in unicast route auto correction for 2b ECC error. Before the fix auto correction worked only for the first time the error occurred.
SDK-69302 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 56641_A0 56642_A0 56643_A0 56643_A1 56643_B0 56644_A0 56644_A1 56644_B0 56645_A0 56648_A0 56648_B0 56649_A0 56649_B0 In previous releases, single destination non-unicast traffic was not supported by service based queuing. In this release, the feature has been supported by providing a new switch control enum bcmSwitchNonUcVlanShaping to optionally assign these traffic to service-based queues.
SDK-69304 56340_A0 BCM56548H has been supported in this release.
SDK-69410 56840_A0 In previous releases, when enabling or disabling Micro flow based hash in RTAG7 for ECMP in BCM56846, ECMP member mode would be changed simultaneously, which caused traffic interruption. In this release, a new switch control has been added to allow controlling ECMP mode individually.
SDK-69506 All In the previous release, traffic wasnt right when calling API bcm_port_control_set to set port Unicast, Multicast and Broadcast with BCM_GPORT_BLACK_HOLE. In this release, this issue has been fixed through modifying the forwarding profile allocation. Unicast, Multicast and Broadcast traffic can be configured with BCM_GPORT_BLACK_HOLE.
SDK-69630 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 bcm_ipmc_add() performs a search for the entry before adding it, verifying that it is indeed a new entry. When the search failed, as it should, it would report an error, even when the replace flag was not there.

Added a check for the replace flag when error checking. It should no longer print the error message if the replace flag is there.

SDK-69775 88670_A0 cint example for routing over overlay (ROO) and L2VPN using same forwarding and tunneling resources. see cint_vxlan_roo.c
SDK-69776 88670_A0 New feature for ROO: linker layer extension. Extend link layer of the overlay configuration: - configure up to 2 vlans. - configure outer vid lsbs. see cint_vxlan_roo.c, the cint example has been updated to support this feature.
SDK-69805 88650_A0 88660_A0 88670_A0 Field Qualifier, bcmFieldQualifyForwardingVlanId, size was fixed to 15b (was set to 12b)
SDK-70027 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 Fixed an issue that potentially corrupts the PHY register for BCM56640 type of switch devices.
SDK-70102 56440_A0 All In previous releases, MMU parity errors were seen on Katana devices. In this release the bucket burst calculation has been fixed addressing the MMU parity error problem.
SDK-70193 88670_A0 skip over MTRPS_EM & CRPS dynamic memories
SDK-70331 56344_A0 In previous releases, bcm_port_enable_set() would fail to disable a port if queue based metering was configured on the port. This release fixes the issue.
SDK-70463 53403_A0 56850_A0 This release introduces warmboot support for KOI with TD2 switch. Chip initialization failures are removed.
SDK-70477 88670_A0 Fixed mantissa calculations for ingress queue thresholds.
SDK-70580 88670_A0 Fixed mantissa calculations for ingress queue thresholds.
SDK-70600 All New APIs for creating source VSQs (VSQE and VSQF) where implemented: bcm_cosq_src_vsqs_gport_add() New APIs for configuring source based ingress congestion management where implemented:bcm_cosq_resource_allocation_set() Please look in the TM programers guide for more details.
SDK-70606 SDK-71871 56040_A0 This release introduces eight new enums which can be used to retrieve MMU transmit and dropped counts for UC and MC queues independently.

bcmCosqStatUCDroppedPackets bcmCosqStatMCDroppedPackets bcmCosqStatUCDroppedBytes bcmCosqStatMCDroppedBytes bcmCosqStatUCOutPackets bcmCosqStatMCOutPackets bcmCosqStatUCOutBytes bcmCosqStatMCOutBytes

SDK-70807 56960_A0 NA
SDK-71008 88950_a0 Added support for bcm_fabric_multicast_multi_set/get APIs. More information can be found in the UM.
SDK-71024 SDK-71109 All Modified return type to match function declaration.
SDK-71049 All Members named 'class' caused compilation error. Those members renamed to 'class_id'.
SDK-71240 All Cosq FC: SOC properties fc_inband_intlkn_XXX are used to configure flow control properties for in-band ILKN. SOC property value will be stored in global variable used to check if inband ILKN is valid during bcm initialization. But the global variable are not set correctly during warmboot in previous code, which cause setting flow control path fail. After this fix, the global variable are not set correctly during warmboot.
SDK-71267 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 In previous releases, access of the UNICORE TX_DRIVER register would use register 0x17 instead of 0x15. With this release, the xgxs16g1l driver for 40nm serdes core, the TX driver control registers are offset 0x15 registers instead of offset 0x17 registers.
SDK-71288 56860_A0 After the hardware is programmed to reflect the new encapsulation is changed, the software structures are updated to reflect the change. This defect fixes updates of software structures.
SDK-71289 56860_A0 Issue: In double wide mode, FP Entry hit was occurring for invalid conditions.

Resolution: In this release we prevent F3 field selectors and some F1 field selectors from being programmed in secondary slice in the case of double wide group.

SDK-71337 56045_B0 56046_B0 In earlier releases, UC and MC per-Queue drops were shown in bcm-shell on Ranger+ as : "PERQ_DROP_PKT" "PERQ_DROP_BYTE" "PERQ_DROP_PKT_UC" "PERQ_DROP_BYTE_UC" In this release, it has been changed to: "PERQ_DROP_PKT" "PERQ_DROP_BYTE" "PERQ_DROP_PKT_UC" "PERQ_DROP_BYTE_UC"
SDK-71519 56840_A0 56850_A0 56860_A0 56960_A0 TRIDENT In previous releases, the function _bcm_tr2_layered_qos_resolution_set did not program ING_CONFIG_64.IGNORE_PPD0_PRESERVE_QOS and EGR_CONFIG_1.DISABLE_PPD0_PRESERVE_QOS for Trident/TH chipsets. This has been fixed by adding layered QoS resolution support for Trident/Trident2+/Tomahawk.
SDK-71687 All added the support of 1G at 6.25G so that when gloop is closed, the proper data can be tx out
SDK-71735 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 56851_A0 56851_A1 56851_A2 56851P_A1 56851P_A2 56852_A0 56852_A1 56852_A2 56853_A0 56853_A1 56853_A2 56854_A0 56854_A2 56854_B0 56855_A0 56855_A2 In previous releases, VP filtering mode on VLAN membership check could not be changed from virtual port group mode to hash table mode directly. In this release, this has been fixed by supporting the direct transition between previous two modes.
SDK-71739 88670_A0 MPLS tunnel termination mapping from EXP to TC,DP was done with incorrect EXP. EXP was always 0 not related to any EXP from terminated MPLS tunnel. The fix provided EXP from correct terminated MPLS tunnnel according to PIPE/Uniform models as done in previous generation devices.
SDK-71747 56860_A0 NA
SDK-71824 56640_A0 NA
SDK-71834 56960_A0 Flex stats infrastructure has been enhanced to allow per-pipe counters to be setup by Tomahawk VFP software module.
SDK-71881 All In this release support has been added in the bcm_l3_route_get API to display "l3a_pri" field.
SDK-71914 SDK-74248 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 In previous releases, the TAG_ACTION_PROFILE field in _bcm_tr3_vlan_mac_delete_all was incorrect. In this release, this field has been modified to VLAN_MAC_TAG_ACTION_PROFILE.
SDK-71915 All A new flag was added to expose Out-LIF modification: BCM_RX_TRAP_UPDATE_ENCAP_ID. A new enum value was added to bcm_rx_trap_config_t: - bcm_if_t encap_id; /* Encap-ID */

If BCM_RX_TRAP_UPDATE_ENCAP_ID is present, then the Out-LIF can be changed according to encap_id. At egress, the change must be coupled with destination change.

An example of use can be found in cint_egr_mtu.c. This cint demonstrates the use of bcmRxTrapEgMtuFilter, as well as the configuration process for MTU. In addition, the cint can also use the bcm_field_qualify_RxTrapCode in order to drop packets that violate the MTU. In order to do so, uncomment the part that starts with :" /* Testing the rx_trap_code_qualifier */ ".

SDK-71992 88670_A0 to use this UI use 'show pvt'. the pvt monitor was enabled.
SDK-71993 56547_A0 PORT LOCK wasn't unlocked during invocation of _bcm_port_mac_reinit was failed. The issue has been fixed in this release.
SDK-72020 56460_A0 Problem: Debug logs were displayed by default when an endpoint was created.

Solution: The debug log generation is suppressed by default.

SDK-72031 56540_B0 In previous SDK code, when the start index and end index were passed to the API bcm_l3_route_traverse and start is not 0; a misalignment of the start index would occur.

In this release, the start index is correctly assigned.

SDK-72045 56850_A0 56960_A0 In previous releases, API bcm_l3_nat_ingress_add didnt add reference count of binding egress NAT. API bcm_l3_nat_egress_delete decreased the reference count directly and delete the egress NAT when the reference count equal to 0. It caused mistaken delete of egress NAT even when this egress NAT was being referenced by other ingress NATs. This has been addressed by adding the reference count when binding to an ingress NAT in API bcm_l3_nat_ingress_add. API bcm_l3_nat_egress_delete adds a protection to prevent mistaken delete of egress NAT. This API returns BCM_E_BUSY to indicate that the current egress NAT is still referenced by other ingress NATs.
SDK-72057 88670_A0 Jericho: Add support to the Soc property system_is_petra_b_in_system.
SDK-72085 56640_A0 56850_A0 In the previous releases, if a user created a primary NNI port and then created a failover NNI port; the failover id and failover port would be returned when the user tried to get the information of the primary NNI port. In this release, the failover id and failover port will not be returned in such a scenario.
SDK-72088 56640_A0 56640_B0 56643_A0 56643_B0 Problem : No support for ExtensionHeader2Type in TR3

Solution: Add support for ExtensionHeader2Type in TR3.

SDK-72196 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 In BCM5645x devices, previously when auxiliary ports were connected to external PHY and the controlling port in Quad mode was functioning at internal PHY, the corresponding PHY was not getting updated during Flex operation.

This was due to incorrect handling of PHY map selection registers during hardware linkscan initialization for newly formed flex ports.

This issue has been fixed by Setting CMIC_MIIM_INT_SEL_MAP registers to 0 when external PHY is present.

SDK-72208 56960_A0 This release adds support for Aggregation Monitor.
SDK-72210 56960_A0 In this release support has been added for the AGM feature. AGM is a statistics engine operating on counters in the flex counters block. The AGM monitor provides statistics on forwarding group member selection and utilization by providing set of counters representing group member utilization by traffic flowing through the system.
SDK-72222 88670_A0 Mapping NIF ports on the same quad to different core is forbidden. Traffic will fail for these ports. A validation was added
SDK-72282 88660_A0 The previous firmware didn't support the UDH for BFD over IPv6. The current firmware fixed this issue by adding UDH after ITMH for BFD transmit.
SDK-72381 All Issue was caused due to syntax error when certain blocks of source code were conditionally enabled using '#if ...' and '#endif' constructs. It was resolved by modifying the error code and testing it against all possible combinations of the conditional macros used within the given function.
SDK-72384 56960_A0 NA
SDK-72455 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 In external TCAM, when group is created with action bcmFieldActionExternalValue0Set max action size for in HW is 48 bits, but SW used only 32 bits. Issue fixed and now when setting the action by API bcm_field_action_get(unit, entry, bcmFieldActionExternalValue0Set, &param0, &param1). The action is constructed from param0 for the 32 LSB bits and 16 LSB bits of param1 for the MSB bits.
SDK-72463 56340_A0 56640_A0 In this release, support has been added for recording port-based LLS bitmaps.
SDK-72504 88660_A0 OAM: dest_port field of bcm_rx_trap_type_create with OAM type can be a gport of one of the following types:  BCM_GPORT_TYPE_LOCAL  BCM_GPORT_TYPE_MODPORT  BCM_GPORT_TYPE_TRUNK  BCM_GPORT_TYPE_SYSTEM_PORT  BCM_GPORT_TYPE_UCAST_QUEUE_GROUP  BCM_GPORT_TYPE_MCAST_QUEUE_GROUP  BCM_GPORT_TYPE_MCAST  BCM_GPORT_TYPE_BLACK_HOLE  BCM_GPORT_TYPE_LOCAL_CPU
SDK-72507 88660_A0 88670_A0 All interrupt will be cleared even after failure in the interrupt handler
SDK-72513 All In the previous release, rx runt packet byte is not counted in snmpIfInOctets, snmpEtherStatsOctets and snmpIfHCInOctets. In this release rx runt packet byte will be counted via adding RRBYT counter in snmpIfInOctets, snmpEtherStatsOctets and snmpIfHCInOctets.
SDK-72521 SDK-74094 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 56641_A0 56642_A0 56643_A0 56643_A1 56643_B0 56644_A0 56644_A1 56644_B0 56645_A0 56648_A0 56648_B0 56649_A0 56649_B0 In previous releases, segmentation fault may appear on Triumph3 devices when recovering the Field module. This was caused by an incorrect argument for _FP_METER_BMP_TEST. In this release, the argument for _FP_METER_BMP_TEST has been corrected. The recovery for bcmFieldIngressLogicalPolicerPools16x512Contiguous and bcmFieldIngressLogicalPolicerPools16x512Split modes was also added.
SDK-72523 56224_A0 56224_B0 All Problem : Spike in traffic would occur during removal of entry with meters present. Solution: Meter table is cleared only after entry is removed.
SDK-72553 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 All In previous releases, when the bcmSwitchL3IngressInterfaceMapSet was set, the NAT realm ID was configured incorrectly in the API bcm_l3_egress_create. This has been addressed by getting the correct L3 ingress interface information when setting the realm ID.
SDK-72579 56460_A0 56457_B0 56455_B1 56458_B0 NA
SDK-72593 88670_A0 buffer numbers are now assigned correctly to support also 2048 dbuff size configuration - calculation was fixed. sent 10000 packets and none was dropped
SDK-72613 All soc_mmu_error_port() bug related to operator precedence is fixed.
SDK-72688 All In previous releases, for KT and KT2 the BYTE_COUNTER width was assumed as 36 bits when this field was updated. Actual width of BYTE_COUNTER field was 35 bits.

In this release, it has been corrected to 35 bits for KT & KT2 devices.

SDK-72733 56860_A0 NA
SDK-72740 All In previous releases, all created network ports would be retrieved by bcm_mim_port_get_all(), and would be deleted by bcm_mim_port_delete_all() or bcm_mim_vpn_destroy(). In this release, none of the network ports can be retrieved by bcm_mim_port_get_all() or deleted by bcm_mim_port_delete_all() or bcm_mim_vpn_destroy().
SDK-72772 88660_A0 Age out messages were sent only in ingress/egress_centralized state only (not in distributed). Now it is possible to receive age out messages in distributed state as well. If the age out messages are configured to be sent to the CPU they will be sent even in distributed state.
SDK-72802 88670_A0 relevant tables and registers were either zeroed or changed to all ones to allow support of dram_enable=0 mode
SDK-72863 88670_A0 bcm_l2_station_add: Fixed a bug where trying to create a multiple mymac termination station for MiM would create a different kind of station.
SDK-72992 88670_A0 Add support to CPU learning with callbacks on Jericho. bcm_l2_addr_register was supported only on Arad and now it is available on Jericho as well
SDK-72993 56640_A0 In earlier releases, the PORT_EHG_RX_TUNNEL_MASK memory was being programmed to match all packets; and the header programmed into PORT_EHG_RX_TUNNEL_DATA memory contained the VLAN tag and TPID. This information should have come from PORT_EHG_RX_CONTROL.VLAN and PORT_EHG_TPID.TPID. In this release, the PORT_EHG_RX_TUNNEL_MASK memory is being programmed to match the data in the PORT_EHG_RX_TUNNEL_DATA memory. The header programmed into PORT_EHG_RX_TUNNEL_DATA memory does not contain the TPID or VLAN tag.
SDK-72994 88670_A0 Added support for setting connection between VOQS and VOQ connectoers (ingress an egress queues) in asymmetric core configuration.
SDK-73003 SDK-75618 56460 NA
SDK-73020 All In previous releases, the udf entries were incorrectly arranged in the HW table when their priorities were not zero, because packet format id was incorrectly taken into account. This has been fixed by not taking packet format id into account when the priority is non-zero. Packet format id takes effect only when priority is not specified or is zero.
SDK-73074 56040_A0 All In this release the accelerated mode for HW linkscan mode ports has been expanded to SW linkscan mode ports. SW linkscan ports enter the accelerated mode when: a) Port is part of the SOC property fast_sw_rx_los_pbmp. b) Port is down.
SDK-73095 88660_A0 88670_A0 OAM: OAMP Punt packets will arrive at the CPU port (or any other destination) with two sets of system headers: an FTMH, PPH, and FHEI built by the OAMP and the system headers of the original packet. The user may configure a trap code for each of the validity checks and this will be set on the FHEI on the external set of system headers (this is done for example in maid_trap_set() in cint_oam.c). The reason the packet was punted may be deduced by the external set of system headers and the MEP-ID may be deduced by the internal set of system headers. The external system header stack will always be FTHM (9B), PPH (7B), FHEI (3B). Due to a hardware bug, FTMH.PPH_EXISTS will incorrectly equal 0 and the FTMH.FHEI_SIZE will equal 3 as opposed to 1 (1 is encoded to 3 bytes, 3 is encoded to 5 bytes).

Punt packets may be recognized by the source system port on the first FTMH. If the SSP is equal to a local or remote OAMP port then the packet may be assumed to be a punt packet and the aforementioned bugs should be taken into account.

SDK-73098 88660_A0 VLAN-Port , VXLAN: LIF learning information encoding for ac-mp lif and tunnel termination lif was incorrect in BCM88660 and on some cases returned error in get/replace APIs.
SDK-73134 88650_A0 88670_A0 port tx disable doesn't disable flow control which may cause for old traffic to get stuck in the disabled queue. Fixed
SDK-73156 88660_A0 In metering, when a meter is configured with Sharing Enabled, the difference between two parameters represented with the same reverse exponent might be too large for all possible reverse exponent values. In these cases, we compromise on the accuracy of the lower value (meaning, the lowest value achievable with the selected reverse exponent will be larger than the lower value). A warning message is printed in this cases.
SDK-73158 56960_A0 All In previous release, the user could not create two groups with the same group priority. In this release, two groups without pre selection and with same priority can be created on Tomahawk IFP.
SDK-73186 56842_A0 NA
SDK-73208 88660_A0 Fixed writing out-of-bounds segmentation fault during counter initialization sequence.
SDK-73285 56960_A0 In previous releases, the APIs bcm_l3_host_add & bcm_l3_route_add would return -4 when l3a_pri was greater than 7. In this release the priority value check will accept priority up to 15.
SDK-73320 88660_A0 LLVP classification determines a tag format per combinations of TPID values and other user defined flags. The tag format is later used to map an EVE action. The operation is available in Advanced VLAN Translation through the API bcm_port_tpid_class_set().

The LLVP classification for untagged packets had no effect in some scenarios, although the operation was declared as successful. The LLVP classification for untagged packets is now fully functional.

SDK-73332 88660_A0 fixed Warm Boot Issues with Core clock @ 500MHz
SDK-73334 56960_A0 Fixed the dual hash SW reordering function to calculate the correct destination entry hash value during recursion bucket trace validation.
SDK-73369 53406_A0 This release adds the following APIs to set the firmware mode to use dfe or br dfe bcm_port_phy_control_set(unit, port, BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_FIRMWARE_DFE_ENABLE, 0); bcm_port_phy_control_set(unit,t, BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_FIRMWARE_BR_DFE_ENABLE, 0)
SDK-73374 All CLP & XLP interrupts action are not valid while port configured as ILKN. Therefore during cleaning interrupts sequence these interrupts should be skipped.
SDK-73392 56060 All 56060_A0 In previous releases, the API bcm_time_capture_get did not include the upper 15 bits of clock register. This release fixes the incorrect timestamp value returned on 48-bit timestamping supported devices.
SDK-73398 All In previous releases, the CLI multicast delete command would not work when encap id was set to -1. In this release, this has been fixed by adjusting the check of parameter.
SDK-73399 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, SDK wasn't allowed to add TPID for a virtual port when the virtual port was a remote port. This has been fixed in this release by removing this restriction.
SDK-73403 56850_A0 56960_A0 In previous releases, bcm_l3_nat_ingress_find didn't retrieve next hop info correctly. In this release the API bcm_l3_nat_ingress_find retrieves the correct next hop.
SDK-73461 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 Support to configure field UDF_TCAM.SUBPORT_TAG_PRESENT was enabled later in hardware and same was missing in SDK. Now configuring this field through SDK is enabled.
SDK-73462 88660_A0 In L3, when creating L3 interface a default RIF profile is created. An out of resource error was returned When interface was created and deleted more than 4095 times. The issue fixed now and when deleting the L3 interface the RIF profile is also deallocated.
SDK-73466 All Problem : DRAM bitmap was incorrectly set from the number of DDR memories.

Solution: Now the dram bitmap is correctly calculated from number of DDR memories.

SDK-73521 88670_A0 minor configuration added in order to support XAUI interface
SDK-73533 88670_A0 88950_a0 Fixed SerDes RX controls: bcm_port_phy_control_set(unit, port, BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_RX_PEAK_FILTER , val) bcm_port_phy_control_set(unit, port, BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_RX_LOW_FREQ_PEAK_FILTER , val) bcm_port_phy_control_set(unit, port, BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_RX_VGA , val) bcm_port_phy_control_set(unit, port, BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_RX_TAP#, val) bcm_port_phy_control_set(unit, port, BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_RX_TAP#_RELEASE, val)
SDK-73614 88950_a0 Fixed legacy support for: bcm_fabric_link_control_set(unit, link, bcmFabricLinkPrimaryWeight, weight) bcm_fabric_link_control_set(unit, link, bcmFabricLinkSecondaryWeight, weight)
SDK-73616 88950_a0 Fixed legacy support for bcm_fabric_link_control_set(unit, link, bcmFabricLinkIsSecondaryOnly, <0/1>)
SDK-73646 56846_A0 56846_A1 Previously linkscan thread, _bcm_esw_linkscan_update_port(), updated "Ethernet clock recovery" improperly. Now, SDK checks the registers related to "Ethernet clock recovery" before accessing them.
SDK-73647 88660_A0 Remote LIF update: For a Remote LIF, created by bcm_vlan_port_create(), a FEC is created but not a LIF. Therefore, when performing a "REPLACE" operation for such an object, the value of the In-LIF attribute fields isn't relevant to the operation. The problem was that all the bcm_vlan_port_create() attributes were validated during a "REPLACE" operation, even for Remote-LIF objects, causing failure in some cases even though the failing field may have not been applicable for the Remote-LIF. The "REPLACE" now performs validation according to the relevant fields for the object and in case of a Remote LIF, In-LIF attributes aren't validated.
SDK-73670 88660_A0 To reduce the time for cosq delete - we optimized the cosq get information function. instead of checking all the queues in the system we are only checking one queue at a time - to verify that its empty.
SDK-73685 88660_A0 88670_A0 All the program selection to the flp single hop function was fixed to support also URPF
SDK-73786 56540_A0 56540_B0 Problem: Previously OAM loss and delay related endpoint parameters were not recovered during warmboot because the endpoint software information was improperly maintained in SDK.

Solution: In this release, support is added to recover OAM loss and delay related information during warmboot when software endpoint information is constructed.

SDK-73828 88660_A0 88670_A0 All OAM: Hitherto the CCM statistics (counting per endpoint) was based on the LIF. The MD-Level was added to the LEM lookup key which results in CCM counting being done per endpoint, not per LIF.
SDK-73832 88660_A0 bcm_port_force_forward_set API ,for static forwarding, is now supported in TM-mode as well as in PP-mode.

Call sequence: bcm_port_force_forward_set(0,13,13,1);

SDK-73866 88670_A0 Added support for for queue dram queue-based congestion management.
SDK-73869 88660_A0 OAM: Support receiving CCM packets at the OAMP without transmitting CCMs. The OAMP checks incoming packet's CCM period and compares that value against the MEPs CCM period. Normally disabling transmission is done by setting the MEPs CCM period to 0, which would result in the above check to fail, thus hinder the OAMP from processing the CCM. In order to support receiving CCM packets without sending packets, CCMs are sent by the OAMP to an illegal destination. This can be done in the following way: 1. Configure an accelerated MEP with bcm_oam_endpoint_create() with a positive ccm_period. 2. Update the above endpoint with ccm_period set to 0. In this case the OAMP will continue sending CCM packets but these will get dropped in the pipeline. 3. Endpoint may be updated to transmit legal CCM packets once again. Note: The update in step 2 may cause subsequent calls to bcm_oam_endpoint_create to fail (accelerated Down MEP only), depending on the LSB of src_mac_address field. This failure may be avoided by creating the endpoints before updating any endpoints to disable CCM transmission. This behavior may be enabled by setting the soc property custom_feature_oam_ccm_rx_wo_tx to 1.
SDK-73874 56634_A0 56634_B0 56636_A0 56636_B0 56638_A0 56638_B0 56639_A0 Support for URPF feature has been implemented in this release.
SDK-73881 56224_B0 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 In earlier releases if a cable was connected to bring a link UP before linkscan was started, the MAC was not getting synced correctly after the linkscan was started. This has been fixed in this release.
SDK-73883 SDK-73057 88670_A0 read weight was changed to 1, irrelevant counters for DDR4 are ignored when reading results.
SDK-73902 56640_B0 In previous releases, replace operation on double wide entry of table L3_ENTRY was not supported. This is supported in this release.
SDK-73916 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 In previous SDK releases, when a port was probed during system run time, the MAC was being reset as part of the port probe sequence. This resulted in link flap on the ports which are in the same block. In this release, the MAC reset sequence is only done during initialization and skipped during run time.
SDK-73924 88660_A0 The alloc lif diagnostic has been broken when calling "diag alloc lif" with a specific number. It is fixed now.
SDK-73938 SDK-74098 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 All In previous SDK releases, bcm shell command INTR did not support chip parity status interrupt management. The issue has been addressed in this release.
SDK-73943 88650_B1 88660_A0 support is added for rx loopback for 40G CR4 mode
SDK-73957 All NA
SDK-73958 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, the table EGR_VLAN_XLATE could not be programmed on VXLAN access side. In this release, this has been fixed to allow programming it.
SDK-73967 56450_B0 56450_B1 In previous releases the RQE in Katana2 does not make use of mutilple queues. In this release, all of these queues are used.
SDK-73968 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 In previous releases, EFIFO sizing always assumed external memory. In this release, EFIFO sizing is now based on the external/internal buffer usage. Overspeed de-limiter is also programmed appropriately for the external non link phy ports.
SDK-74008 88660_A0 On some SAL implementations, a short usleep is done by doing a 'yield' within a loop, rather than a true 'sleep'. If no other tasks are using the CPU, this will effectively be a busy-wait, as the yield will immediately return. This can make it appear that the Rx thread is using a lot of CPU, though this is only because no other task is in a running state.

To avoid this appearance of CPU load, the value of >20000 can be set for the rx sleep

So the result is only the appearance of 100% CPU load, and this operation should not have any effects on other tasks. The task that is spinning doing a sal_usleep() is continually calling an OS yield, so any other scheduled tasks will run.

The only time you will see this task getting 100% CPU is if no other tasks are trying to run.

Currently we are testing a change that will increase the rx sleep to value of >20000.

SDK-74013 56334_A0 56334_B0 In previous releases, alternative UDF qualifiers were not considered during group creation with resulted in groups getting created in double wide mode even though group creation in single wide mode was possible. This release adds changes to try alternative UDF qualifiers during group creation before going to higher wide modes.
SDK-74026 56224_A0 56224_B0 Previously during warmboot recovery, the entry PBMP mask was mistakenly applied to secondary/ternary parts. In this release, a check has been added to warmboot recovery and PBMP mask is applied only the primary part of the entry.
SDK-74042 56340_A0 56547_A0 NA
SDK-74060 All In earlier releases, SDK had some memory leaks in the file "src/bcm/esw/flexctr/flex_ctr.c", "src/bcm/esw/flexctr/flex_ctr_egress.c" and "src/bcm/esw/flexctr/flex_ctr_ingress.c". These have been fixed in this release by adding memory protection.
SDK-74062 56460_A0 In this release, support warmBoot for the ETH LM/DM feature has been implemented. Additional scache size of 198KB is required to support this feature.
SDK-74095 SDK-69084 All In previous releases for Triumph3 devices false station may exist in L2_MOD_FIFO if packets with the same DA and VlanID were sent in a high rate. False callbacks would be produced due to the false station move. In this release some judgements were added to check whether the station move is a real station move. No false callback appears due to the judgements.
SDK-74121 88670_A0 Fixed 88x7x issue where egress multicast replications may have been sent out of order.
SDK-74149 88650_A0 88650_B0 88660_A0 88670_A0 SGMII default speed is changed to 1G.
SDK-74152 All This release fixes a compilation failure for previous GPL module release (sdk-6.4.3-gpl-modules.tar.gz).
SDK-74156 56960_A0 In previous releases, exit clean could cause segmentation fault when ALPM was enabled on Tomahawk. This has been fixed in this release.
SDK-74158 88660_A0 Support snooping OAM traffic to accelerated endpoints. To do that, a snoop command should be defined and a trap to the OAMP port should be connected to it. Once this is ready, it's possible to use bcm_oam_action_set to set the trap as the action to an accelerated endpoint and get the desired result. For a detailed example see acc_snoop_set in cint_oam.c
SDK-74213 88660_A0 In external TCAM,rollback was not supported when adding entries. It caused inconsistent behavior after adding entry fails. This issue was fixed and rollback process is executed after a failure.
SDK-74260 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, the API bcm_l3_egress_create would not share the hardware table EGR_MPLS_VC_AND_SWAP_LABEL_TABLE which would result in bcm_l3_egress_create returning BCM_E_RESOURCE. This issue is addressed in this release.
SDK-74262 56850_A2 In previous releases, point wasn't checked whether it is NULL point when the point wanted to allocate a block memory in _bcm_trident_trunk_block_mask function. This has been fixed by adding point allocation memory's judgment whether it is NULL point.
SDK-74270 56541_A0 56640_A0 NA
SDK-74318 56960_A0 This release adds fp_unlock before returning the status in bcm_esw_field_entry_enable_set when the chip type is Tomahawk and stage is ingress.
SDK-74327 All In previous releases, the API bcm_mpls_port_get_all wouldn't return the failover virtual port part of VPWS VPN. In this release bcm_mpls_port_get_all() also returns the failover port details.
SDK-74330 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 In previous releases, when line rate traffic was running on a Katana2 port configured in Hardware Linkscan mode, traffic drop was observed after warmboot. This issue was caused due to an incorrect link status update in Hardware linkscan mode based on software link status during link reload.

In this release, the issue has been fixed by retrieving link status from CMIC_MIIM_LINK_STATUS registers for ports configured in Hardware linkscan mode during warmboot.

SDK-74344 56860_A0 In previous releases, users would encounter Trident2+ simulator ports not coming up. To address this issue, the link status defaults to "up" for tsce_sim.
SDK-74345 53400_A0 This release adds support of bcmCosqStatOutPackets and bcmCosqStatOutBytes counters.
SDK-74346 56850_A0 NA
SDK-74378 88660_A0 OAM/BFD: Fixed bug for accelerated endpoints where the field tx_gport wasn't correctly returned in bcm_oam/bfd_endpoint_get() in case tx_gport was a LAG gport.
SDK-74399 88650_A0 In the previous release, the broadsync pll was initialized by default. In this release, the initializtion is controlled by soc feature.
SDK-74407 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, the service_tpid of a MPLS port would be obtained from the table SOURCE_VP, which caused an incorrect result. This has been addressed by getting the service_tpid from the table EGR_MPLS_VC_AND_SWAP_LABEL_TABLE for a network MPLS port and getting the service_tpid from the table EGR_L3_NEXT_HOP for a MPLS access port.
SDK-74421 All NA
SDK-74434 All Issue: UDF elements attached to any stage are stored/recovered to ingress stage control. During the warmboot recovery instead of checking the list of elements in ingress stage, look up stage udf entries were checked causing crash. Fix: This has been corrected to always recover from ingress stage.
SDK-74435 All In previous releases, the command 'dump socmem' would take up too much CPU time without releasing the CPU. This has been addressed by the monitoring task killing the thread as needed.
SDK-74439 56540_A0 Issue: Apollo2+ devices were not able to create 2K oam groups.

Fix: OAM group data structure has been initialized to 2047 for OAM group creation.

SDK-74448 88660_A0 P2P: Cross-connect creation (bcm_vswitch_cross_connect_add) can be defined to a drop or trap destination by using BCM_GPORT_BLACK_HOLE or a trap destination respectively. The deletion of a cross-connect (bcm_vswitch_cross_connect_delete) that was defined drop or trap was failed. After the fix, cross-connect deletion to any type of destinations succeeds.
SDK-74479 88660_A0 Bug fix - when creating an OAM remote MEP in 'continuity' state, a lifetime of at least 3.5 * the specified CCM-period would pass before a timeout event is triggered.
SDK-74509 All NA
SDK-74535 SDK-74240 56960_A0 In previous releases, LPM routes were not able to fit advertised 128k routes. In this release, IPv4 double wide mode is enabled and higher sharing ratio is now supported to get a higher utilization.
SDK-74552 56260_B0 56460_B0 Problem: Previously on Saber2, for a few IO configs, Error messages (WorseSpacing) were prompted during device initializaition.

Solution: These are warning messages are added for debugging any bandwidth reduction that might happen due to worst spacing in TDM cycle. For CMIC port, the design supports the required bandwidth even at this TDM spacing. In this release, the severity of the worst spacing log message is reduced only for CMIC port.

SDK-74589 56640_A0 NA
SDK-74590 56640_A1 NA
SDK-74591 56640_A0 NA
SDK-74592 56640_A0 NA
SDK-74594 56640_A0 NA
SDK-74595 56640_A0 NA
SDK-74596 56640_A0 NA
SDK-74614 56860_A0 In previous releases the bcm_port_pause_set API was not working as expected. This was due to the pause_control.tx_enable field being incorrectly set. This release corrects the issue.
SDK-74620 56540_A0 In former releases , calling functions of bcm_rpc_setup didnt check whether bcm_rpc_setup returned NULL pointer. In current release , NULL pointer checks on return of bcm_rpc_setup are added.
SDK-74623 56260_A0 56460_A0 In this release, the UPMep OAM key as DVP improvement done as part of SDK-67722 has been ported to the Saber2 platform.
SDK-74682 56640_A0 NA
SDK-74685 56643_B0 In previous releases, there was potential deadlock issue between MEM_LOCK and SOC_EMS_LOCK when L3 host entry added. This has been fixed by adding a MEM_LOCK before SOC_EMS_LOCK in esm_err_recovery_seq.
SDK-74699 56042_A0 56045_B0 56046_B0 56340_A0 56340M_A0 56342_A0 56342M_A0 56540_B0 56541_B0 56542_B0 56544_B0 56547_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 56643_A1 56643_B0 56644_A1 56644_B0 56649_B0 56847_A1 56849_A1 56842_A0 56844_A0 56845_A2 56846_A1 56850_A1 56850_A2 56860_A0 56960_A0 NA
SDK-74720 88670_A0 88950_a0 In this release support has been added for the following new FW controls: BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_FIRMWARE_BR_DFE_ENABLE BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_FIRMWARE_LP_DFE_ENABLE BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_FIRMWARE_DFE_ENABLE
SDK-74790 56540_A0 Problem: In previous releases, a Table Full error would occur after 257 fp entry installs and removes. Solution: This occurred due to TR3 egress interface information not being cleared upon an fp remove. In this release code has been added code to properly handle fp removes.
SDK-74791 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 Issues and Fixes: 1. Previously, UDF element flags and offset_byte warmboot sync and recover was not working properly. This has been corrected in this release. 2. In this release, the internal qualifier value pushed during warmboot sync is relative to the max value, so that the recovered value can be adjusted. 3. In previous releases, warmboot sync for UDF bitmap in group qset was not done, so UDF bitmap determination for a recovered group was not possible. In this release, code has been added to sync group UDF bitmap so that the recovery can be proper.
SDK-74796 56344_A0 In this release, configuration of RCPU operation added for external PTP TOP.
SDK-74798 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, advertisement inconsistency existed between advert_set and get calls in TSCMOD. In this release, a code fix is implemented for the case when AN mode register read back is zero, SW uses the internal states to decide what AN mode the users will use, based on configurations or API.
SDK-74812 All NA
SDK-74821 56846_A0 56850_A0 In previous releases, PFC mapping for TD+ could only be set class by class. This has been improved and multiple mappings can be set at the same time.
SDK-74823 All In previous releases, a function would return directly when drain cell fails. This has been fixed, the error value is recorded and the function doesn't return directly when drain cell fails.
SDK-74831 56460 In previous releases, egr port dscp flex counter did not work for some DSCP values. It was found that bcmStatGroupModeDscp mode for egress counters was reserving only 2 counter offset, instead it should have 64 counter offset group. This has been fixed in this release.
SDK-74935 56960_A0 Support for bcmCosqStatIngressPortPoolSharedBytesCurrent and bcmCosqStatIngressPortPoolSharedBytesPeak counters on Tomahawk has been added in this release.
SDK-74985 56340_A0 In previous releases, the parameter 'prio' in the API bcm_esw_vlan_mac_add would not take effect. This has been fixed.
SDK-74990 56340_A0 Earlier SDK releases had a typo which led to using hard code 0 instead of variable unit. This typo has been corrected in this SDK.
SDK-74993 88670_A0 In bcm_l3_route_add, IPv6 entries are converted from uint8 to uint32 and back to uint8 causing some endianness related byte swaps. Instead of using memcpy to convert from uint8 to uint32, the new implementation explicitly encodes from uint8 to uint32. This new implementation avoids endian related issues.
SDK-75002 56450_B0 56450_B1 In previous releases, iProc-based devices could enounter a corrupted DMA memory issue caused by cache invalidate. In this release, the u-boot and LDK patch move the kernel to non-ACP space and the settings let the DDR use 512MB space at 0x8000_0000 on CS0.
SDK-75019 56960_A0 In previous releases, an internal utility function in the call path of bcm_switch_hash_banks_config_set() expected a logical bank number to operate on. However, a physical bank number was being provided resulting in SOC_E_PARAM being returned. This has been corrected.
SDK-75026 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 In previous releases, The XPORT_PORT_ENABLE dynamic programming was causing the MMU credits to reset. This led to packets stuck as the MMU couldn't drain due to unavailability of credits. In this release, XPORT_PORT_ENABLE reprogramming is not required in-line with other platforms. MAC/PHY/EGR_EN reprogrammed is sufficient.
SDK-75040 88650_B1 88660_A0 OAM: Load balancing might cause wrong OAM behavior
SDK-75083 56960_A0 NA
SDK-75104 56960_A0 NA
SDK-75109 56260_A0 88670_A0 SAT: Two new BCM APIs bcm_sat_gtf_packet_<start/stop> are introduced to start/stop GTF packet generation. bcm_sat_gtf_packet_start is called after bcm_sat_gtf_packet_config. An example code for calling bcm_sat_gtf_packet_<start/stop> was added into CINT $SDK/src/examples/sat/cint_sat.c
SDK-75180 56340_A0 Issue: The UDF offset takes value from 0 to 63. But in KT/KT2/SB2 devices, values greater than 63 were getting programmed, this was an incorrect behavior. Fix: This is corrected by adding a check to only allow values less than 64.
SDK-75198 56860_A0 NA
SDK-75270 56960_A0 Freed pointer (allocated by counter module) accessed by field detach function, since counter thread detached before field module. This bug is fixed now.
SDK-75397 56850_A0 56960_A0 NA
SDK-75434 56860_A0 In previous releases, RERPKT errors occurred when changing speed from 10G to 1G for xe port. In this release, the XLMAC_RX_CTRL register STRICT_PREAMBLE field is programmed appropriately for 1G case.
SDK-75440 56850_A2 Issue: During group re-creation, when group selcodes were reset, group qualifiers offset was not cleared. This resulted in the qualifiers offset's not being updated as per the new selcodes. Fix: In this release we clear group qualifiers offset along with selcodes, now they are reconstructed as per the new selcodes.
SDK-75473 SDK-72036 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, port credit was changed unexpectedly during port enable process. This has been addressed by reloading credit during port enable process.
SDK-75538 56845_A2 NA
SDK-75557 56960_A0 In previous release, when bcmFieldActionNatEgressOverride action was configured on a 56960, the Nat id configured was lost after warmboot. This issue is fixed in 6.4.6 by calculating the NAT ID from Hardware and filling it back into internal structures.
SDK-75563 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 In earlier releases the memory id of the table WRED_PARITY_ERROR_BITMAP may become over-witten. In this release, this issue has been corrected.
SDK-75567 88650_A0 bcm_vlan_translate_action_range_add() allowed by mistake to add two vlan ranges, which will have the same entry and cause vlan compression ranges stop working. In this release,this issue has been addressed by modifying the range key to avoid using the same entry for two vlan ranges.
SDK-75651 All In previous releases, there was no way to program the register EGR_ETAG_MULTICAST_RANGE. In this release, this has been fixed by extending the API bcm_switch_control_set.
SDK-75677 88660_A0 88670_A0 Required changes in SDK in order to support KBP-SDK 1.3.8 for external TCAM and KAPS are introduced. KBP-SDK 1.3.8 fixes an inflated memory issue.
SDK-75751 56860_A0 NA
SDK-75773 88650_A0 OAM/BFD - When updating a remote endpoint the continuity state (or LOC state) is reserved, even if using the BCM_OAM_ENDPOINT_FAULT_CCM_TIMEOUT flag.
SDK-75784 56840_A0 56846_A0 In previous releases, the API bcm_mpls_vpn_id_create would return a value of BCM_E_EXISTS when an invalid MPLS VPN ID was used. This has been addressed by returning a value of BCM_E_PARAM.
SDK-76062 SDK-76441 56960_A0 L3 extended view is not relocating enough scache memory for data storage. This is fixed now
SDK-76182 56960_A0 Warmboot on 6.4.5 to 6.4.5 may not recover bcmFieldActionEgressMask and bcmFieldActionEgressPortsAdd actions properly. However, upgrade will not have any issues.
SDK-76223 88670_A0 In the previous release, HG IF doesn't work with core-1 since XGS MAC Extender functions didn't take input core id as parameter. In this release, this issue has been addressed by replacing default core id with input core id.
SDK-76350 88660_A0 In the previous release, the UDP checksum calculation missed one byte in the the UDP pseudo header that caused the checksum value not right In this release, the above issue has been fixed.
SDK-76367 88660_A0 For previous release, BFD_IPV6_YOUR_DISCR_NOT_FOUND doesn't point to valid destination. For this release, change the SDK to add trap code BFD_IPV6_YOUR_DISCR_NOT_FOUND to point to Host CPU.
SDK-76447 88660_A0 Having ELK Interlaken in the system will cause for dynamically adding CAUI port to fail. Fixed
SDK-76901 All This release fixes a compilation failure for previous GPL module release (sdk-6.4.3-gpl-modules.tar.gz).




Section 6: Unresolved Issues for 6.4.6

The following issues are unresolved in version 6.4.6 of the SDK.

Number CSP # Chips Release Notes
SDK-33686 389108 56634_A0 If a MiM virtual port has statistics enabled for it and if such MiM port is replaced using BCM API bcm_mim_port_add( ) along with flag BCM_MIM_PORT_REPLACE then the statistics of that MiM port might be lost.
SDK-45075 All When an interrupt occurs on different blocks of the same type (e.g. multiple FMAC blocks), the count will be accumulated in the same counter. For example RX-LOS interrupt may occur on different FMAC blocks, and counted as same recurring event, although it is in fact a different interrupt. This may affect corrective action in case it is different for a recurring event, in the case if recurring-threshold for this event is crossed.
SDK-46556 621213 88650_A0 88650_B0 88650_B1 bcm_l2_cache_delete() API does not delete general_trap entry configuration in HW
SDK-51978 88650_A0 In a device with channelized CPU ports, where some of the CPU ports are Higig and some not, the WB wont preserve the Higig indication correctly.
SDK-54219 744517 88650_B1 In ARAD B1, VxLAN/L2GRE packet size of 236B-299B will be dropped by EPNI if the packet needs to be terminated. Workaround is introduced in FP CINT: cint_field_ingress_large_termination.c
SDK-54488 88650_A0 In Field Processor, when creating a cascaded field group, a failure might occur in key allocation in case the key ID is already determined. To be investigated.
SDK-54623 88660_A0 In Field Processor, when creating a field group, false error messages are printed when operation succeeds (return value indicates success). To be fixed.
SDK-56851 767727 88650_B1 88660_A0 The guarantee hardware mechanism only guaranteed the resource (BDs). The number of BDs used is not smaller than the used buffers, but there are three buffer types and not each buffer type can be used for any packet.
SDK-65720 88650_B1 88660_A0 bcm_cosq_port_mapping_set() configures TC mapping profiles, the API receives a queue and map it to a TC mapping profile. The a TC mapping profiles are configured internally, bcm_cosq_port_mapping_set() does not fully utilize the TC mapping profiles since there will be an unused profile, that hold the transition states of the mappings.
SDK-66650 88660_A0 OAM: calls to bcm_oam_endpoint_action_set() affect all other non-accelerated MEPs defined on the MEPs LIF. Additionally, the following (incorrect) behavior has been observed: 1. Create MIP on a LIF 2. Create an accelerated Up endpoint on same LIF 3. Call bcm_oam_endpoint_action_set() for the MIP 4. Destroy the MIP 5. Create a new MIP on the LIF. After step 5 one half of the MIP will behave with the default configurations and the other half will behave with the configurations defined on the first MIP.
SDK-67436 88650_B1 88650_B0 88650_A0 88660_A0 Accessing Field Processor APIs with different configuration threads may fail due to wrong lock coding.
SDK-69747 88660_A0 88670_A0 For some cases, If the application initialization in bcm_attach(), fails after bcm_dpp_counter_init(). The counter processor background thread is not disabled, Which can cause a segmentation fault. until there is a fix, in case of an error call: bcm_dpp_counter_background_collection_enable_set(unit, FALSE); to disable the background thread.
SDK-71969 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 The BCM56850 supports UDF in the VFP but requests for UDF rules may result in a "feature unavailable" error condition.
SDK-74220 88670_A0 EPNI and EGQ in TM mode counter pointers are are not constructed well in QMX/Jericho devices.
SDK-76947 56960_A0 This is see on a TH with a Furia external PHY.




Section 7: Device and Platform Support

The section describes all devices, platforms, and operating systems that are supported by this release.

BCM84074_A0 84728 Quad KR to XAUI (Firmware version 0x124. Bring-up)
BCM82381_A2 82381 Dual 100GbE with CAUI4 to CAUI4 / Dual 40GbE XLPPI to XLAUI/ Octal 10GbE SFI to XFI port. Firmware version D00E Driver supports 100G CR4, 40G SR4/LR4/CR4 and 10G SR/LR Functionality Supported: PHY Reset(Hard/soft), Link status, Speed and Interface configuration, port enable/disable, AN, Tx Training, remote/digital loopback, Polarity inversion, PRBS, Eyescan, DSC, PLL sequencer restart, Phy dump, FEC and Rx PMD lock. Driver Limitation : 1. Chip reset issues reset to all the ports that shares same PHY-ID(MDIO ADDR).
BCM82764_A2 82764 BCM82764 Dual 40GbE channels with Dual 40GbE XLPPI to XLAUI / Quad 40GbE PMA reverse bit MUX to convert 2x20G to XLPPI(4x10G) /CAUI4 to CAUI4 / Octal 10GbE SFI to XFI port. Firmware version D008. Driver supports 40G SR4/LR4/CR4/KR4 and 10G SR/LR/KR/CR Functionality Supported: Link status, Speed and Interface configuration, port enable/disable, Polarity inversion, Power set/get, PRBS, Eyescan, PLL sequencer restart, Phy dump, Rx PMD lock. remote/digital loopback set/get, PHY Reset(Hard/soft), DSC, Phy dump, Tx lane control set/get Tx set/Get, Rx set/Get and Tx Training Driver Limitation : 1. Speed change is only supported through config.bcm. Speed switch through flex port is not supported in this release. 2. Chip reset issues reset to all the ports those shares same PHY-ID(MDIO ADDR). 3. Tx Training may not finish on some 10G lanes(Line side).
BCM84858_A0 84858 Quad 10GBASE-T Transceiver. Firmware version 1.01.04 - Beta
BCM84858_B0 84858 Quad 10GBASE-T Transceiver. Firmware version 1.02.02 - Beta
BCM84856_B0 84856 Dual 10GBASE-T Transceiver. Firmware version 1.02.02 - Beta


Section 7.3: Operating Systems

The SDK provides the SAL and BDE abstraction implementations necessary for running the SDK on the following operating systems. See the Platform Guide (56XX-PG818-R) for instructions on porting the SDK to another platform.

Section 8: Release Media

The Software Development Kit is released as a gzipped tar file on the Broadcom Customer Support Portal, http://support.broadcom.com. The Network Switching Software Platform Guide, also available on the Customer Support Portal, provides documentation on the various components, the source directory layout, how to build the release for various platforms, and how to customize and port the software to new platforms.



Section 9: Support

Questions, feedback, and/or suggestions should be sent to your Broadcom FAE.

Section 11.1: EDITLINE License terms and conditions 

This package was obtained from the following location, and was modified
for purposes of inclusion into the SOC diagnostics shell.

Removed files:
        MANIFEST Make.os9 Makefile os9.h sysos9.c testit.c unix.h

Added files:
        sysvxworks.c Makefile

Changed functionality:
        Merged unix.h into editline.h
        M-P and M-N now behave like tcsh.
        list_history(count) routine displays history
        Commented out completion
        Changed rl_complete and rl_list_possib into caller-settable
                global functions
        Don't ring bell on TAB if word is already complete

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Index of /afs/athena.mit.edu/contrib/sipb/src/editline

[     ] Name                   Last modified     Size  Description
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------

 [DIR]  Parent Directory       11-May-99 03:40      -
 [   ]  MANIFEST               07-Jul-97 11:20     1k
 [   ]  Make.os9               07-Jul-97 11:20     1k
 [   ]  Makefile               01-Sep-97 00:34     2k
 [   ]  complete.c             07-Jul-97 11:20     4k
 [   ]  editline.3             07-Jul-97 11:20     5k
 [   ]  editline.c             07-Jul-97 11:20    25k
 [   ]  editline.h             07-Jul-97 11:20     2k
 [   ]  os9.h                  07-Jul-97 11:20     1k
 [   ]  sysos9.c               07-Jul-97 11:20     1k
 [   ]  sysunix.c              07-Jul-97 11:20     3k
 [   ]  testit.c               07-Jul-97 11:20     1k
 [   ]  unix.h                 07-Jul-97 11:20     1k

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------

$Revision: 1.7 $

This is a line-editing library.  It can be linked into almost any
program to provide command-line editing and recall.

It is call-compatible with the FSF readline library, but it is a
fraction of the size (and offers fewer features).  It does not use
standard I/O.  It is distributed under a "C News-like" copyright.

Configuration is done in the Makefile.  Type "make testit" to get
a small slow shell for testing.

This contains some changes since the posting to comp.sources.misc:
    -   Bugfix for completion on absolute pathnames.
    -   Better handling of M-n versus showing raw 8bit chars.
    -   Better signal handling.
    -   Now supports termios/termio/sgttyb ioctl's.
    -   Add M-m command to toggle how 8bit data is displayed.
The following changes, made since the last public release, come from
J.G. Vons <vons@cesar.crbca1.sinet.slb.com>:
    -   History-searching no longer redraws the line wrong
    -   Added ESC-ESC as synonym for ESC-?
    -   SIGQUIT (normally ^\) now sends a signal, not indicating EOF.
    -   Fixed some typo's and unclear wording in the manpage.
    -   Fixed completion when all entries shared a common prefix.
    -   Fixed some meta-char line-redrawing bugs.

Enjoy,
        Rich $alz
        <rsalz@osf.org>

 Copyright 1992,1993 Simmule Turner and Rich Salz.  All rights reserved.

 This software is not subject to any license of the American Telephone
 and Telegraph Company or of the Regents of the University of California.

 Permission is granted to anyone to use this software for any purpose on
 any computer system, and to alter it and redistribute it freely, subject
 to the following restrictions:
 1. The authors are not responsible for the consequences of use of this
    software, no matter how awful, even if they arise from flaws in it.
 2. The origin of this software must not be misrepresented, either by
    explicit claim or by omission.  Since few users ever read sources,
    credits must appear in the documentation.
 3. Altered versions must be plainly marked as such, and must not be
    misrepresented as being the original software.  Since few users
    ever read sources, credits must appear in the documentation.
 4. This notice may not be removed or altered.

 Modification log:
 25Aug92  (W.Metzenthen) Changed malloc() call to calloc() in makebitmap()
          to remove bugs under Linux. Changed a few '^' to the correct '~'.
          General tidying. Recognize Linux via the __linux__ symbol.
          Main change based upon suggestion by Wolfgang Thiel.
 07Sep99  Changed large amounts of stuff to simplify  --Curt McDowell


Section 11.3: CINT parser license terms and conditions 

The C code for the CINT parser was generated by using GNU Bison parser
generator from the file cint_grammar.y   CINT is an optional diagnostic
tool that can be included in your system  by adding CINT to the
FEATURE_LIST in SDK compilation flags.

Removed files:
        None

Added files:
        None

Changed functionality:
        None

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/* A Bison parser, made by GNU Bison 2.4.1.  */

/* Skeleton implementation for Bison's Yacc-like parsers in C

      Copyright (C) 1984, 1989, 1990, 2000, 2001, 2002, 2003, 2004, 2005, 2006
   Free Software Foundation, Inc.

   This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
   it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
   the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
   (at your option) any later version.

   This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
   but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
   MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
   GNU General Public License for more details.

   You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
   along with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.  */

/* As a special exception, you may create a larger work that contains
   part or all of the Bison parser skeleton and distribute that work
   under terms of your choice, so long as that work isn't itself a
   parser generator using the skeleton or a modified version thereof
   as a parser skeleton.  Alternatively, if you modify or redistribute
   the parser skeleton itself, you may (at your option) remove this
   special exception, which will cause the skeleton and the resulting
   Bison output files to be licensed under the GNU General Public
   License without this special exception.

   This special exception was added by the Free Software Foundation in
   version 2.2 of Bison.  */

/* C LALR(1) parser skeleton written by Richard Stallman, by
   simplifying the original so-called "semantic" parser.  */

The Circuit Emulation Services (CES) driver code provided herewith is provided
by BATM Advanced Communications Ltd (BATM) and is subject to licensing agreement
between BATM and Broadcom Corporation.


Section 11.5: BIGDIGITS license terms and conditions 

Contains BIGDIGITS multiple-precision arithmetic code originally
written by David Ireland, copyright (c) 2001-11 by D.I. Management
Services Pty Limited <www.di-mgt.com.au>, and is used with
permission.

David Ireland and DI Management Services Pty Limited make no
representations concerning either the merchantability of this software
or the suitability of this software for any particular purpose. It is
provided "as is" without express or implied warranty of any kind. Our
liability will be limited exclusively to the refund of the money you
paid us for the software, namely nothing. By using the software you
expressly agree to such a waiver. If you do not agree to the terms, do
not use the software.


Section 11.6: APIMODE parser license terms and conditions 

The C code for the APIMODE parser was generated by using GNU Bison parser
generator from the file api_grammar.y   APIMODE is an optional diagnostics
shell interface that can be included in your system  by adding APIMDOE to the
FEATURE_LIST in SDK compilation flags.
See Section 11.3: CINT parser license terms and conditions for the Bison licence.


Section 11.7: Wind River Systems license terms and conditions

See WRS_LICENSE.pdf contained in each systems/vxworks subdirectory.





Section 12: Resolved Issues for 6.4.5

The following issues are resolved in version 6.4.5 of the SDK.

Number CSP # Chips Release Notes For 6.4.5
SDK-34820 SDK-35233 All Fixed issue with reuse of EGR_MPLS_VC_AND_SWAP_LABEL_TABLE entry.
SDK-35214 SDK-36940 442408 56620_B0 Fixed bcm_l2_traverse API to be agnostic of VPN deletion.
SDK-37408 All Fixed control type bcmSwitchDirectedMirroring of the bcm_esw_switch_control_set() for the Higig2-Lite ports
SDK-39296 SDK-40129 519299 56689_B0 56685_B0 56685_A0 56684_A0 56680_A1 56680_A0 56639_A0 56638_A0 56636_A0 56634_A0 56629_B0 56628_B0 56628_A1 56626_B0 56624_B0 56624_A0 56624_A1 56620_B0 56334_B0 56334_A0 Fixed bcm_l2_replace for matching . Previously it was incorrectly programmed to match with VFI 0 instead of the specified VFI number.
SDK-44788 56540_A0 In earlier releases, the BUCKETSIZE field of FP_STORM_CONTROL_METERS was not set correctly for Triumph3 devices resulting in possible traffic loss. In this release, the BUCKETSIZE field is now set correctly.
SDK-45309 616889 All Changed all strtok to sal_strtok_r so that functions are reentrant .
SDK-48023 56640_B0 In earlier releases TR tests and error injection function for Triumph3 SER was not supported. In this release, added support for TR tests and error injection function for Triumph3 SER.
SDK-51807 709294 56640_B0 In previous releases, for Triumph3 devices the L2_LEARN_INSERT_FAILURE interrupt was not handled properly. The L2 overflow interrupt handler was called regardless l2_learn_insert_failure mask enabled or not. This has been fixed and so that the L2 learn insert failure functions properly when l2 overflow is disabled.
SDK-52225 56324_A0 Added proper mask value when writing to register ANALOG_TX_AMP
SDK-55702 SDK-72530 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 In former release the method of VLAN MAC delete was incorrect in that it parsed memory incorrectly thus VLAN MAC modifications could not be supported for 3000 times , now method of VLAN MAC delete has been modified and VLAN MAC modifications can be supported for 3000 times .
SDK-55820 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 Problem: bcm_esw_field_data_qualifier_ip_protocol_add does not allows a relative offset which is multiple of 2 Solution: Newer devices have 2 byte UDF chunks. Made changes to allow relative offset which is a multiple of 2 in function bcm_esw_field_data_qualifier_ip_protocol
SDK-56502 88670_A0 MPLS PORT: Hierarchical Protection VPLS support added using two level of Hierarchical-FEC mechanism. Example can be seen in cint_vswitch_vpls_hvpls.c. For more details please refer to 88670-PG1XX-R.
SDK-56685 773628 56440_A0 Previously, packets would become stuck in MMU if packets were transmitted to a port with a remote fault. This has been corrected, and the ports with remote fault are removed from the port_bitmap list of TX list of ports.
SDK-57241 780221 56850_A2 In previous releases, the API bcm_port_vlan_member_set would reset the VP_GROUP value which was programmed previously by application. This has been fixed by preventing the modification of the value set by application.
SDK-57766 782524 56850_A0 84328_A0 In previous releases, the "phy control <hg#> dump" and phy loopback commands did not work properly after setting the phy_pcs_repeater config variable. This has been fixed and now the PHY infrastructure for loopback and phy controls has been modified to be directed to external PHY if present.
SDK-58187 88650_B1 In previous releases, livelink eyescan was not working on lane 1 of a RXAUI port. In this release, a fix has been added for the dual lane port eyescan so that eyescan can be run on the second lane of the port.
SDK-58295 88650_A0 88660_A0 88670_A0 Enabled creating FMQ 0 in enhanced mode too.
SDK-59391 799550 88660_A0 time of execution of problematic part was reduced from few mili secs to few tens of micro secs
SDK-59547 88650_A0 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 Fixed bug that when a trunk member is added with BCM_TRUNK_MEMBER_INGRESS_DISABLE, it is not returned with bcm_trunk_get()

the fix include creating a new sw db to maintain lag info. please note that there are still restrictions regarding using the different flags of the trunk members - there could be no replications when adding member with INGRESS_DISABLE and there could be no replications when removing a member with EGRESS_DISABLE

SDK-61469 826126 88660_A0 A new RX Trap flag BCM_RX_TRAP_DROP_AND_LEARN was added for egress traps only (for egress learning). When set, the packet is dropped and egress learning is taking place.
SDK-62811 839284 88650_B1 88660_A0 In Ingress PMF, when using action bcmFieldActionRedirectMcast, if the multicast ID value that is set is the result of bcm_multicast_create, it may include an encoding, in which case the Field API returns an error. This is fixed.
SDK-63557 88670_A0 OAM performance monitoring (loss/delay) can now use a report interrupt to retrieve information. Consult the user manual for details.
SDK-64289 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 Support for UDF qualifiers for VCAP/VFP stage has been added in this release.
SDK-64453 SDK-57801 56440_B0 In this release, the Flow control - LLS_FC_CONFIG.FC_DROP_DEQUEUE is enabled for Katana.
SDK-65040 All BCM_PTP_RXMAP_xxx #defines have been moved from internal to external header file.
SDK-65075 853197 88650_A0 88670_A0 ISQ and FMQ ports consume HRs but don't mark them as used in the allocation manager - Fixed
SDK-65200 56450_B1 56457_B0 56452_B0 56450_A0 56450_B0 56455_A0 56456_A0 56456_B0 5645_A0 In previous releases, the script kt2_config.soc did not set some polarity inversions correctly and would set config variables in an inconsistent manner. In this release, kt2conifg.soc has been updated to function unit independently and removed polarity flips for WC ports 25 and 36 when interface is not XFI.
SDK-65278 825648 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 In earlier releases, the Triumph3 devices were unable to change policer from bcmPolicerModeCommitted mode to any other mode. This has been fixed in this release.
SDK-65369 854365 88030_B0 This release adds support to allow lane > 3 for the eyescan tools for the 100G or ILK port.
SDK-65382 56820_B0 In early releases, the speed checking logic for a common loop back test was not handled properly for all chips. This defect has been addressed in this release.
SDK-65611 851016 56304_B1 In this release, forced cl72 support has been added for 42G on Helix4.
SDK-65718 862204 88660_A0 VLAN-Port: Introduce a new flag BCM_VLAN_PORT_VSI_BASE_VID to set VSI according to (Packet.Outer-VLAN+VPORT.VSI) Note: Flag can't be used when VSWITCH VPN is introduced (i.e. it doesn't work with bcm_vswitch_port_add). For more information see cint cint_vlan_basic_bridge.c
SDK-66002 851445 56636_A0 56636_B0 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 All Previously, in a stacking setup traffic would be affected when replacing failover interface with new remote interface to the network side VPWS. The issue was fixed in this release.
SDK-66264 88660_A0 88670_A0 In Egress PMF, when setting qualifier bcmFieldQualifyBypassFilter using bcm_petra_field_qualify_BypassFilter32, a new possible value is introduced - BCM_FIELD_FILTER_BYPASS_ALL, such that: 1. BCM_FIELD_FILTER_BYPASS_ALL - only Bypass-Filter is set. 2. BCM_FIELD_FILTER_SA_DISABLE - only Exclude-Src is set. 3. BCM_FIELD_FILTER_ALL - equal to setting both BCM_FIELD_FILTER_BYPASS_ALL and BCM_FIELD_FILTER_SA_DISABLE. Both the Bypass-Filter and Exclude-Src are set.
SDK-66285 88650_A0 88650_B1 IRE configuration is restored after running nif recovery sequence
SDK-66459 88650_A0 88670_A0 Added support for tx enable/disable
SDK-66630 88650_B1 88660_A0 inaccessible memories soft error recovery: There are some memories in the design which does not have CPU access. Therefore they cannot be fixed by SW shadow mechanism upon soft error event. After reviewing the SW corrective action upon soft reset event for these memories, we found that SW corrective actions for some of them need to be changed. RsqFifoControl, RpfMemory, lknTx0LbsAdapMem, lknTx1LbsAdapMem IlknRxAlgnMem[0-23] (these memories should not cause soft reset - action changed to print log only) IlknTx0LnExpnMem[0-23] & IlknTx1LnExpnMem[24-35] (these memories should cause soft reset - action changed to soft reset).
SDK-66637 88650_A0 88650_B0 88660_A0 MPLS PORT: bcm_mpls_port_get of ingress only gport does not return label+push profile information
SDK-66690 56260_A0 Implemented the loss and delay measurement for Ethernet Network according to the ITU.T Y.1731 standard. ITU.T Y.1731 standard specifies Ethernet OAM with two performance matrices, one for packet loss measurement (LM) and one for packet delay measurement (DM) for Ethernet network. These protocols support both Pro-active and On-demand performance measurements on a query-response model. This implementation is used by calling End-point create with Loss/Delay flags, Loss/Delay Add/ Get/Delete APIs. The implementation also includes Synthetic Loss Measurement(SLM) calculation for Loss measurement with synthetic frames.

Please enable ETH_LM_DM in feature list in SDK makefile Make.local to enable ETH LM/DM.

SDK-66708 56450_B0 Problem: There are a few ports where our APIs don't take into account remappings applied using config variables such as xgxs_tx_lane_map. One specific case is when they call "bcm_switch_control_set(0, bcmSwitchSynchronousPortClockSourceBkup, 30);

Solution: Correcting the port remap to select L1_WC1_RECOVERY_CLK1_MUX_SEL from register TOP_MISC_CONTROL_3.

SDK-66840 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 Added new APIs to configure LIF ranges, and mapping to select LIF counting. bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_range_set() - Configure LIF ranges. bcm_stat_counter_lif_counting_set() - Mapping LIF ranges.
SDK-66982 56450_A0 56450_B0 56640_A0 In this release, the existing APIs bcm_l2_ring_replace, bcm_failover_ring_config_set and bcm_failover_ring_config_get have been extended to support the operations fast_flush, forced_flooding and learn_disabling based on VPN.
SDK-67022 88650_B0 CRPS: Getting high counter IDs is fixed.
SDK-67047 56960_A0 eyescan is fixed to match dsc dump.
SDK-67374 56450_B0 Previously, traffic would be broken if bcm_multicast_egress_subscriber_add was called twice with same parameters. In this release, the SDK will return the error BCM_E_EXISTS.
SDK-67497 56440_A0 56440_B0 56449_B0 56444_A1 56445_A0 56442_B0 56445_A1 56447_B0 56445_B0 56448_B0 All 56446_B0 56443_B0 56441_B0 56440_A1 While validating whether hw slice movement is possible the number of free counters required was calculated incorrectly. Have rectified the calculation mistake
SDK-67518 88670_A0 MPLS PORT: Add support in BCM_MPLS_LEARN_ENCAP flag. This flag enables two pointers forwarding scheme. In this scheme, PWE and the MPLS underneath information are both set in the EEDB and pointed by two different pointers from the ingress. The learning information is PWE OutLif + MPLS FEC. MPLS FEC in this case should be set using BCM_L3_ENCAP_SPACE_OPTIMIZED. See example in cint_vswitch_vpls.c
SDK-67556 56260_A0 Broadsync Firmware is now supported for BCM56260/56460.
SDK-67783 88660_A0 88670_A0 BFD: 1. Properly set the TX rate. The actual TX rate was 3.33 MS slower than what the user requested. 2. When updating the TX rate (using the bcm_bfd_endpoint_create() API with the BCM_BFD_ENDPOINT_UPDATE flag), the change should take place immediately
SDK-67843 56846_A1 56846_A0 Problem : EFP rule was not hit when ipv6 src/dst address was configured Solution : The programming of ipv6 fields in efp_slice_control when srcip6/dstip6 is configured has been corrected.
SDK-67852 All Problem: Redundant return statements in _field_group_add_selcodes_install Solution : Removed redundant return statements.
