SDK-67885 56850_A2 56854_B0 56850_A0 56850_A1 56855_A2 56854_A0 56855_A0 56854_A2 56853_A0 56851P_A2 56851P_A1 56852_A2 56853_A2 56853_A1 56852_A0 56852_A1 All 56851_A1 56851_A2 56851_A0 In previous releases, there was a chance that illegal packet length could be passed and CMIC tx would stop working. The issue has been fixed in this release by adding packet length validity check before CMIC tx takes place.
SDK-68007 54385_B0 In this release, EEE enable in fiber mode (BCM543XX) has been disallowed.
SDK-68040 56640_A1 56640_B0 56640_A0 In earlier releases, ""out of memory"" was printed upon booting up the Triumph3 devices if there was EXT_IPV6_128_DEFIP without EXT_IPV6_64_DEFIP presented in the config.bcm. This has been addressed by fixing the ""Segment Fault"" which would occur when running the ""rc"" command if only one of EXT_IPV6_128_DEFIP and EXT_IPV6_64_DEFIP was presented in config.bcm for Triumph3. Also, fixed the incorrect indexes of EXT_SRC_HIT_BITS_IPV6_128, EXT_DST_HIT_BITS_IPV6_128 and EXT_TCAM_VBIT_DEFIP_IPV6_128 for Triumph3.
SDK-68053 All 88660_A0 The flag BCM_BFD_ENDPOINT_RDI_CLEAR_ON_LOC_CLEAR should not be used when creating or updating BFD endpoint.
SDK-68127 56850_A0 Two new types bcmCosqControlUCEgressPool, bcmCosqControlMCEgressPool are defined to let user to decide egress pool of which queue should be set.
SDK-68143 88750_A0 Fix RTP_MCT Interrupt Handling bug.
SDK-68207 All Fixed issue with TR 6 (the bug was in the test).
SDK-68219 All Problem : Noisy print statement in _field_tr3_external_policy_counters. Solution : Removed noisy print statement.
SDK-68263 56960_A0 Added Color Independent action in common actions init for Tomahawk.
SDK-68280 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 88670_A0 TDM OPTIMIZE FTMH CUD (copy unique data) stamping: When working at TDM optimize mode, user can choose to stamp CUD to Multicast packets FTMH header in order to pass this information to the BCM886XX peer. this option was not available to user till now. in order to support this option "custom_feature_tdm_eg_editing_is_cud_stamping_type1" SoC property added. If this SOC property is set all the TDM ports in which configured to perform custom external editing (bcmFabricTdmEditingCustomExternal) will stamp CUD to Multicast packet FTMH header.
SDK-68354 SDK-67687 All The function _bcm_mirror_destination_match is called when user wants to verify whether two tunnel destinations are the same or not. In previous releases the function header stated "limited match utility". In this release, this has been addressed by maintaining the original behavior and adding a matching description of mirror destinations with tunnel type in the documentation.
SDK-68366 56450_A0 56450_B0 In Katana2 devices, link changes in newly formed flex ports were not reported correctly during hardware linkscan. In addition, newly formed flex ports were by default set to software linkscan mode even when they were configured to function in hardware linkscan.

This was due to incorrect mapping of ports with external physical links. The CMIC_EXT_PHY_ADDR_MAP register that maps the external phy address of the links to the corresponding ports was not getting updated after the flex operation.

This issue has been fixed by initializing hardware linkscan on the newly formed flex ports during port attach sequence, which in turn updates the address map register.

Linkscan thread has also been modified to set the linkscan mode of a port based on the configured linkscan mode bitmaps instead setting to software mode by default.

SDK-68419 88660_A0 Attempting to delete an entry in LEM/ILM with mpls_termination_label_index_enable = 1 and bcm_mpls_tunnel_switch_delete leads to an error. The solution is to pass action==SWAP.
SDK-68420 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 This release adds support for Higig Lite on Katana2.
SDK-68466 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 There was an issue which caused S-Channel operation to timeout occasionally. This was due to lack of table access protection in the API bcm_l2_traverse(). It has been fixed.
SDK-68523 56340_A0 Problem: Buffer space allocated in _bcm_field_fb_entry_move would result in stack overflow. Solution: In this release, the static allocation was moved to dynamic.
SDK-68579 88670_A0 In the previous release, Jericho used the same macro ARAD_PP_EG_LL_ENCAP_REMARK_PROFILE_INDEX_MAX for exp remark profile as Arad. And Jericho EPNI remark profile configuration was not correct. In this release, it has been addressed by changing this macro to 4 for Arad and 8 for Jericho and change Jericho EPNI remark profile configuration from 0x3210 to 0x7643210.
SDK-68605 All In earlier releases an issue existed resulting in a failure to send tagged packets with "tx 1 file=xxx". This was the result of a typographical coding error which has been corrected.
SDK-68607 56820_A0 56820_B0 In earlier releases, scorpion devices were lacking ser correction for mmu memory and the ability to clear mmu parity errors. This release added the ser correction for mmu memory, now mmu parity errors will be cleared.
SDK-68641 88650_A0 88660_A0 Enabled configuring the free BDB threshold (system-RED) above 64K up to 256K.
SDK-68686 88750_B0 Fix bug in RTP MCT interrupt handling
SDK-68689 All In previous releases, a dead lock issue could happen due to port lock and mirror lock's sequences being different in functions "bcm_mirror_port_get" and "bcm_esw_port_control_set". The issue has been fixed by adjusting port lock and mirror lock's sequences.
SDK-68773 56640_B0 When the GLP is TGID, the whole GLP should be used as TGID. But the earlier code set the module ID just like GLP was a normal Port. Current SDK has corrected this mistake.
SDK-68808 56240_B0 In previous SDK releases, the size of LPM tables (L3_DEFIP_ONLY, L3_DEFIP_DATA_ONLY, and L3_DEFIP_HIT_ONLY) were incorrectly programmed for BCM5624x devices. This has been corrected in this release.
SDK-68817 88950_a0 FE1600 change in logging level for MIIM register access (verbose to debug).
SDK-68880 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 ISSUE: In previous releases, the Burst parameter in bcm_port_rate_egress_set/get() APIs, was considering value in kbits, where 1kbits=1024bits.

ROOTCAUSE: While converting values, inside APIs, from kbits to bits and vice versa; wrong values were used.

SOLUTION: The code has been modified to accept Burst parameter such that 1kbits=1000bits.

SDK-68883 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 All In previous releases, there was no support for LOCAL_SA field in L2 API structure for Triumph3 devices. In this release LOCAL_SA field can be obtained from L2 hardware entries as BCM_L2_NATIVE.
SDK-68888 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, the higig ports took a long time to initialize to 42G. This initialization has been optimized in this release.
SDK-68889 56640_B0 In earlier releases, all L2 entries would be deleted while using bcm_l2_ring_replace() to delete some L2 entries. In this release, bcm_l2_ring_replace() delete L2 entries correctly.
SDK-69009 88670_A0 MPLS PORT: An ability to allocate p2p pwe outlif (no protection) in the eedb was added. This can be done by configuring MPLS tunnel FEC (bcm_l3_egress_create api) with flag BCM_L3_ENCAP_SPACE_OPTIMIZED set and then calling bcm_mpls_port_add with flag BCM_MPLS_PORT_COUNTED set. and create fec for the.
SDK-69018 88650_A0 Adding many channels on an channelized interface will cause for CGM resource failure - Fixed. From now on the CGM thresholds for reserved PD's is set to 0 for all the ports queues. It's possible to change the thresholds using bcm_petra_cosq_gport_threshold_set() with threshold_type=bcmCosqThresholdAvailablePacketDescriptors where the tc represents the relevant queue to update. Note - these values should be updated without traffic, for further information see Thresholds and Egress Queue Mapping in the User Manual.
SDK-69029 88750_A0 RTP_MCT shadowing: RTP_MCT is a special memory in a way that it is updated from other memory (RTP_MULTI_CAST_TABLE_UPDATE). Therefore this memory can't be shadowed and need to be excluded from memory shadow list. shadowing mechanism often used for soft error recovery upon such event. RTP_MCT memory doesn't use SW shadow mechanism in order to recover from this error. There is other SW routine for this purpose which does not involve SW shadow mechanism. Our default application does not shadow this memory. This fix prevents shadowing this memory. If user will try to do so, an error returned by the driver.
SDK-69082 56340_A0 Added the fix to avoid the whole reset for probing a new port while there is still active port on the same core
SDK-69085 88650_A0 88660_A0 88670_A0 Added a CLI diagnostic "kbp sdk_ver" to print the KBP lib version.
SDK-69089 88660_A0 added a new soc property,

custom_feature_do_not_update_action_size_in_billing_mode=1

when set ignores updating action size.

SDK-69099 88670_A0 API bcm_switch_control set() with type bcmSwitchL3UrpfMode was not setting the HW. Bug was fixed in Jericho, and now when setting the bcmSwitchL3UrpfMode the URPF mode is being configured.
SDK-69161 56850_A0 56850_A1 All In previous releases, flicking the thread linkscan off and on repeatedly would lead to traffic loss. This has been addressed by maintaining the proper link change value when linkscan is reopened.
SDK-69169 56440_A0 56440_A1 56440_B0 Unable to setup L3 MPLS flow using BCM Shell commands. Enhanced the "mpls tunnel " command to accept Ingress Interface as a parameter which is required to program the tunnel termination correctly.
SDK-69186 56640_B0 56643_B0 In previous releases, if ISM UFT was used by ESM, the banks of UFT were allocated through the properties of External Tcam. In some situations banks of UFT were re-allocated, resulting in the initialized size of UFT banks for ESM being insufficient. This has been fixed to avoid re-allocating the banks.
SDK-69211 88660_A0 By setting the sampling_ratio field of an OAM remote endpoint or BFD endpoint, event based punting of packets can be enabled and the value determines once in how many events this punting would occur. Setting this field to 0 disables the event based punting (error based punting happens always either way). Legal values are 0-8. Other values are illegal for this field.
SDK-69217 88660_A0 In Metering, when MEF hierarchical meters are configured, lower buckets in the meter can use excess credits from top buckets (using Max Committed rate) without generating their own credits (using CIR).
SDK-69218 88650_B1 88660_A0 In FCoE, a new mode for NPV switch is added (enable this mode by setting the SOC property fcoe_npv_bridge_mode to 1). In this mode, for downstream traffic, the packet egresses with the original destination MAC address, and the NPV MAC address is the new source MAC address. For upstream traffic, the packet egresses with the original source MAC address, and the FCF mac address is the new destination mac address.
SDK-69228 56850_A0 56850_A1 In previous releases, the VRF info was not passed for attached flex counter with NON-ZERO VRF multicast route. As a result, a failure was returned for no route found. This has been addressed by passing the VRF info to find the matched multicast route.
SDK-69234 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 56641_A0 56642_A0 56643_A0 56643_A1 56643_B0 56644_A0 56644_A1 56644_B0 56645_A0 56648_A0 56648_B0 56649_A0 56649_B0 In previous releases, there was an issue in the API bcm_cosq_classifier_mapping_clear(), which occasionally caused an assertion failure and SDK crash. This has been fixed.
SDK-69253 88660_A0 OAM accelerated endpoint can be set on a LAG. The TX-GPort that is used by the OAMP is the trunk GPort. For an example, see cint_oam_endpoint_over_lag.c
SDK-69269 56640_A0 In earlier releases, on Triumph3 devices more than expected UFT space would be allocated for ESM, resulting into booting failure. In this release, the memory space is allocated correctly.
SDK-69274 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In earlier releases, setting BCM_L3_HIT could cause assert when adding ipv4/ipv6 route in ALPM mode. This issue has been resolved in this release.
SDK-69288 All In Parser, in case soc property bfd_ipv4_single_hop_extended is enabled, the UDP header is parsed twice, which causes wrong data to be passed forward (e.g., for 1588 UDP-based packets). This is fixed.
SDK-69306 88650_B1 88660_A0 MPLS PORT: Deletion of pwe with egress vc label==0 tesults in error. This is fixed.
SDK-69340 56850_A0 This release supports the ability to implement flexible, SOC-property-based configuration of Trident-2 EGR_1588_LINK_DELAY_64 registers.
SDK-69391 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 Previously in vpls case, the SDK did not support deletion and adding back of failover port before primary port was deleted. In this release support has been added to allow the deletion and then adding back of the failover port.
SDK-69396 88950_a0 PRBS recommended sequence is different from the example included in SD-6.4.4 ("src/examples/dcmn/cint_prbs.c"). The sequence fixed to first stop TX and then RX.
SDK-69406 88650_B1 88660_A0 In FEC, when protection is used, the failover_id of the even FEC wasn't extracted correctly when this FEC record was requested by FEC index. This is now fixed.
SDK-69437 56334_A0 56334_B0 In previous releases, an FP group might go from a double to quad mode on Enduro/Dagger platforms. In this release, the secondary selector for qualifier DstPort & DstGPort has been corrected.
SDK-69443 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 All In previous releases , the CRC mode for transmit side LinkPHY subports would be misconfigured on BCM5645x devices. This has been fixed in this release.
SDK-69448 56040_A0 Added following statistics for the API bcm_cosq_stat_get() for all Triumph3 devices. bcmCosqStatIngressPortPoolSharedBytesPeak bcmCosqStatIngressPortPoolSharedBytesCurrent bcmCosqStatIngressPortPGMinBytesPeak bcmCosqStatIngressPortPGMinBytesCurrent bcmCosqStatIngressPortPGSharedBytesPeak bcmCosqStatIngressPortPGSharedBytesCurrent bcmCosqStatIngressPortPGHeadroomBytesPeak bcmCosqStatIngressPortPGHeadroomBytesCurrent bcmCosqStatEgressMCQueueBytesPeak bcmCosqStatEgressMCQueueBytesCurrent bcmCosqStatEgressUCQueueBytesPeak bcmCosqStatEgressUCQueueBytesCurrent
SDK-69453 56640_B0 In previous releases, packet was droped when trunk port was used as WLAN NNI port. In this release, the issue has been addressed by configuring correct destination and trunk membership.
SDK-69467 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 56851_A0 56851_A1 56851_A2 56851P_A1 56851P_A2 56852_A0 56852_A1 56852_A2 56853_A0 56853_A1 56853_A2 56854_A0 56854_A2 56854_B0 56855_A0 56855_A2 All In previous releases, when SER recovery failed, the SER error log event would not be generated. In this release, the SER error log event will always be generated regardless of the result of the SER recovery.
SDK-69512 88660_A0 SyncE support for dynamic port provisioning: In order to support SyncE after dynamic port provisioning action (port speed change) the following API's need to be called: * bcm_switch_control_set(unit, bcmSwitchSynchronousPortClockSource\Bkup, port); * bcm_switch_control_set(unit, bcmSwitchSynchronousPortClockSourceDivCtrl\BkupDivCtrl, div); This change is about fixing the API's above to reconfigure SyncE after dynamic port provisioning (port speed change) action.
SDK-69525 56643_A0 56643_A1 56643_B0 When programing ipfix mirror port operation for a specific port, the previous SDK releases did not use the port number in progamming register. And the destination port of ipfix mirroring was not saved to ingress and egress true memory. This has been corrected.
SDK-69530 56540_A0 56643_A0 In earlier releases, the configuration for bcmPolicerModeTrTcmDs couldn't be recovered when warmboot was enabled. In this release, the configuration can be recovered correctly.
SDK-69531 88650_A0 88660_A0 88670_A0 TPID: A TPID Profile consists of two device level TPID values. The bcm_port_tpid_xxx APIs are used to associate an object (port or logical LIF) with up to two TPIDs, thereby modifying the available per device 4 TPID profiles and the per device TPID values. TPID values and TPID Profiles can be removed or modified if no object is assigned with those values as may happen when TPIDs that were previously set are being modified or deleted. Prior to the fix, TPIDs and TPID Profiles that were set and later modified or deleted weren't released, thus such manipulations caused both the TPIDs and TPID Profiles HW tables to be full earlier than expected. The TPID & TPID Profiles are now released as expected.
SDK-69544 56850_A2 In previous releases, ALPM trie splitting could cause a system crash due to null condition. In this release, this has been resolved.
SDK-69569 88650_A0 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 Working in Mesh mode (soc property "fabric_connect_mode=Mesh") and with fabric link rates 11.5 Gbps might cause cell drops. Fixed.
SDK-69607 SDK-68239 88660_A0 88670_A0 In L3 applications the API "bcm_l3_egress_create" did not allow a destination(port) of type trap for multicast. This constraint was removed.
SDK-69648 All This release prevents a PTP slave-only clock from granting unicast negotiation requests. A slave-only clock summarily rejects unicast negotiation requests for PTP message services via the reference signaling arbiter function.
SDK-69742 88650_A0 88660_A0 In FEC, getting a FEC which was configured with BCM_GPORT_BLACK_HOLE returned an error. This is now fixed and bcm_l3_egress_get now works as expected.
SDK-69764 88670_A0 ROO IPV4: Added support for ROO and RPF enabled both for the host table (LEM) and the routing table (KAPS). RPF can be set either loose or strict. For more information see UM. For CINT example, see cint_vxlan_roo.c. CINT example show ROO IPV4 + RPF over VXLAN overlay, but it may apply to other overlays such as Trill, NVGRE and VPLS.
SDK-69774 88670_A0 Introduce new feature Routing over overlay (ROO) Multicast (ROO MC). The features includes: 1. Multicast replications to overlay which require to configure 2 cuds (Native-Out-RIF, Overlay-LIF). Note: Multicast replications must be done egress multicast. 2. Support IP-Compatible multicast after overlay termination 3. Multicast features such as fallback to bridge and same interface filter inside the overlay are now available. Please see cint example: cint_vxlan_roo_mc.c for more information.
SDK-69783 88670_A0 In 88670-family we introduce PWE o GRE application with better managed micro-code resources against older devices. In Jericho there is no need for Field Processor workaround to set forwarding to be MPLS. Also VTT and FLP stages were adjusted. Changes in API sequence, can be seen in cint_vswitch_vpls_gre.c.
SDK-69819 88650_A0 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 MPLS: A condition was added in bcm_mpls_tunnel_initiator_create to check that the rif is in valid range.
SDK-69824 56440_A0 56440_B0 Problem occurred with "PTP peer statistics full" prints would fill the console. This was addressed by fixing a race condition in PTP peer statistics tracking.
SDK-69839 56850_A2 All In the previous releases, the API bcm_vlan_translate_add would not update the VLAN_ACTION_VALID for the existing vxlan_xlate entry. In this release, this has been addressed by updating the VLAN_ACTION_VALID.
SDK-69864 88670_A0 In L3, when running on Jericho/Qumran-MX, searches in the host table were not performed in case the in-RIF was enabled for L3VPN. meaning, searches for default VRF (=0) were not performed. The forwarding searches using VRF and default-VRF are now performed correctly in route and host DBs.
SDK-69875 88670_A0 In Jericho device, VRRP and multiple my-MAC termination APIs are supported.
SDK-69878 88670_A0 In BCM88670, the SA-Authentication entry prefix was incorrectly set to enable flushing all the Database entries via the flush machine. This is fixed.
SDK-69914 88670_A0 Added for all L2/L3 In-LIF allocation APIs the support of wide flag (BCM_XXX_WIDE).
SDK-69915 88670_A0 Add support for new action for ingress PMF: bcmFieldActionStackingRouteNew and new qualifier bcmFieldQualifyStackingRoute for Egress PMF to set 15 bits of Stacking Extenstion and passing information from Ingress PP to Egress PP.
SDK-69926 All OAM: when calling bcm_mirror_port_destroy() on a outbound mirror defined on a port on which an OAM Up MEP may exist, OAM traffic associated with the Up-MEP may be disrupted. This has been fixed.
SDK-69940 88670_A0 In Field Processor, at ingress stage, the following Ingress Qualifiers are supported: 1. bcmFieldQualifyForwardHdrVlanId: it matches the VLAN Tag Id (12b), from the Forwarding Header 2. bcmFieldQualifyForwardHdrSrcMac: it matches the MAC Source-Address (48b), from the Forwarding Header 3. bcmFieldQualifyForwardHdrDstMac: it matches the MAC Destination-Address (48b), from the Forwarding Header
SDK-69942 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, DEFAULTROUTE bits of uRPF pivot entries for default route may not be updated correctly and would cause default route check failure. In the current release, DEFAULTROUTE bits of uRPF pivot entries are updated correctly when a default route is inserted/updated.
SDK-69954 88670_A0 Added support for IPV6 RPF. RPF can be set to either loose or strict. For more information see UM. For CINT example, see example_rpf_ipv6 in cint_ip_route_rpf.c.
SDK-69961 88650_B1 88660_A0 Soft Reset Causes LAG Smooth Division Table Corruption. Corruption of LAG Smooth Division Table causes Lag misbehavior after Soft Reset sequence. In order to resolve this issue SW will shadow this table at his memory before the Soft Reset and will update the table with shadow after the Soft Reset. This way LAG Smooth Division Table values restored and Lag misbehavior after soft reset sequence eliminated.
SDK-69966 56850_A0 Added EEE LPI passthrough support in TSC.
SDK-69974 All In previous releases, memcpy would be allowed even when NULL pointer was found. The relative data would be directly copied to an the address without a proper check. In this release, the validity of the address is ensured prior to accessing memory.
SDK-70023 All this fix is crucial for trunk users. this fix should have no effect on other modules besides trunk.
SDK-70073 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 Problem: Traffic would flow at a higher rate than expected when entry was reinstalled after making changes to meter value.

The solution in this release is as follows: 1. The entry will not be removed and reinstalled when a change in the policer is made. 2. BUCKET_COUNTER in field_meter_table is not set unless the BUCKET_SIZE is changed.

SDK-70108 56640_A0 In previous releases, the replace operation was not supported for API bcm_l3_intf_create(). It would cause field MPLS_TUNNEL_INDEX error for TABLE EGR_L3_INTF. In the release, added replace operation support for API bcm_l3_intf_create().
SDK-70117 88670_A0 Error mechanism initiation. Error mechanism initiation need to be done before all error function calls. any error before Error mechanism initiation will cause driver crash. this sequence moved to early stage of init sequence before all error function calls.
SDK-70123 88670_A0 To setup multicast of AIS packets from a MEP: 1. define an AIS object for example: bcm_oam_ais_t ais; 2. Set the ID in ais.id 3. Set the tx period in ais.period for example: ais.period=BCM_OAM_ENDPOINT_CCM_PERIOD_1S; 4. Set MC flasg: ais.flags |= BCM_OAM_AIS_MULTICAST; 5. Set MDL in which this AIS should be sent: ais.level = 7; 6. call bcm_oam_ais_add(unit,&ais); In this example, every 1sec, an AIS packet with MDL=7 would be broadcasted.

To stop the AIS packet sending, use bcm_oam_ais_delete.

Note: Only 1 AIS is currently available per MEP-ID (i.e. AIS can be sent with only 1 level)

SDK-70125 88670_A0 It's possible to create OAM MEP of type bcmOAMEndpointTypeEthernet on a MPLS port.
SDK-70136 56850_A2 56860_A0 In previous releases, the SDK would not properly handle the scenario of replacing labeled egress objects with BCM_MPLS_LABEL_INVALID. In this release, the SDK properly replaces labeled egress objects with BCM_MPLS_LABEL_INVALID.
SDK-70137 88670_A0 88950_a0 Fabric pipes configuration in mode: triple pipe of uc, high priority mc, low priority mc, fixed. In addition added a support to define which priorities are considered as high/low.

Supported pipe mapping in mode triple pipe of uc, high priority mc, low priority mc.  UC, high priority MC (priorities 3), low priority MC (priorities 0, 1, 2) (3-pipes system):  fabric_pipe_map_uc=0  fabric_pipe_map_mc=2  fabric_pipe_map_mc3=1

 UC, high priority MC (priorities 2, 3), low priority MC (priorities 0, 1) (3-pipes system):  fabric_pipe_map_uc=0  fabric_pipe_map_mc=2  fabric_pipe_map_mc2=1  fabric_pipe_map_mc3=1  UC, high priority MC (priorities 1, 2, 3), low priority MC (priorities 0) (3-pipes system):  fabric_pipe_map_uc=0  fabric_pipe_map_mc=1  fabric_pipe_map_mc0=2

SDK-70158 88650_A0 88660_A0 PRGE: Chip init fails sometimes due to bug in egress programmable editor programs management.
SDK-70167 All In earlier releases, stack corruption may occur when calling the function 'format_pbmp'. This issue has been fixed in this release.
SDK-70181 88660_A0 88670_A0 In FCoE, add new SOC property: fcoe_npv_bridge_mode. When set to 1 the NPV switch works as bridge for packets that ingresses from the N_PORT and as a router for packets that ingresses from the NP_PORT. Default value is 0.
SDK-70189 88670_A0 Jericho/QMX configuration updated to support diag "ps" command.
SDK-70211 88660_A0 Counter possessor's sources: EPNI, EGQ where not mapped correctly for MSB ranges, and counter command 1.

more over, EGQ statistics collection was building the collected statistics pointers will assuming priority x is mapped to queue offset x in the EGQ. Fixed collecting EGQ statistics for packet priority only, with no impotence to queue offset.

SDK-70222 88660_A0 In MAC table, aggregation of few flush operations into one bulk operation was not functional. MACT bulk operation is not possible when exact match tables shadow is disabled.
SDK-70260 88670_A0 DramMmuIndAccess UI was enabled for Jericho. dram indirect read and write functions were modified.
SDK-70299 88670_A0 The flag BCM_MPLS_PORT_INGRESS_WIDE, which indicates a wide pwe entry, has been changed to BCM_MPLS_PORT2_INGRESS_WIDE and should be added to the flags2 field of the mpls port.
SDK-70323 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, PFC class mapping was not thoroughly cleaned by bcm_switch_control_port_set. This has been fixed in this release by resetting the whole mapping.
SDK-70347 88660_A0 In the MAC table, there was a bug in the addition of a MACT entry to the SW shadow that could cause a "dead loop". Now the entries are always added in the correct place in the memory.
SDK-70383 88660_A0 In The TM PMF program which is hit for UP-MEP packets in recycle-pat, we override the remove-1B action by setting "bytes to remove" to zero so that one extra byte removal does not happen in LBP stage.
SDK-70400 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 All In previous releases, an issue existed with group creation logic when a group qset (Outport , IngressClassField ,InPort ,OuterVlanId , InterfaceClassPort} combination was created it would be single wide mode with KEY1 (this would allow only L3 packets to hit the rule). In this release, the group creation logic was fixed to go double wide mode for this qset with KEY1 & KEY4 to support all types of packets. If single wide mode only is needed then user needs to remove either Outport or IngressClassField from the group qset.
SDK-70408 All ARAD+ only. In L2 switch IPv4 compatible multicast, support for source specific look-up is added. A new SOC property is introduced: "ipmc_l2_ssm_mode" to enable this feature. When set, in case of IPv4 compatible MC, when the in-RIF is not enabled for IPMC and bcmSwitchL3McastL2==1, an additional search to LEM<FID,G> is performed: TCAM<FID,G,S>. The TCAM result has higher strength than the LEM result. To insert an entry to the new TCAM database, use the API bcm_ipmc_add() the same way it was used to insert an entry to the LEM<FID,G> database and also set the s_ip_addr and s_ip_mask fields in the bcm_ipmc_addr_t structure used an an input. See usage example in cint_ipmc_flows.c
SDK-70456 All In previous releases, the API bcm_l3_ingress_create would reset the hardware field ACTIVE_L3_IIF_PROFILE_INDEX which may have been previously programmed by the API bcm_ipmc_rp_add. In this release, this has been addressed by preventing the modification of the field in the API bcm_l3_ingress_create.
SDK-70471 88750_A0 diag egr is now clearing maximum statistic per interface
SDK-70472 88670_A0 Jericho interrupt database updated with Jericho registers. Interrupt commands will not cause crash now.
SDK-70478 88670_A0 remove irrelevant registers from tr 3
SDK-70480 All skipping IQM_PAKCET_DESCRIPTOR_MEMORY_ECC_DYNAMIC which is an internal chip memory .
SDK-70481 88670_A0 skip MTRPS_EM & CRPS dynamic memories
SDK-70530 All In order to support srec loading during init, we added the functionality of using the soc properties: mcs_load_uc0 mcs_load_uc1

As prefix for loading the srec file. This functionality was added tot he appl_init.

These soc properties represent prefix string that can be used for loading the srec files to the device during init phase. mcs_load_uc0 mcs_load_uc1

Assign the soc property with the prefix of the file you want to load mcs_load_uc0=bfd mcs_load_uc1=bs

and in any place in the init use the soc api to get it back soc_property_get_str(unit, (core == 0) ? spn_MCS_LOAD_UC0 : spn_MCS_LOAD_UC1);

The name of the srec file is than build from the: Device name ( BCM88660, BCM88460...) CORE ID 0,1 Prefix mcs_load_uc0,mcs_load_uc0 File extension srec

The file that will be loaded will have the format <Device name>_<Core ID>_<Prefix>.srec

For example: BCM88460_0_bfd.srec BCM88460_1_bs.srec

SDK-70557 88660_A0 All In L3, when running on ARAD+ and the SOC property bcm886xx_l3_ingress_urpf_enable is set to '1', calling the API bcm_vswitch_port_delete() for a LIF which is connected to an existing RIF did not remove that connection in the SW state. This resulted in unexpected behavior. The LIF-RIF connection is now being updated correctly when removing the LIF from the VSI/RIF.
SDK-70581 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 For KT2 devices, ports that were configured to work in hardware linkscan mode when disabled were moved to linkscan mode none. As a result, when the port was re-enabled, the linkscan mode setting was not restored.

This would occur because linkscan mode was being set to none for all disabled ports by default.

This issue has been fixed by retaining the previous linkscan mode for disabled ports.

SDK-70597 56960_A0 Tomahawk "dump socmem" command has been updated to exclude the internal memories during read/dump.
SDK-70628 56643_A1 In previous releases, if L2 entries were added into L2 table using dynamic replace when the L2 table was full, it could cause dead lock on Triumph3 devices when aging was enabled. In this release, the improper lock has been removed and the dead lock will not happen in that special situation.
SDK-70655 88670_A0 When working in TM mode (i.e., fap_device_mode=TM), the traffic was not passing the egress due to a missing configuration. This is fixed.
SDK-70748 56960_A0 In the previous release, HW linkscan callbacks were not coming in correctly. Tomahawk hardware linkscan is supported via CMICDV2 interface - new registers for ports beyond 128 needed to be programmed. In this release this has been corrected.
SDK-70770 88660_A0 During the update of a BFD endpoint, the required resources are freed. To prevent garbage packets from being created during that time, the creation of packets is disabled for the duration of the update. Note: this can cause some expected packets to be missed from the created packets stream (during endpoint update).
SDK-70780 88660_A0 All packets transmitted by OAMP which include ITMH will also include UDH in the correct placing, when required (with OAMP-PE programs).
SDK-70791 88670_A0 PPDB_B_MACT_AGING_CONFIGURATION_TABLE was not configured well in Jericho. Mact entries were not deleted in the correct age state. Aging configuration is done properly now.
SDK-70846 All Fixed an error where calling multiple units deinit-init sequence from the bcm shell command line (for example running following from BCM shell: "*: tr 141") may cause the sequence to run several times on the same unit, and skip other units.
SDK-70856 56340_A0 All In earlier releases, SDK returned the maximum number of ports per module as 32 and number of modules as 1 even though the chip supported 64 ports. In current release, the issue has been fixed. BCM56340 will boot with 64 ports and single module if config variable spn_MODULE_64PORTS = 1.
SDK-70857 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In Trident2 chip, in order to ensure compatibility for SDK, port LED status of port 1 has been changed to location 0xA0 instead of 0xA1.
SDK-70865 56440_A0 56440_A1 56440_B0 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 Added check to remove loop back port from data in bcm_field_qualifier_Inports_get() API.
SDK-70873 All Add PCIe preemphasis setting for iProc based PCIe device in BDE.
SDK-70876 88660_A0 QOS: The max number enties of Egress non-encap was wrongly set as _BCM_QOS_MAP_EGR_REMARK_MPLS_EXP_MAX(8). The max number of Egress non-encap entries was corrected to TC(8)*DP(4)=32.
SDK-70878 56850_A0 In this release, two new types bcmCosqControlUCEgressPool and bcmCosqControlMCEgressPool are defined to allow the user to decide the egress pool of which queue to set.
SDK-70898 56960_A0 Problem: Meter index not set properly in Ingress Field processor policy memory. Soluion: Meter pair count intialization was done to wrong value of 8 instead of 128 , hence meter index was getting calculated wrongly. This is updated to initialize correct values in this release
SDK-70913 All 100G interface drops traffic with rate over 12G Fixed
SDK-70916 88670_A0 set all indirect WR mask registers on initialization. This clears the TCAM_HIT_INDICATION tables in initialization process and enables write/clear them in run-time.
SDK-70919 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 56641_A0 56642_A0 56643_A0 56643_A1 56643_B0 56644_A0 56644_A1 56644_B0 56645_A0 56648_A0 56648_B0 56649_A0 56649_B0 In this release, the default weights setting of WRR value to 2 has been extended to L0,L1 tables.
SDK-70931 88650_A0 88660_A0 88670_A0 Added two cint utility functions in src/examples/dpp/utility/cint_utils_vlan.c: vlan__open_vlan_per_mc - used to create a vlan and assign it to a multicast group.

vlan__open_vlan_per_ports - used to open a new vsi and add ports as members.

SDK-70935 88660_A0 All OAM/BFD: For retreiving CCM/BFD per endpoint statistics, use the API bcm_field_stat_get32(). This should be used in the with the parameters:  unit  stat_id: should be set to counter_engine << 29 |is_rx <<14 | endpoint_id where o counter_engine is 0-4, the counter engine configured in the soc property o is_rx should be set to 1 if the RX counter is needed, 0 otherwise o endpoint_id: the endpoint for which the value is requested.  stat: should be set to bcmFieldStatDefault  value: output goes in this value. Note that it is the user's responsibility to add PMF rule for rx Down MEP and rx BFD. For rx up mep is already implemented. For full documentation refer to the programmer's guide.
SDK-70937 88660_A0 88670_A0 support for new action for Ingress PMF: bcmFieldActionStackingRouteNew : Replace the value of the stacking route in FTMH stacking-Extension. support for new qualifiers in Egress PMF: 1. bcmFieldQualifyStackingRoute :Qualify Stacking Route history bitmap in in FTMH stacking-Extension. 2. bcmFieldQualifyDstSysPortExt Qualify on FTMH Destination System Port (DSP) Extension (16 bits).
SDK-70938 88660_A0 88670_A0 added support for new action for Ingress PMF: bcmFieldActionStackingRouteNew : Replace the value of the stacking route in FTMH stacking-Extension.

added support new qualifiers in Egress PMF: 1. bcmFieldQualifyStackingRoute :Qualify Stacking Route history bitmap in in FTMH stacking-Extension. 2. bcmFieldQualifyDstSysPortExt Qualify on FTMH Destination System Port (DSP) Extension (16 bits).

SDK-70990 56450_B0 In previous releases, sub_field_width for port based hashing was incorrectly configured for both concatenate and non-concatenate cases. It has been fixed in this release.
SDK-70991 88660_A0 When calling to bcm_vlan_port_create with trunk gport with no members, bcm_vlan_port_destroy failed.
SDK-71013 SDK-58711 56041_A0 In this release, TSPLL configuration on BCM53400 family defaults to internal reference, this avoids a lock-up when external reference is not present.
SDK-71023 56840_A0 In previous releases, in _bcm_td_wred_war_configure() it changed hg port to xe port which caused the speed to change. Then in _bcm_td_wred_war_hw_state_restore() it restored the settings except speed, which resulted in the port being unable to link up. This issue is fixed in this release.
SDK-71035 56860_A0 Added support for Prbs related functionality invoked via bcm_port_control_set/get APIs.
SDK-71037 All In Field module, a new API was inserted with a 'class' parameter, which does not compile for C++ compilations. This is fixed by renaming it 'class_id'.
SDK-71038 5600_A0 56850_A0 56850_A1 Some CMIC interrupts that should have been handled in kernel mode and did not need to report to user mode were not being be masked properly. This issue has been fixed.
SDK-71042 88650_B1 88660_A0 QOS: The max number entries of EGRESS PCP_VLAN was wrongly configured as _BCM_QOS_MAP_EGR_VLAN_PRI_MAX(8) * SOC_DPP_CONFIG(unit)->qos.dp_max(4)=32. The max number of EGRESS PCP_VLAN entries was corrected to _BCM_QOS_MAP_EGR_VLAN_PRI_MAX(8) * _BCM_QOS_MAP_EGR_VLAN_CFI_MAX.(2)=16.
SDK-71093 88650_A0 88650_B0 88660_A0 88670_A0 A fix was inserted following the failure of bcm_switch_control_port_get with bcmSwitchPortHeaderType in case port is MPLS RAW configured.
SDK-71126 56640_A0 Problem: OAM group errors were not alarmed when error free remote endpoint was replaced. Solution: The proper OAM group entry is now used while clearing the defects as part of endpoint deletion which is done in replace operation.
SDK-71135 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 Problem: Katana2 device drops packets having MACDA=0x00...00 when no OLP configuration is present on the system, because the packets are subject to OLP MACDA prefix check by default and if no OLP configuration is present on the device the check is done against MAC: 0x00...00

Solution: Disable the prefix checking done by default, instead enable it only when OLP configuration is done on the system. Disable it back if OLP configuration is deleted.

SDK-71144 56040_A0 In previous releases, the API bcm_cosq_gport_bandwidth_set() would fail to configure a bandwidth value for an HSP port if ETS mode was enabled for the GE/XE ports. This has been fixed in this release.
SDK-71207 88670_A0 in Jericho, the access to Small TCAM banks was made improperly, therefore access was limited, and upper small banks could not be accessed. it was fixed.
SDK-71241 88670_A0 Changed the ingress queue default to DRAM-mix when DRAM exists.
SDK-71285 88950_a0 API "bcm_fabric_control_set(unit, bcmFabricShutdown, enable)" fixed.
SDK-71302 56540_B0 The existing code used the value of parameter "end" minus 1 as the last entry index instead of parameter "end". The code has been changed to take the value of parameter "end" as the last entry index.
SDK-71388 88670_A0 In Jericho, the maximal bfd_rate available for accelerated BFD endpoints is 1703 ms.
SDK-71390 88650_A0 An Arad-only (88650) compilation issue has been fixed ("_bcm_petra_rx_discard_packet" function was defined but not used).
SDK-71399 56850_A2 56852_A2 Update TD2 TDM for management port configuration to give customer more flexibility on management port manipulation.
SDK-71437 88650_B1 88660_A0 Learning on outboud mirroring internal ports was disabled.
SDK-71455 56224_A0 56224_B0 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 Problem: Unable to destroy existing entry on warmboot.

Solution : In structure fp_entry the policer array field was not initialized correctly on warmboot. Which has been fixed now.

SDK-71465 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 Issue: Show counter are displaying only cos 0 statistics Solution: Modified the code for displaying the counters for all the cos values
SDK-71549 56960_A0 If L2MOD_FIFO was enabled on BCM56960 (Tomahawk) via the configuration property "l2xmsg_mode=1", bcm_l2_addr_add() could return BCM_E_FAIL under some conditions.

Upon SDK init, in L2x FIFO mode (config: l2xmsg_mode=1), recording of L2 Add(L2 insert) messages are disabled (behavior similar to TD2).

SDK-71578 88660_A0 TWAMP (Two-Way Active Measurement Protocol) RFC 5357, 4656 is introduced by DNX devices. Note: In order to enable TWAMP, OAM application needs to be set by soc properties and initialize beforehand (bcm_oam_init). TWAMP application includes four processing flows: TWAMP sender TX, TWAMP reflector RX, TWAMP reflector TX, TWAMP sender RX. For CPU -> DNX device TWAMP sender TX (As well as TWAMP sender TX), field processor rules should be used to modify OAM actions according to required IP fields in the following way: Key consisting of (a subset of) the following: {SIP, DIP, UDP source port, UDP dest port}. Actions for this rule: - OAM-Sub-Type = NTP DM - OAM-Stamp-Offset = TWAMP test packet timestamp offset (Header-Offset[4] + 4B) For DNX device -> CPU TWAMP reflector RX (as well as sender RX): Field processor rule with key consisting of (a subset of) the following: {SIP, DIP, UDP source port, UDP dest port}. Actions for this rule: - OAM-Sub-Type = NTP DM - Trap to CPU Egress programmable editor add the TOD MSB. CINT application example is still in-work, BCM SDK already supports the following actions and the programmable editor.
SDK-71584 88670_A0 To stamp CUD over FTMH header MSBytes: 1. set SOC property 'custom_feature_tdm_eg_editing_is_cud_stamping=1' 2. For each port that requires this stamping, set the egress TDM editing action to bcmFabricTdmEditingCustomExternal (using bcm_fabric_tdm_editing_set).

Reference example can be found in cint_tdm_example.c, in arad_tdm_outter_header_example.

SDK-71585 88660_A0 In L2, API bcm_l2_learn_limit_set() failed when flags included BCM_L2_LEARN_SYSTEM and limit=0. This is fixed and limit=0 is allowed now.
SDK-71597 88670_A0 L3: Outlif profile was reset by bcm_l3_egress_create which may cause for example to Link-layer OutLIF attributes such as split horizon forward group to stop working.
SDK-71612 56960_A0 Tomahawk link fault scan logic was disabled in the previous release. It's enabled with correct MAC scanning logic for this release.
SDK-71614 56452_B0 56450_A0 56450_B0 56450_B1 56455_A0 56456_A0 56456_B0 5645_A0 56457_B0 56455_B1 56458_B0 ISSUE: 1> Rate adjustment was not working properly for all PACKET_QUANTUM values. 2> Refresh count adjustment was not done for 2 other meters when one rate was configured.

ROOTCAUSE: Code was not taking care of the above two issues.

SOLUTION: 1> Corrected the rate adjustment logic to take care of different PACKET_QUANTUM values. 2> Also corrected the adjustment of refresh count of all three dlf/mc/bc meters since PACKET_QUANTUM is common across all of them, when ever any one of them was set.

SDK-71627 56040_A0 Problem :SDK-71627 : FP_TCAM and FP_POLICY_TABLE size was showing 8k. Solution: SDK-71627 : FP_TCAM and FP_POLICY_TABLE size set to 2k.
SDK-71654 All In the previous version, this was happening since the metric indicating number of counters required was unset and hence was not updating the offset table ie. the ING_FLEX_CTR_OFFSET_TABLE_5 and hence the customer was unable to count packets.

In the current version, the issue is fixed and the metric is correctly updated.

SDK-71689 56460_A0 Problem: Port 21 of 56460 device was working on quad mode even when the port was configured in single mode. Issue specific to config #3.

Solution: Fixed number of lanes for port 21 of 56460 device, to work in quad mode when it is configured as xe port.

SDK-71690 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 56851_A0 56851_A1 56851_A2 56851P_A1 56851P_A2 56852_A0 56852_A1 56852_A2 56853_A0 56853_A1 56853_A2 56854_A0 56854_A2 56854_B0 56855_A0 56855_A2 56960_A0 In previous releases, Objects bcmSwitchObjectL3RouteV4RoutesUsed, bcmSwitchObjectL3RouteV6Routes64bUsed and bcmSwitchObjectL3RouteV6Routes128bUsed were unsupported in ALPM mode. They have been enhanced for ALPM.
SDK-71748 56548_A0 Added the support for qsgmii core so that the serdes driver current can be set/get through bcm api
SDK-71764 56340_A0 Drop qualifier offset value initialized in KEY2 was incorrect and overlapping with IpType qualifier. Corrected the same.
SDK-71795 All Ukernel images can be loaded by soc perpropty mcs_load_uc0=bfd and mcs_load_uc1=bs automatically.
SDK-71799 88950_a0 Added support for fabric SerDes firmware CRC check. Details about how to enable firmware CRC check can be found in the UM.
SDK-71805 All During traverse the age machine is in freeze. If the callback that receives the traverse results return an error it stops the traverse. The bug was that the aging was left frozen. Now the aging machine is back to normal if the callback returns an error and stops the traverse
SDK-71807 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 56851_A0 56851_A1 56851_A2 56851P_A1 56851P_A2 56852_A0 56852_A1 56852_A2 56853_A0 56853_A1 56853_A2 56854_A0 56854_A2 56854_B0 56855_A0 56855_A2 56960_A0 In previous releases, status of used entries in L3 host table couldn't distinguish between IPv4 and IPv6 by API bcm_l3_info(). This has been resolved.
SDK-71835 56643_B0 In previous releases, the master key of KEY_GEN_OFFSET_TR2_ACL_IP4_ONLY was incorrect. It could not filter IPv4 packets with fragment header. In this release, the master key has been corrected.
SDK-71854 88650_B1 88660_A0 MPLS: bcm_mpls_tunnel_switch_delete() can be used to remove only termination entries even if forwarding entries were added with same label. This can be done using BCM_MPLS_EGRESS_LABEL_ACTION_VALID flag and appropriate action.
SDK-71878 All In earlier releases, SDK had a memory leak in the file "src/bcm/esw/flexctr/flex_ctr_common.c". This has been fixed in this release by adding memory protection.
SDK-71909 56860_A0 In previous releases, both ingress_bitmap and egress_bitmap would be programmed together when adding gport to the vlan using API bcm_vlan_gport_add. In this release, this API has been fixed to program bitmaps separately based on the flags.
SDK-71925 56045_B0 56046_B0 In previous releases, statistics of priority group 0 was always returned when retrieving stats for bcmBstStatIdPriGroupShared through bcm_cosq_bst_stat_get. In this release, the issue has been fixed by calculating correct priority group based on given gport and cosq.
SDK-71984 88650_A0 88660_A0 88670_A0 Allocation manager: fixed a bug that might have caused the device to crash in TM mode, or if too many cosq resources were allocated.
SDK-71988 56640_B0 Triumph3 100GE port only supports IEEE mode.In previous releases if the property of 100GE port was not set to be "pbmp_xport_xe" in config.bcm, the port would be set to be HIGIG mode. In this situation, Triumph3 initialization would fail. In this release, Triumph3 100GE port can only be set to be IEEE mode.
SDK-72023 88670_A0 snoop crop size as 3 which is not a valid size, changed it to 64.
SDK-72052 All The "CMIM Rx" thread creation is corrected to return failure for "bs config" when thread creation failure.
SDK-72081 56040_A0 Issue ==== Even though actual entries are 2k in Ranger+ actual hw index will be upto 8K with holes in between. SDK was not considering the holes while indexing the HW entries.

Fix == Added fix to consider the holes while indexing HW entries during field create API & counter threads.

SDK-72089 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 56851_A0 56851_A1 56851_A2 56851P_A1 56851P_A2 56852_A0 56852_A1 56852_A2 56853_A0 56853_A1 56853_A2 56854_A0 56854_A2 56854_B0 56855_A0 56855_A2 All In this release, in order to address KNET kernel crashes we ensure that no other process starts processing Rx DCBs.
SDK-72200 56224_A0 56224_B0 Problem: Unable to destroy existing entry on warmboot.

Solution : In structure fp_entry the policer array field was not initialized correctly on warmboot. This solution has been implemented in this release

SDK-72261 88650_B1 88660_A0 arad_pp_lem_block_get could return more results than the calling function can handle. It caused a memory overflow. Now the number of results from arad_pp_lem_block_get is limited and it might be called multiple times to retrieve all the traverse results. The commit that fixes the problem is under the JIRA SDK-63734
SDK-72280 88660_A0 In the cint there is a code for configuring OLP messages to the CPU (SHADOW). The wrong flag was used in the learn message. BCM_L2_LEARN_MSG_LEARNING instead of BCM_L2_LEARN_MSG_SHADOW. Now the correct flag is used
SDK-72304 88670_A0 Jericho - multi fabric pipes configuration - cell mapping to fabric pipe is wrong. Fixed.
SDK-72305 88670_A0 Fabric SerDes clock frequency (SoC property "serdes_fabric_clk_freq") might not read correctly from soc properties. Fixed.
SDK-72308 88650_B0 rx los doesn't work for lane 8 Fixed
SDK-72309 88650_B1 88660_A0 RX restart causes remote lanes to reset as well. Fixed
SDK-72349 88660_A0 In IP multicast when working in ELK, packets with DIP range 225-239.xxx.xxx.xxx were dropped. Issue fixed and now all packets are routed according to configuration.
SDK-72453 88660_A0 in external Tcam use, The ELK rx_data_size (result data size sent back to the device) calculation wasn't taking under consideration the ELK working mode (compare1/compare3). Issue fixed and now now size calculated according to the ELK working mode.
SDK-72588 88660_A0 The cint is configuring cpu learning. It was missing the configuration of the OLP messages to go to the CPU queue. Now this missing part is added




Section 13: Resolved Issues for 6.4.4

The following issues are resolved in version 6.4.4 of the SDK.

Number CSP # Chips Release Notes For 6.4.4
SDK-36361 56440_A0 For BCM56440 (Katana) and BCM240 (Enduro2) families of devices, bcm_cosq_gport_bandwidth_set() implementation could write incorrect table index under some conditions, resulting in possibly inaccurate traffic shaping.. This has been fixed.
SDK-38281 56440_A0 bcm_cosq_gport_sched_get API is updated to return appropriate scheduler mode.
SDK-41912 564478 56440_A0 Fixed system reboot caused due to out of bound access to flex counter pool in bcm_port_stat_counter_set
SDK-43491 56640_A0 56440_A0 56850_A0 56440_A1 56440_B0 Fixed cpu queues not honoring weight in WRR mode on TD2/KT/TR3
SDK-43693 88650_A0 88640_A0 CL independent per flow proportional mode support: option to config CL from independent per flow type weight's as higher weight higher priority by set the flag BCM_COSQ_GPORT_SCHEDULER_CLASS_WFQ_MODE_INDEPENDENT_PROPORTIONAL in the gport_add. Note: The definition of the CL independent per flow mode is global for All the CLs and when proportional mode defined inverse mode cannot be used and the opposite
SDK-43716 591808 56440_A0 The stat value for GT16383 and GR 16383 can be read from API bcm_stat_ge_get
SDK-47451 SDK-52856 643625 56440_A0 56445_A0 56445_B0 56634_B0 56636_A0 56636_B0 56638_A0 56638_B0 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 In previous releases, UDF module support would not work for legacy chipsets which support eight chunks of four bytes each. This release extends UDF module support to work across legacy and latest devices supporting varying number of chunks and chunk size.
SDK-47624 650405 56850_A0 bcm_vxlan_stat_detach() API now detaches both ingress counter and egress counter.
SDK-48334 662397 56440_A0 56440_B0 Corrected retrieval of port and queue info in bcm_multicast_egress_subscriber_get.
SDK-49382 669106 56440_A0 56440_A1 56440_B0 56450_B0 Support has been added for the following commands. The "multicast show" command has been implemented to print the replication queue list for subscriber queue replication on Katana and Katana2. The LLS command has been implemented for Katana devices.
SDK-49460 682997 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In earlier releases, we used external clock as default reference clock of TS_PLL and BS_PLL, if the external clock was not existent or was not OK, the system would print error message. Now we use internal clock as default reference clock. This has been resolved.
SDK-52406 56640_B0 In the earlier releases, when using "tcam prbs=1" command, an incorrect mapping to PRBS7 would occur, because Triumph3 does not support prbs=1. In this release, the incorrect mapping was fixed.
SDK-54597 SDK-49387 735093 56840_A0 56846_A0 56846_A1 If PFC-transmit was disabled while the XMAC was in the XOFF state, the XOFF state was retained and would send out XOFF frame when the PFC-transmit was re-enabled regardless of traffic. This has been fixed in this release.
SDK-55072 545556 56450_A0 56640_A0 56640_B0 56840_A0 56846_A0 56846_A1 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, the MIRROR_CONTROL.M_ENABLE field would not get set when a port initially configured as an XE port later changed to HiGig encapsulation. This has been fixed by setting MIRROR_CONTROL.M_ENABLE field to 1 during the transition.
SDK-55410 756377 All The priority scoring mechanism for UDF packet type offsets has been documented. When the same type of UDF packet format is added using API bcm_field_data_qualifier_ethertype_add, it takes lower priority than when same type of packet format is added using API bcm_field_data_qualifier_packet_format_add.
SDK-55513 758422 56850_A0 All In earlier releases, the SDK would not check if user mixed line-rate and oversubscription ports existed together within a TSC on Trident2. This has been resolved and the SDK can check in both flex port mode and non-flex port mode.
SDK-55675 56640_A0 56640_B0 All BFD support over LAG : To run BFD session on LAG interfaces, application has to configure an independent asynchronous mode BFD session on every LAG member link in a LAG bundle. Asynchronous mode BFD sessions on every LAG member link is termed as "micro-BFD session". Dedicated MAC "01-00-5E-90-00-01" has to be used as next hop destination MAC in accordance with Standard RFC 7130.
SDK-55835 756688 88670_A0 In L2, the age can be now retrieved via a new field age_state to struct bcm_l2_addr_t. The Hit indication can be retrieved from the L2 flags (BCM_L2_HIT flag).
SDK-55917 764186 56440_A0 56440_A1 56440_B0 In earlier releases, the L3_DEFIP table was missed in S/W TCAM SER protection list, so the SER engine did not detect and correct corrupted entries in L3_DEFIP table. All the TCAM tables on KT have been added into S/W TCAM SER protection list in this release to address this issue
SDK-56197 88650_A0 88650_B0 88660_A0 OAM: For BHH OAM endpoints over PWE, MPLS, the "Passive" side entry on which TX counters associated with the MEP are maintained can be extracted from the field mpls_out_gport in bcm_oam_endpoint_create() (by default this field is BCM_GPORT_INVALID in which case the LIFs are assumed to be symmetric). Passive side OAM traps also exist on this LIF at the egress. The outLIF can be set in the following way: 1. In case of MPLS tunnel, the actual outLIF can be taken from label_array[*].tunnel_id which will be returned from the API bcm_mpls_tunnel_initiator_create(). In case of VPLS, the outLif can be taken from the encap_id field of bcm_mpls_port_add api. 2.For BHH MPLS endpoints the outLIF should then be set as a tunnel gport using the macro BCM_GPORT_TUNNEL_ID_SET(). For PWE endpoints the outLIF should be set as a MPLS_PORT gport. 3.The gport-subtype should be set. For example using the cint mpls_tunnel_id_to_mpls_tunnel_gport().

An example of this can be found in oam_run_with_defaults_mpls_tp().

SDK-56251 765209 88650_B1 88660_A0 Add an API to change counter engine source dynamically: int bcm_stat_counter_config_set( int unit, bcm_stat_counter_engine_t *engine, bcm_stat_counter_config_t *config); int bcm_stat_counter_config_get( int unit, bcm_stat_counter_engine_t *engine, bcm_stat_counter_config_t *config);
SDK-56373 765537 56340_A0 56640_A0 On non-cache-coherent platform, DMA buffer needs to be invalidated before CPU access. However, this operation for all Triumph3 devices was missed in previous releases. This issue has been fixed in this release.
SDK-56690 773593 56850_A0 In previous releases, when enabled LLFC would conflict with PAUSE. This has been addressed by disabling PAUSE when LLFC is enabled, and enabling PAUSE when LLFC is disabled.
SDK-57009 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, bcm_vxlan_stat_detach took high execution time because redundant memory operation was executed. In this release, we remove memory read operation and use soc_mem_write instead of soc_mem_write_range conditionally to save time, then the execution time can be reduced a lot.
SDK-57125 779514 84848_A0 Support has been added for BCM84848 1G AutogrEEE with clear statistics feature.
SDK-57476 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In earlier releases bcm_stat_group_create could get stuck in loop for egress SVP counters under scaled set-up. The issue was due to macro FLEX_COUNTER_DEFAULT_EGR_DVP_ATTRIBUTE_1_TABLE_POOL_NUMBER not being defined correctly for TD2, which led to endless loop when the egress flex counter pool were exhausted. It was defined to 5 for all the chips include TD2 but actually it should be less than 4 for TD2 as TD2 only has 4 egress flex counter pools.

The fix was to define separate macro for TD2.

SDK-57494 783183 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, the performance of the API bcm_l3_route_delete_all did not match customers' requirements. In this release, it has been improved by 2.4 times for both ipv6 or ipv4 routes. This is achieved by leveraging DMA for bulk operations, skipping delete propagation and storing the index of each route entry.
SDK-57822 788335 56850_A0 56850_A1 Support has been added for a new API to traverse all valid VXLAN port and a callback routine to retrieve the vxlan port information. The callback function is defined as follows: int (*bcm_vxlan_vpn_traverse_cb)(int unit, bcm_vxlan_vpn_config_t *info, void *user_data)
SDK-58066 790849 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, a link down event on a HG[40] port with CL72 enabled triggered Edatabuf overflow. This issue has been fixed in this release.
SDK-58557 789635 56624_A0 56624_B1 For L3_ENTRY_ONLY and MPLS_ENTRY tables, parity errors on index subject to (((entry index) & 3) != 0) couldn't be recovered by the SDK. This was because the entry index of the dual hash table was not correct if the index & 3 was not previously 0. The code has been changed to put a correct entry index for soc_ser_correction.
SDK-58654 56960_A0 1. RTAG7_MPLS_L2_PAYLOAD_L3_HASH_FIELD_BMAP register is Rtag7 Hashing Field Selection Bitmap Register for MPLS terminated tunnels with L2 payloads. MPLS_L2_PAYLOAD_L3_BITMAP_A/B Hash field selection for MPLS terminated pkts with L2 payloads in RTAG7_MPLS_L2_PAYLOAD_L3_HASH_FIELD_BMAP register is now configurable in Tomahawk. 2. In addition RTAG7_HASH_CONTROL_2 registers MPLS_PAYLOAD_HASH_SELECT_A/B configuration is supported which selects inner L2 (0) or inner L3 (1) fields to drive to Hash buckets when MPLS packet is received and the tunnel is being terminated.
SDK-59769 804528 88650_A0 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 arad_pp_frwrd_fec_ecmp_hashing_global_info_get_unsafe() will now return the use_port_id flag
SDK-59979 SDK-68669 811045 All In earlier releases, parallel warpcore firmware loading was not supported. The feature was added in this release.
SDK-60222 SDK-60187 88650_A0 88650_B0 88660_A0 All added memory array caching: Some memories have multiple instances within a single block in the device. Internally, the SDK organizes such tables into arrays, so that each instance of a table can be accessed using an instance-id. The caching mechanism did not support caching of memory-arrays. Customer impact: Normally, memories can be cached to DRAM as part of soft-error (SER) protection mechanism, or in order to improve driver runtime performance. For memory arrays, caching was not available. For parity-protected configuration memories, caching is used to recover from a soft-error. As a result of this addition, memory arrays can now also be protected by this mechanism. list of relevant memories: EPNI_EEDB_BANK EPNI_DATA_FORMAT EPNI_LFEM_FIELD_SELECT_MAP IDR_MCDA_PRFSEL IDR_MCDB_PRFSEL IHB_FEM_BIT_SELECT IHB_FEM_MAP_INDEX_TABLE IHB_FEC_ENTRY IHB_TCAM_ACTION IHP_PARSER_PROGRAM IHP_VLAN_PORT_MEMBERSHIP_TABLE IHP_LIF_TABLE

note for 6.3 branch: the list of cached tables is not filled by the fix in this JIRA, and will be filled soon.

SDK-60417 817061 56240_B0 As per the data sheet, Saber supports 2K Egress Flex Counter Table size, where as the support in SDK was only for 1K table size even though the device supported the same. Fix has been added to support 2k Egress Flex Counter Table size.
SDK-60443 88650_A0 88650_B0 88650_B1 88660_A0 VLAN Port: The API bcm_vlan_port_find() returns information regarding a VLAN-Port that was either supplied by a gport in the vlan_port_id field or by entering the fields that are essential for the match: criteria, port, match_vlan etc. The API, in the mode where vlan_port_id was supplied, was failing non-local gports for the device. After the fix, the API accepts non-local gports and returns all the locally available information. Some field values that aren't available on a remote device, such as protection fields, won't reflect the values in the device where the gport resides.
SDK-60978 811047 88650_B1 In previous releases, an rx reset or full reset with traffic running in ingress could cause persistent PFC XOFF and result in a traffic outage. This was due to the reset causing the pause mechanism not to configure properly and incorrect pause frames being transmitted. This has been solved by correcting the soft init sequence.
SDK-61030 822480 All soc_shutdown now uses spinlocks for working in multi processor environment, and dpc_disable is called after disabling all the interrupts. This prevents intermittent crashes in the DPC thread during soc_shutdown.
SDK-61166 823916 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 12 lanes of 100G are used to check the prbs status including 2 unused lane which always returned failed even though the 10 active lnased prbs status were OK. Added the fix to use 10 active lanes for prbs status checking for 100G
SDK-61249 88650_A0 88660_A0 88670_A0 In TCAM memory, a mechanism for identifying and fixing SER errors in the TCAM exists, which handles an error upon SER occurrence, identifies the location of the error and according to TCAM bank owner, reproduces the TCAM entry from software database and rewrites it to TCAM memory. This mechanism is not supported for TCAM banks that are owned by VT or TT blocks. This is fixed.
SDK-61576 88660_A0 BFD: Allow BFD endpoints of type IP over MPLS by default for BCM88660.
SDK-61860 831533 88650_A0 In MAC-In-MAC, fixed a bug of access to non existing register fields in ARAD_A0.
SDK-61897 823047 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 Support has been added to allow the configuration of 20G oversubscription ports in a valid flex port application.
SDK-61902 56334_B0 56334_A0 In previous releases, linkscan would not enable the MAC which would result in traffic being blocked on the port.

Logic has been added to check whether the MAC is enabled in the port update routine. If the MAC is disabled, the port update routine will enable the MAC.

SDK-62156 797863 56750_A0 56750_A2 56755_A0 In the previous release, the API bcm_multicast_init didn't clear L2MC table and L2 addr table. In this release, this issue has been addressed by clearing them in the API.
SDK-62199 827548 56634_B0 In previous releases, the protection group failed to work when the failover id was 0x18000001. This was because in the mpls failover vp group check, vp group 1 was not included as valid failover vp. This has been corrected by including vp 1 as valid failover group.
SDK-62229 825199 56640_B0 For Triumph3 EXTERNAL STAGE, L3Routable will be determined by considering MY_STATION_HIT, FORWARDING_TYPE & L3_IIF_VALID bits. To qualify a packet on L3Routable add qualifiers MyStationHit, ForwardingType & L3Routable to the group and configure an entry with the following values: L3Routable data =0x1 mask=0x1 ForwardingType data=0x2 (bcmFieldForwardingTypeL3) MyStationHit data=0x1 mask=0x1
SDK-62285 822442 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 All In previous releases, the return values of _bcm_vp_used_get were not completely checked. This has been fixed by checking all the return values of _bcm_vp_used_get.
SDK-62286 799554 56540_A0 56540_B0 56541_A0 56541_B0 56542_A0 56542_B0 56544_A0 56544_B0 56545_A0 56545_A1 56545_B0 56546_A0 56546_B0 56547_A0 56548_A0 Fixed a number of issues in the KNET driver which could lead to occasional delayed Rx packets.
SDK-62414 88650_A0 bcm_l3_egress_traverse() will now fill the bcm_l3_egress_t passed to the callback correctly
SDK-62465 88670_A0 L3: Added support to carry EEI information of service label from FEC using bcm_l3_egress_create api with egress label properties.
SDK-62743 834109 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 All In earlier releases, UDF hashing was not supported. This will now be supported by adding a set of APIs to enable/disable UDF hashing and configure UDF hashing properties.
SDK-62751 SDK-71279 825343 56440_A1 56440_B0 All On KATANA devices, L2 MAC address learning would not work after Warmboot. This occurred because L0, L1 and L2 scheduler bit maps of MMU CosQ were not retrieved during Warmboot. Code has been added to retrieve L0, L1 and L2 scheduler bitmaps during Warmboot.
SDK-62757 838601 54282_A0 54282_C0 54282_C1 54382_B0 54382_C0 54382_C1 In previous releases, the API bcm_port_phy_control_get would return the wrong value for BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_EEE_AUTO_FIXED_LATENCY. This has been corrected with the parameters TRUE(1) for fixed latency and FALSE(0) for variable latency.
SDK-62784 838583 56450_A0 Problem Statement: In earlier release, all L0 nodes were not usable , even when Linkphy was not enabled.

In this release s1_scheduler and s0_scheduler are set to 0 when linkphy is not enabled, so that all L0 can be used.

SDK-62866 813901 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 When an IPFIX interrupt was generated, it was observed the interrupt was received after the disabling the interrupt, The overflow and timeout were not being checked and disabled if enabled. Logic has been added to check and disable the overflow and timeout if enabled before processing the IPFIX interrupt.
SDK-63079 837938 56960_A0 Added MBIST support (TR 147) for Tomahawk SDK.
SDK-63101 835936 56640_A0 After Warmboot, the entry 0 of table ING_L3_NEXT_HOP_ATTRIBUTE_1 wouldn't successfully recover when parity error injected. This was caused by the valid bit map associated with this entry being cleared during Warmboot. This issue has been fixed and now the valid bit map of a entry in the software cache is not cleared when Warmboot is in progress.
SDK-63103 839828 56640_B0 The MPLS_ENTRY table did not recover after Warmboot. This would occur because the MPLS_ENTRY and MPLS_ENTRY_EXTD overlapped. In this release, the MPLS_ENTRY and MPLS_ENTRY_EXTD have been added to the overlapped memory list to solve the problem.
SDK-63107 841019 56440_A0 56440_A1 56440_B0 In this release, a redundant code segment in function _phy_xgxs16g_control_tx_driver_set() has been removed.
SDK-63112 827173 All Very long CINT scripts would exhaust memory resources. This was due to an internal function that declares and initializes variables would not release local objects immediately after their use. Though all objects were released at the end of the loop, during loop iterations there was increasing demand of RSS pages for the running process. A fix has been made to release these local objects as soon as their use is complete.
SDK-63134 88660_A0 Added support for string based MAID with format: 0x04 <MD Len> <5 bytes MD> 0x02 <MA Len> <6 bytes MA>

To use this format, set soc property oam_maid_11_bytes_enable=1 and call field_oam_advanced_features() cint function.

An example for this can be found in oam_example function in cint_oam.c

SDK-63143 88650_B1 88660_A0 In earlier releases an error happened when the user get/set RIF in High VSI mode for some special services, which was caused by using an incorrect register in programming sequence . This has been resolved by modifying the register mapping between VSI and RIF, such that the user can set/get RIF correctly in High VSI mode.
SDK-63395 843778 56340_A0 An invalid peak temperature value was printed when "show temp" was performed. This issue was due to an incorrect initialization sequence for the temperature monitor. This has been corrected by rearranging the initialization sequence.
SDK-63433 88650_A0 88660_A0 In large exact match table, HW accelerated traverse operations were not functional when EM shadow is enabled. This is fixed.
SDK-63539 56440_B0 In the previous release the linkscan mode variables were incorrectly documented as BCM_PORT_LINKSCAN_SW BCM_PORT_LINKSCAN_HW BCM_PORT_LINKSCAN_NONE The documentation has now been corrected with the following variables respectively. BCM_LINKSCAN_MODE_SW BCM_LINKSCAN_MODE_HW BCM_LINKSCAN_MODE_NONE
SDK-63552 811881 88650_A0 88660_A0 Allow ingress discard per In-LIF. The discard enable/disable is available via bcm_port_discard_set() for the specified In-LIF and the desired mode value. The mode value can now support BCM_PORT_DISCARD_INGRESS, while BCM_PORT_DISCARD_NONE removes the discard. Note: The available mode values effect both the In-LIF and the Out-LIF whenever a new mode value is set. bcm_port_discard_get() now supports the modified values for the mode field.
SDK-63560 88670_A0 OAM: New 88670 OAM diagnostics: 1) diag oam id: shows the OAM -ID of the last recieved OAM packet. 2) diag oam count oamp: Shows the number of recieved/transmitted packets by the OAMP. 3) diag oam prge: shows all loaded OAM PRGE programs. 4)diag oam prge last=1 shows the last run OAM PRGE program.
SDK-63633 843722 56850_A2 56850_A0 56850_A1 In earlier release, default setting of bcmSwitchEntropyHashSet0Offset was concatenated mode, and there was no way to modify it. This has been fixed by making default as non-concatenated mode, and letting bcmSwitchEntropyHashSet0Offset modify it.
SDK-63663 54680_A0 54680E_B0 Traffic was not looped back during PHY Loopback. This has been corrected and now MII Control Register ( internal loopback) is asserted for any device when PHY loopback is set.
SDK-63734 808883 88660_A0 In MAC table, traverse action with mask was not returning all the required entries. The traverse code was treating filtered out entries as if they are entered to the result buffer. This is fixed and MACT traverse action now returns proper entries.
SDK-63755 832108 88660_A0 Added support for IPv6 SAV and IPv6 address compression. The result of IPv6 address compression can be qualified by PMF entries. The following two soc properties are introduced to enable/disable above function: 1.custom_feature_l3_source_bind 2.custom_feature_ip6_compression_enable
SDK-63853 56850_A2 In previous releases, bcm_switch_hash_entry_remove/bcm_switch_hash_entry_destroy behaved the same. They both removed entry from the hardware tables and destroyed flex hash entry. The behaviors have been corrected according to API reference guide. bcm_switch_hash_entry_remove will only delete hardware table entry. Software table entry will be deleted by bcm_switch_hash_entry_destroy.
SDK-63891 847002 88650_B1 88660_A0 In Parser, some Parsing Macros were configured to mark packets with PLC/PFC 0x00 upon stopping following a parsing error, causing issues in subsequent blocks. Macros are now configured to fail-back to the calling Macro PLC/PFC values in case of a parsing error.
SDK-63900 846993 88650_B1 88660_A0 IPMC RP: Fixed flush mechanism for rendezvous point(rp) in ipmc-bidir database. Now 'bcm_ipmc_rp_get' can distinguish between different rp and return only configured interfaces according rp_id.
SDK-63928 845982 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 In earlier releases the MMU_WRED_CONFIG entry index was not right, which then caused ser to not correct the expected entry. Code has been changed to correct the entry index, ser can use cache restore to correct the MMU_WRED_CONFIG entry.
SDK-63979 846217 56840_A0 In previous releases, the UDF Group creation was order dependent. In this release the order of chunk allocation has been changed. When more than 4 chunks are required for a qualifier, UDF2 is given priority over UDF1.
SDK-63984 845383 56450_B1 56450_A0 56450_B0 On BCM5645x devices, support has been added for extended CLI port command with option 'detail' to print software and hardware port configuration in addition to basic port status.
SDK-64003 848452 56640_A0 56640_A1 56640_B0 56643_A1 For Triumph3 devices, ESM was not working for IPv6 ACL Short and IPv6 ACL Full modes. To address this problem, the following issues have been fixed: 1. Number of searches required for IP6S_ONLY partition in LTR was programmed as 2 but should be 1 since only ACL partition needs to be searched. 2. Field mapper to key id entries for IP6SONLY & IP6FONLY tables were incorrectly programmed for number of Key responses expected. Only ACL response (KEY_GEN_RSP_TYPE_ACL) was expected. 3. 480bit partitions in SW were mapped to 640bit partition in external TCAM. To support 480bit, upper two 80bit portions of all 640bit entries in TCAM need to have a valid bit set along with data and mask set to 0. Valid bit was not set causing 640bit search to fail. All of these issues have been addressed in this release.
SDK-64043 849712 56540_A0 56545_A0 56640_A0 On a 56640, the DO_NOT_LEARN_MACSA bit would not be set when the bcm_l2_cache_set() API was called with the BCM_L2_CACHE_LEARN_DISABLE flag. Support has been added to handle the BCM_L2_CACHE_LEARN_DISABLE flag for the bcm_l2_cache_set() API.
SDK-64142 SDK-64914 849803 56450_A0 56450_B0 In previous releases, retrieving the index of the child node was based on the assumption that the child indexes were allocated contiguously. For nodes with WRR scheduling mode, this was not true. The SDK has been corrected to retrieve the index directly instead of the present base + offset method.
SDK-64144 849036 56640_A0 In earlier releases, when there was only ext_l2_fwd_table configured for triumph3, if external tcams were used to learn L2 address, the learning messages would be sent to L2_MOD_FIFO repeatedly. In this release, the same L2 address is reported to L2_MOD_FIFO only once if it is already in the external tcam.
SDK-64182 850934 56450_A0 56450_B1 56450_B0 In earlier releases, the xgxs16g1l driver did not support Hardware LOS solution. In this release, the SOC property "serdes_rx_los " has been implemented in Katana2. This will enable "signal_detect_en" and "invert_signal_detect" in register 0x8300.
SDK-64196 851179 56450_A0 56450_B0 The ING_L3_NEXT_HOP table extended queue info could not be cleared when extended queue was created in explicit extended queue mode. This issue has been corrected. In an mpls configuration ING_L3_NEXT_HOP, qtag and tag_type will change to 0 in ing_l3_next_hop memory when per_flow_queue_base is 0.
SDK-64222 56340_A0 56640_B0 Upon VCO change on warpcore block, all member ports of particular warpcore block should be hard reset. Earlier ports were soft reset. Changes are made to hard reset the warpcore member ports in this release.
SDK-64270 88650_A0 88650_B0 memory error initiation mechanism fix: memory protection mechanism disabled for the following memories: IRR_SNOOP_MIRROR_DEST_TABLE IRR_SNOOP_MIRROR_TABLE_0 IRR_SNOOP_MIRROR_TABLE_1 IRE_NIF_PORT_TO_CTXT_BIT_MAP These tables are not protected by parity error detection mechanism by HW. Upon initiating error for these tables, incorrect memory error indication passed to the bcm driver and wrong memory entry correction take place. Therefore, BCM SDK disables the parity protection mechanism for them. Note, This fix applies only for memory error initiation mechanism. These memories are not causing parity error event.
SDK-64290 843249 56634_A0 56634_B0 In 56634 the "l3 l3table add vrf=0 ip=172.16.95.9 mac=00:04:DF:13:6E:99 Trunk=32" would process into a check that TRUNK num was restricted under 32 , so this command failed ; Now TRUNK num will not enter this inappropriate check and "l3 l3table add vrf=0 ip=172.16.95.9 mac=00:04:DF:13:6E:99 Trunk=32" is OK .
SDK-64335 852089 56524_A0 In previous releases, the bcm_vlan_stat_get32() API would return an incorrect value in a multi-unit system. In this release the global variable _bcm_flex_stat_buff_toggle has been converted to unit based in order to support multi-chip systems.
SDK-64352 816473 56450_A0 56450_B0 On Katana2, traffic would not function properly on ports at 100Mbps. This was due to the ports not being able to operate in independent channel mode while in asymmetric speed mode.

This has been fixed by enabling Lane mode for ports in asymmetric speed mode at speeds less than or equal to 1G.

SDK-64388 851969 56850_A0 In a warpcore when the encapsulation of an xe port changed to higig, it caused the other three ports to change to 11G. This resulted in a reset to the core and link-down for the other three ports. This issue has been fixed. Now the config variable "port_max_speed" is used to overwrite the default HG speed. In order to reset the core, set the "port_max_speed" as 10G explicitly in the config.bcm. To switch HG at 11G, set 11G explicitly using port_speed_set API/command or remove "port_max_speed" from config.bcm.
SDK-64391 56850_A0 56850_A1 56850_A2 In previous releases, the element numbers of the local array mask_entries changed from 128 to 256 resulteding in a stack overflow in TD2. This issue has been fixed in this release via allocating heap memory instead of stack memory for mask_entries.
SDK-64426 56450_B0 When single_wide was used the reference count at index would be incremented. When double_wide, the reference count at index and index+1 was incremented. The presence of ecmp group was checked only at index and updating reference count at index.

It is incorrect to update the count only at index when Katana2 is in double_wide mode. Index and Index+1 should be updated similar to _bcm_xgs3_ecmp_group_add/bcm_xgs3_ecmp_group_del.

In this release BCM_XGS3_L3_MAX_ECMP_MODE(unit) ? _BCM_SINGLE_WIDE : _BCM_DOUBLE_WIDE have been added for updating reference count in functions wherever single_wide is being used and the flag is BCM_L3_MULTIPATH (ecmp).

SDK-64471 847082 56540_B0 In previous releases, the SDK would create two sets of DiffServ queues in the process of attaching a service queue. This has been fixed so that ports do not reuse indexes.
SDK-64501 851696 56640_B0 On TRUMPH3, when adding an L2 entry with group size greater than 63 an error was returned even though the supported number of groups was 1024. This was caused by the l2 table entry group incorrectly using 63(6 bits) instead of 1024(10bits). This has been corrected to use a size of 10bits for the group field of the l2 table entry.
SDK-64519 88660_A0 OAM: In case EVC filtering is enabled outgoing DM packets are corrupted.
SDK-64562 853905 56960_A0 This is a query on whether SDK 6.4.3 supports preselection.

SDK 6.4.3 will have only legacy FP support. It doesn't support multiple keygen profile for a logical table. This support is coming in phase-2.

SDK-64650 854677 56450_B1 56450_A0 56450_B0 For 5645x devices, the ports that were not linked up before Warmboot, were not able to transmit post Warmboot even if the ports were later linked up. The root cause for the issue was support didn't exist to update the linkscan bitmaps for the ports that were linked up post Warmboot. Support for Katana2 linkscan pbmp and bmap update has been added.
